title: Beautiful boating lake
review: Enjoyed boating in the lake with nice views around, though the Swatchata could be better. Could watch ducks , crane in the lake.

title: Just a lake
review: I understand the history behind tbis artificial lake, but at the end of the day it is just an average lake.

title: Amazing boat ride
review: We enjoyed a very nice boat ride in the lake...beautiful scenery with birds flying around and calmness around

title: Was OK, few good spots for photography
review: Didn't excite much, few tepid boats on a lake. There are few pagodas on the lake where one cake take nice portrait photos..

title: Historical Lake
review: The Gadsisar talab (Lake) jaisalmer built by Raja Rawal Jaisal, is one of the most famous tourist places in Jaisalmer This historic lake is located towards the south of Jaisalmer. DOP 08.03.2019

title: Lake in Desert City
review: The Lake looks lovely in the evening or when the sun is shining bright. It is very close to the Fort and fairly approachable.

title: Good for photography
review: The place is a decent place but could be better maintained in terms of cleanliness and beauty. But still what is there is good but should be visited it the morning or evening. Avoid visiting in the afternoon as the sun gets overheated and hot. There are plenty of composition possibilities for photography.

title: Ordinary lake
review: If you are in the area, this lake is definitely a place where you can take a few minutes to take pictures. Apart from this, it is an ordinary lake, which needs to be clean and maintained.

title: For sun rise
review: Not one of t

title: Lakeview
review: Amazing view ..but its dirty everywhere no place to sit & boat ride are expensive , near to the golden fort so you can explore both place

title: Man Made Lake
review: Its a small lake has bating options but not kept well , its quite nice but dirty , good to see place .

title: Nice place
review: The lake is nice, you can rent a little boat and make a tour of the lake. For sure something to see in Jaisalmer.

title: A beautiful lake spoiled by man
review: It is a very nice lake to view with old monumental structures all around and within the lake. But other than taking a few photos nothing can be done at the lake as it is very poorly maintained. The water is stinking with waste dumped in the water. There is no boating or any other recreational activities.

title: Family visit
review: A nice picnic spot for rest and refreshing. There is a small Siva temple with nice arch. One can go boating also

title: Beautiful views!
review: Myself and my parter went by bike today and had a beautiful day! The site was really gorgeous and the archetechture was stunning.

title: Lake view.
review: Beautiful lake.Good boating and the old Shiv tempel.Like the old buildings of ancient time.Nice place for visit specially small kids enjoy the boating.

title: Ok but .....
review: Ok but nothing special.

title: A bit grubby, but worth visiting
review: Rather atmospheric in the late afternoon with sun past its peak. Can get some good photos. Lake suffers somewhat from rubbish and unspecified creatures in the water. Not sure what they were, but rats is my suspicion.

title: Evening boat ride!
review: Go for a relaxing boat ride in this lake take pictures along the way and that’s all. The water is shallow so avoid the corners if you pedaling.

title: Overcrowded
review: When we visited in Jan first week it was jam packed with tourists and it was a big mela. The lake would have looked more beautiful if it was managed well.

title: Nice place
review: Nice place. Not much crowded. Good for photography. No entry fees. One can do boating also. Its chargeable.

title: Beautiful lake
review: A very pretty lake where it is fun to go boating and take pictures with the lovely background of Rajasthani structures of the yore.

title: GADISAR LAKE
review: The Gadisar Lake was constructed by Raja Rawal Jaisal, the first ruler of Jaisalmer and later reconstructed by Maharawal Gadsi Singh in the year 1367 AD. It is said this rain water lake once provided water to the entire town. At present Gadisar Lake gets water from Indira Gandhi Canal so it never dries. Located towards the south of Jaisalmer city, the entrance to the Gadisar Lake is through a magnificent and artistically carved yellow sandstone archway that is known as the Tilon-Ki-Pol. There are numerous shrines and small temples on the embankment of this lake. The most popular among these temples is the Krishna Temple which houses a statue of Lord Vishnu. There is a big domed pavilion in the center of the lake. The main attractions of the lake are the different species of birds, which migrate from distinct places.

title: Just a Photo stop
review: The lake was one of the main water sources from old Times, rain water being the source. Now it’s a tourist destination with local seen going for boat trips. We just stopped by on the way to airport for a photo click.

title: An average lake side view
review: The lake is good and have nice sand stone structure around it. But the structures are not well maintained. The good thing is there is no entry fee only boat rides are chargeable.

title: 5 min stop
review: Bit of a waste of time.  If you are in the area call in but there is rubbish everywhere and big queues for the boat.  It's a bit of a tourist trap

title: Tourist trap
review: Whilst the settings is very nice it would definitely be enhanced by removing all the rubbish from the lake, cleaning the seating areas of dog poo so one could sit and enjoy  the view.

title: Most famous place
review: This Lake is one of the most famous tourist places in Jaisalmer. This lake was built by Raja Rawal Jaisal. Surrounding by nice view.

title: Beautiful Lake But Neglected
review: Its a beautiful lake where one can spend a very pleasant evening. Unfortunately, the whole lake area is very poorly maintained, filth and katchra is lying at number of places around the lake.

title: Beautiful historical lake
review: It's a beautiful lake with historical buildings in yellow sandstone spread across. The birds are also beautiful here. There are both self pedal and rowing boats available here. The lake is not very big and hence the boat round is just for 15 minutes. It's only heartbreaking to see plastic line up the lake and birds feeding on it. Unfortunately that's the sad story of most places in India and weird how most people turn a blind eye to it.

title: Nice recreation
review: Since not much to do in the small town if u Hv time ,do try out the boat ride in the lake. U can row or paddle or get someone to paddle at an extra cost . The Shiv mandir right beside is a must visit.. A rare depiction of Shivji in a very different pose

title: Catfish!!
review: This lake is filled with catfish, all of which jostle for scraps when thrown in the water. The water itself does not look like it would pass any health and safety test but it is old. The structures themselves were quite Indian. But the fish were too captivating!!

title: Could do with some maintenance!
review: The lake in itself was quite enchanting, even though I wish I went at a better time. However the surrounding areas near it left a lot to be desired especially the lack of cleanliness. If we want to promote our tourist attractions, we must spent some more effort on keeping them clean. Too much plastic and food items lying all over the place.

title: Good for boat ride
review: It was the lifeline of Jaisalmer with the only source of water. Lake boating has options of self as well as paddle boating.  Water seems dirty and not so clean. Good to go for boating in the evening.

title: Must do...
review: Do visit this lake when you are in Jaisalmer. A serene lake. Good place to click some Pictures with your dear ones. U can also enjoy Boating at minimal cost. I paid 100rs for A couple Boat ride. Try to visit in morning or evening if possible as u may feel the heat in afternoon.

title: Awesome Rajasthan
review: One evening is must for spending in Gadisar Lake if you are in Jaisalmer. Seeing sunset with friends while boating was just amazing.

title: Absolutely beautiful
review: must go there around sunset.its so calm and peaceful and serene  and a photographers delight to see the sunlight fall on the banks of the lake

title: Would like to visit again and again
review: Very calm and peaceful place. One of my favourite places of Jaisalmer. Rowing and paddle boat is really fun. Visit during winter to avoid heat waves

title: Nothing special
review: Really nothing special. Only a lake which is pretty dirty and small. Not advised to go if you do not have tons of extra time

title: Beautiful but...,
review: This is a beautiful lake in Jaisalmer, but could be done by the government to clean it up and make it more tourist friendly.

title: Good
review: The boating in gadisar Lake was a good experience. Its cheap and refreshing there's also a temple nearby. Overall, gadisar Lake isn't special but do visit if you visit Jaisalmer..

title: Neglected
review: Visited on a rainy day which didn't enhance  the experience. Much of the surrounding fore shore is covered in rubbish and the buildings are very much neglected.

title: 1km away from jaisalmer fort
review: Near to jaisalmer fort.  Pedal boating is available.  Can spend 20-30 min according to your interest.  Can park your park for free,  outside of the entrance. Not so crowded when we were there

title: Very ordinary lake
review: I think it is a very ordinary lake.you can find such lakes near you cities as well. You can visit this lake if ample time is  available.

title: Gadiskar Lake in Jaisalmer
review: Not a good place.It is not a lake, it is just like a pond.Near this place, cleanliness is also not good.

title: Gadisagar lake
review: The Gadsisar Lake was built by Raja Rawal Jaisal, the first ruler of Jaisalmer. In the later years Maharaja Garisisar Singh rebuilt and revamped the lake. The entrance to the lake is through Tilon-Ki-Pol, a magnificent and artistically carved yellow sandstone archway, Lake is good for boating, sunset view, bird photography.

title: Misty morning visit
review: A gorgeous place on a lake. I watched in awe as the mist dispersed and revealed the golden pavilions on and beside the water. Great photo op! Recommended.

title: River in desert
review: A huge river in jaisalmer which is city of desert... offer different type of boating with minimal charge.good quality of food shop is also available

title: DIRTY LAKE
review: Though, it is a big lake but the Management has not given any attention about its cleanness . It is very dirty and most of the tourists were voting in the lake.

title: Gadaisar lake
review: The lake is located in the heart of the city. But ill maintained lake. Water is very dirty. Only saving grace is boating facility here.  A place you don't like to visit for the second time.

title: Good for a leisure visit
review: It's a great place to simply sit by the lake steps or paddle boating in the lake and savour the view. Many birds flock to the lake in winters and if you are lucky you can spot some rare birds too. We managed to spot a kingfisher! :)

title: Beautiful lake
review: Gadisar lake, is an man-made water reservoir .it was the only source of water in jaisalmer, constructed by the first ruler of jaisalmer,raja rawal jaisalmer. It is surrounded by temples and ghats. It's an beautiful place to visit. I would suggest you to do boating there during sunset. Boating charges are Rs. 50 per person, if you choose to peddle it yourself. You can also go to the other side of lake, if you want to spend some time in peace.

title: Clean and clear
review: Picturesque lake and a lovely carved arched mount to view and take good pictures..the folk singer added to the beauty

title: Average
review: The place is a bit of a let down. While there exist the hallmarks of a majestic lake that could have potentially become the centre point of this city apart from the fort, what eventually plays down is a beautiful lake and trademark golden stone monuments all run over by poor maintenance and the uncaring tourists and government apathy. Hawkers will try and pester you. Guides will try and pester you. Commerce is the centre point of tourism but this a rather sad path to take. Visit you must for it is part of this grand old city.

title: Giant bats
review: Two cool things about this place. 1.) It was financed by a prostitute who wanted to leave something beautiful behind. 2) One of the trees on the lake is FULL of GIANT bats that are fun to watch and very active, even during the day.

title: Not that great
review: Its dirty, crowded with boats. Go early morning when there is less crowd for photography. Nothing special here

title: Worth a quick peddle
review: Went out on the water in a pedal boat for an hour for 400 rupees and it was an okay thing to do. It won’t matter if you skip it but you know if you have extra time to kill and it’s a nice day then it’s okay for a chill out on the water.

title: Not a Mandatory Place to Visit
review: A quick google search tells Gadisasar Sagar Lake is one of the top places to visit in Jaisalmer. But I don't find it that nice. There isn't much to see in terms of old buildings. Moreover, lake was very dirty.

title: Lake in Jaisalmer
review: It’s an ok place to visit as I didn’t find place that much meat n clean and if you can avoid it there will no harm in the same.. Only boating is the attraction in this place.

title: Nice place for boating
review: Nice place for boating between places of historical importance..kids enjoyed it..good to spend sun set time..

title: Don't waste your time here
review: Dirty lake and surroundings are even dirtier.

title: Filthy lake
review: Considering Jaisalmer being one of the main tourist attractions, this lake is so badly maintained. City drainage is connected to this lake.

title: Serene boating
review: Had  a late evening boating in the lake. Don't look at the water but look at the surrounding and the splendour of old architecture and the hingula temple.

title: Not crowded, nice for photoshoot
review: The history related to its creation is very fascinating. Very close to the Railway station. Nice place to stroll and have photoshoot. Not much activity to do here.

title: Nice place for evening
review: Catch out this location after 3 pm which is the best time to visit this lake and, where you can explore so many things. You can ride a boat and can be witness of sunset as well.

title: It’s nice
review: It’s nice, if you stopped there for a short moment. There’re burglars at the entrance. The water quality is very poor. The stairs are very steep. At the parking, It’s full with litter, cow poop, cows.

title: Small and beautiful lake in Jaisalmer
review: Worth visiting and taking a short boat ride . The boat rowers are very much talented and friendly and make sure you have a good time. Boat ride is of Half an hour. Pedal boats are also available . Visit during sunset for the best experience.

title: Beautifully embellished desert lake
review: Originally built by the early rulers as a source of water for residents around this area for household needs.  This pretty waterbody with its own structures to meet the needs of travellers has become a tourist attraction.

title: Yes...but
review: Lovely lake with some wonderful buildings. Also a lot of work is going into extending the ghats. However, plastic boats like blue swans, the usual litter and swarms of noisy local tourists make this a less peaceful or restful experience than it could be. Some interesting water birds like kingfisher but a lot scared off.

title: Gadisar Lake
review: Lake where you can enjoy paid boating for half an hour for RS 50 per person in even numbers mutiples...

title: A dry lake
review: I won't consider this as a pure attraction. This place is dried up. The sun disappeared behind the trees and not a proper sunset view. Not very clean as well.

title: Nice place requires good administrators
review: The sagar in old time was a pure source of drinking water , but now activities of visitors and boating that purpose is lost .. it has beautiful structures in water and can be approached by boat ..!parking needs lot of improvement.

title: One time activity
review: Nice lake but very crowded due to tourist season. Parking is bit of issue. You can use pedal boats or take help of normal boat to go around the lake and enjoy the scenic beauty. Afternoon can be very hot. Recommend morning or evening.

title: Disappointed
review: Place is very dirty. Don’t know what else to say about this place. It was waste of time. If they clean this place it can become a beautiful place to visit

title: Dirty lake with good sunset experience
review: This lake offers a good sunset point where you can enjoy the view while paddling around in a boat with your family and loved ones. This place is located 2 kms from Jaisalmer Fort.

title: Reasonably maintained
review: It’s a reasonably well maintained lake , if in Jaiselmer do visit the lake . There is boating available .

title: Jaisalmer - Gadisar or Gadsisar lake
review: Gadsisar Lake is located near Tillon ki Gate, Jaisalmer. Gadsisar lake is a must visit site in Jaisalmer, Rajasthan which is within city limit. Gadsisar Lake was a water conversation tank built in 1367 AD, and was constructed under the reign of Maharwal Gadsi Singh. If a traveler wants to enjoy bird watching on their tour to Jaisalmer, then Gadsisar lake is the right place to be. A Krishna Temple is located by the side of the archway. You can also relinquish the fun of feeding fish which gathers around the lake side. You can also enjoy boating ride in the lake from 8 AM till 8 PM. Boat ride charges range from 10 rupees for row boat to 100 rupees for Shikara for 30 mins. If you are not up for boating then you can cover the place in 1 hour. No entry fee. It is a beautiful photographic location but if you taking your kid, then stroller would not be a good idea. Sunset would be a good time to visit the place.

title: Welcome to Jaisalmer
review: Nice fort....but over crowded in season.....nice museum.....families living in the fort premises.....market in entire fort....but items r costly

title: Man made lake
review: It was build by raja in Jaisalmer to provide drinking water to the city. the water is not used for drinking anymore but it's a nice place to sit by the lake at evening or morning and enjoy boating if you are travelling with kids.Good for photography especially pre wedding kind of shoots.

title: Just loved it
review: The lake is a gem in the beautiful city the approach the monuments around the lake the boating experience the birds in and around the lake the sunset from the lake all are breathtaking.visited twice in three days boating pedal and rowing neither a boat man are available for Rs 300 for half an hour  a ten seater boat for Rs 500  for half an hour from 8 am to 8 pm

title: Not well maintained
review: Lake is ok but not maintained well.It's pathetic to see dirt all around.People are taking boat ride but with no life saving jackets provided to them.

title: Pretty small and dirty
review: Quite disappointing, the area was packed full of people and the water was green and dirty. We did the pedal boating which you could hire for 30 minutes, however, the lake was rather small so you could cover the periphery of the lake in 10 minutes. We were whistled at whenever we approached something interesting. A skippable experience.

title: Very small lake
review: This lake is located very  near to Jaisalmer fort. This is small lake . You can enjoy boating in this lake. Nice to visit.

title: Average experience, can spend some good time in the evening
review: You can probably hang out there in the evening and spend some good time with your friends and family. Apart from that the lake does not offer much to tourists in terms of activities and attractions.

title: Good palce for sunset
review: Near to fort. 100 ₹ per 2 seater boat for 30 mins. Good to do in evening. Sunset is preety from here.

title: Nice location
review: I enjoyed spending a little time here.  Just outside of the city. Vendors selling crafts, etc. seemed cheaper than in city proper.

title: Superb place
review: This is awesome lake with boating facility.

title: Avoid in cold evenings
review: Average experience - good to see so much water in a desert area. But otherwise regular lake like any other.

title: Beautiful reservoir lake!
review: Visited here twice, both around the time of sunset. It's a beautiful place  - I felt transported back in time as the buildings are so old and carved from sandstone, and the place is really very peaceful despite being a maiin tourist attraction in Jaisalmer - because there aren't that many tourists anyway. Took a boat ride one evening and it was good fun, a great way to see the lake from a different perspective. The lake is scattered with buildings within it that were the old platform for the royalty and performers. The second time we walked along the steps round to the undeveloped side of the lake where there's a very small temple (with a very friendly priest). This was the most amazing spot to watch sunset from, as prayers began immediately after the sun had set. But all along the steps give you a great view, no matter the time of the day.

title: Great Views during Sunset
review: Ideally, citizens should ensure that all water bodies should be maintained well. But unfortunately we dont. Great views in the evening. Good spot for photography enthusiasts. 1 km from the back side of Jaisalmer fort.

title: Early Mornings is the best time to visit Gadisar Lake
review: This beautiful Lake is a very pretty lake in Jaisalmer however i was very disappointed to see so much dirt and garbage on the shore of the Lake.

title: Must visit place relaxing
review: Small lake but relaxing and beautiful. Spend some time and take snaps in Rajasthan attire

title: nice lake nothing special
review: the lake is just a few minutes walk outside the city of Jaisalmer; nice to visit with some good views to the city, the fort and you can rent boats for a small amount.

title: Beautiful lake and awesome view
review: It's a Beautiful lake and awesome view. Can do nice photography and spend decent time. Can visit once if you going there.

title: Peaceful place
review: A peaceful lake with picturesque landscape  u cud enjoy boating here followed by puppet show done by local people n dun forget to listen an old man singing local song on way to lake which is quite entertaining

title: Poorly managed
review: This is a typical example of how a pretty lake can be mismanaged with unclean area, no proper signage and management of crowd, poorly managed boat ride. Thumbs down for local municipal corporation

title: Not very interesting
review: This lake was pretty much a waste of time from our point of view. There were some paddle boats for hire though I can't imagine why anyone would want to do that. There were no birds of interest and you really can't go for a walk anywhere. We sat there for a short while then left.

title: A tick mark in the City Tour
review: Travelling to Jaisalmer then Gadisar Lake is being stated as one of the most places visited by Tourists after Fort and hence every traveller has to visit as a check mark in the itenary. This is the only lake in Jaisalmer and has very  good sunset views. It has dedicated parking lot, shopping lane and of course the lake where one can try boating as this is the only water sports kind of thing available at the place. Lake needs some cleaning as well. Visitors may also want to try the puppet show at extra cost but that is just ones choice.

title: Good place for peace
review: This place is very near to Jaisalmer fort, must visit in evening. You will find many pigeons near lake. This place is in city, but very peaceful. Loved the beauty of lake and architecture. You can also enjoy boating with family.

title: Imagination needed
review: Heard stories about this lake.

title: Good place for boating
review: We visited lake during morning hours as during afternoon it really gets hot even in the month of November. They have both paddle as well as attendant boats.

title: Lake View
review: gadisar Lake is very good place to spend evening. You can do boating. It has good fort view and sunset watching points. you can buy many things at reasonable price. Very good Panipuri

title: Not much to see
review: Just a dirty man made lake with the usual garbage on the shore. Lots of children begging and singing.   More tourist junk to buy.   Can certainly skip but there isn’t much else to see in Jaisalmar

title: Good feel
review: A good view which offers boating and has a good view and feel. The best time to visit will be during the sunset, the view is surreal.

title: Wonderful mistic lake
review: This lake is very mistic and inspired.

title: Recommended only for photography
review: There is nothing much but a small lake offering a paddle boat ride.

title: Lake with unmanaged places and deteriorating history
review: we visited in evening around 7.30 pm and also did boating. It is better to visit during daytime.

title: Extremely crowded, long queues for boating in the evening
review: We went in the late evening, was extremely crowded. Lot of chaos on the boating queue, almost a wait time of 1 hour. We spent some 15 minutes and dropped the idea of boating in the dark. Didn't get a pleasant feel at all, may be the timing was wrong.

title: OK to visit
review: This is the only good place to visit in Jaisalmer. Patwan ki Haveli and fort are let down things in town and not worth to spend time and money. Better to enjoy 2 hours around lake and watch evening puppet show. Apart from these there is nothing to see in Jaisalmer town.

title: Okay-ish.
review: It's pretty and all but it's not all that. It's decent, you should go visit just for the sake of it and since you're there, other than that, it's just okay.

title: Can take some pictures in the background
review: We stopped and visited this lake and took few pictures! I guess there is boating but we didn’t have time and it was approaching lunch hour. If u want to take photos with Rajasthani dress shops r available.

title: Nice
review: Nice lake can be visited if spending time in Jaisalmer city.

title: Lovely
review: Beautiful and calm. Lovely sunset viewing. Steps and gallery for seating. Boating trips make tourists enjoy to the fullest

title: Awesome
review: Highly recommend the lake is great for photos in the morning and evening. Very popular for tourists.

title: Beautiful palace
review: Romantic lake, amazing beauty palace, nice boating, beautiful chatri inside the lake, beautiful visit in gadisar lake Jaisalmer

title: Very poorly maintained
review: We went to visit this place around 12pm in the noon and due to too much sun light we refrained from boating and relaxing near the shades but we found the place is very dirty. All over plastic bottles and cow dunk. Also the lake water we found very dirty, full of plastic bottles all over.

title: Gadisar lake
review: A serene lake with boating facilities. One must go right side of boat ghat and sit under the trees and enjoy the breeze beauty and solitude. A open camp like atmosphere. A must visit.

title: Beautiful kale
review: The one and only lake in Jaisalmer. I have missed the sunset (which looks awesome from here). There is boating facility for which you have to buy tickets. Otherwise there is no entry fee to enter the lake.

title: Visit to the lake
review: We visited this lake recently. Due to less monsoon, the lake was half empty. The place around the lake is also not clean. The viewing galleries are off limits, you can't go there

title: Morning best time
review: Nice view of lake and buildings

title: Love
review: I went to see the Gangesar lake and I found it very beautiful and saw the mansion. I did not enjoy how much I saw the Ganges Lake.

title: Overhyped lake
review: Its nice lake but i feel its a bit overhyped. The chatris are good in the middle of the lake but all the cables running in the middle ruin its beauty, lake itself has quite less water and the banks are dirty to say the least.

title: Go for Sunrise
review: We made a quick visit early in the morning as we had some time before Hotel Checkin. The sun rise here is beautiful. We spotted some rare birds too.

title: good place to visit
review: The lake is a good place to visit. Cleanliness of the lake can be improved. The fishes in the lake come to banks for foods offered by visitors. Didn't go for boat ride so can't comment on the same.

title: An average spot
review: Lake is filled with architecture old and new both and it does have to surround area more beautiful but with the guide around were hassled for hiring them.

title: Man Made Lake - Gadisar Lake !
review: Do lick a boat ride in this huge man-made lake and appreciate the fine work around the lake, Temples are built inside water itself. Unlike a lot of lakes in India - this one stands out as there are densely populated with a variety of fishes, which proves that this lake has not been used as a dump station like many others in the country. Best time to visit is just before the Sun Set to get the experience for sunset and enjoy the solace.

title: Gadsisar Sagar Lake
review: The Gadsisar Sagar lake is located within the city of Jaisalmer. The lake is sorrounded by some beautiful old buildings and the way to the lake is lined with locals trying to sell their wares. If one is interested one can hire a boat to do boating although the lake is not big.

title: Boating
review: Nice lake with beautiful veiw boating facility availble.paddle boat for 100rs and 8 person boat for 500rs half an hour.

title: Beautiful
review: Try visiting it in the evening ,around 6.30-7 pm. Its beautiful and peaceful and worth spending some time in the stillness of the evening. Try to attend the evening Aarti at the Hinglaj  temple

title: Must Visit Place in Jaisalmer....
review: You would be wondered how Jaisalmer has such huge water body admist in such a Desert Town....make sure to go for a Boating.....it will give a View of Varanasi Ghats when seen from middle of the water . Worth Visit.

title: A nice little lake
review: Cute, although nothing special in terms of viewing. Small area from which to see the water. Although I imagine if you rent a paddle boat and go out on the lake itself, it’s probably pretty noce

title: Nice place
review: We enjoy our time at beautiful lake with boat ride. Also with historical places around the lake with great view of the Golden fort

title: A very beautiful place at Jaisalmer
review: One of the most famous places at Jaisalmer. The lake looks golden at the time of Sunset. A lake of Royal family still  holds its glory.

title: Serene lies the placid lake
review: Gadisar lake, once the lifeline of Jaisalmer is a beautiful place to spend your evening.while the level of water is not high, it offers a treat to your eyes. The beautiful Shiv mandir on the banks of the lake and the Aarti in the evening adds to the beauty of the place. Sit down near the temple and enjoy the solitude while down below people enjoy their boating.

title: Man made lake with voracious catfish
review: This man made lake in the desert city has lasted for hundreds of years.  It is not surprisingly a holy lake with temples adjacent.  It is an oasis of calm till someone throws some food in when the water heaves with the voracious catfish that live there.  You would not be tempted to dangle a toe in!!

title: Cool water site
review: Gadi Sagar Lake originally was a man-made reservoir that was founded to provide a source of water to the people of Jaisalmer.

title: Beautiful
review: Beautiful lake heart of the desert such a great place to walk around the lake side. enjoy the boat ride with nice view of old building. Nice Hindu temple

title: Beautiful
review: The gadisar lake is such a nice place to enjoy with family and friends,  located near main jaisalmer city, very nice place for boating .

title: Lake not well maintained..and crowded.
review: Better to avoid this as nothing unique here except some boating but very badly maintained.. There are few shops around where you could pick up some traditional stuff.

title: Nice gadisar
review: Gadsisar sagar very nice and good luck and evening times very good looking and sagar is very wonderful sagar Good fish and food . jaisalmer is nice places and tourist point Good looking

title: Tranquility Personified
review: A stunning location where you can stroll around the edge and just be alone. There is a vast seating area with some trees for shade - a beautiful spot to think.

title: Nothing special
review: Only to pass time.Actual it's spot with lake and some shops. No entry fee required if having spare time then visit.

title: Evening timepass
review: Best time to enjoy is evening... Enjoy boating with ur loved ones. Enjoy Safe and happy boating here.

title: nice lake
review: Maharwal Gadsi Singh, the then Maharaja of Jaisalmer constructed this lake in 1400 AD

title: Beautiful lake
review: Such a beautiful place to have sunset. Old historical building from 14th centuries with Hindu temple. Also enjoy boat ride at evening.

title: Beautiful Boat Ride By the sunset
review: Beautiful quite lake amidst the desert city Jaisalmer... Boating options for paddle and rowing boats available at 50₹ person  ...a good romantic ride for 30 minutes

title: Lake with a view
review: The lake with its floating structures in the water - used for musical and dance performances regaling the royalty of yore - evoke your imagination. Teeming with catfish, the lake itself is suitable for a n evening boat-ride, or a simple hour of contemplation, by its calm waters. A Mahadev Temple on the banks, also offers divine solace, for those seeking it. Trinket stalls and photo-op shops (where you can dress up in local finery and get yourself clicked) complete the experience.

title: Must Visit place
review: Great lake....Must Visit place during Jaisalmer trip...

title: Ok ish
review: It's a man made lake where it looks like you can take a boat ride or buy a hat. Bit dirty and in my opinion a bit pointless to visit

title: If you have time, go boating
review: There are many small temples and shrines around the lake. You can either take a paddle boat or a row boat to see them up close. Row boats cost you more.

title: Beaytiful
review: This lake is very beautiful.we did a boating for one hours and enjoyed it.there is lot of small sample around this lake.nice place to spent some hours here.spacilly for sunset time.beautiful lighting at evening.....recommended

title: Awesome
review: Beautiful place. Visited both during sunrise and sunset though the day were cloudy. Loved the peaceful boat ride. Morning meditation. @urba_mom #urbamom

title: Beautiful and worth it
review: We went there cause we were looking for free activities in Jaisalmer. The Jain temples, you paid and get harrased for donations; the Haveli you pay and get tailed by a so called guide. So we decided for this lake. People called it dirty and unimpressive. Well, guess what! everything in India is dirty. Even "holy" Ganga. The lake was super nice for us. Calm, with a cold breeze on the shade. Not as much trash as we expected. We didn't hire a boat, we just chilled on the shore. We enjoyed the calm. Away from the touts. Spent there around 1 hr. We however encountered many men chilling in the shore and on boats. They will stare but they don't look harmful. Alone I would have felt uncomfortable but with my friend it was alright. There's some vendors at the gate and that's annoying but the whole experience was nice

title: Beautiful and Peaceful
review: The lake is walking distance from the fort and a nice place to relax. Around the lake, structures made of sand stone add beauty to the lake. There are a lots of fishes in the lake and people feeding the fishes could be spotted in evening. Small temple is located on side of lake opposite to the sitting platform,

title: Beautiful
review: I saw gadiser lake it was amazing and peace and relax there. I like to spend more more time there.

title: Lake Central Desert
review: Lake Central Sahara is surrounded by many historical monuments and ancient palaces

title: Lake front
review: Decent place. Not much to see but relaxing. Very close to town so easy to get by. However day time can get hot

title: Beautiful and quite place
review: It is indeed Beautiful and quite place.Nothing much to see.Some scene of Bollywood movie SARFAROSH was shot here.We saw people feeding fishes in this lake.

title: Leisure on the lake
review: If you are visiting Jaisalmer between November and February, it is advisable to spend some time at the Gadisar Lake.

title: Serene
review: There is nothing great here for avid travelers. You might click a couple of pictures, have a boat ride and move on. I suggest skipping this place if you have a packed schedule

title: Nice place to chill out
review: It is a nice lake. There are a lot of birds in the trees and many fishes in the water. We watched the sunset and felt really good out there

title: Nice views
review: Spare some time to take a boat ride and lend a ear to the story behind the lake and the temple...interesting !!

title: Quiet place in a busy city
review: It's nice to come here for sunset if you like. You can also go on a little boat ride.. there are some steps where you can dir nicely.

title: Peace & Calm
review: Right from a busy street is Gadisar Lake, and when you enter this place it is magic, it is so calm here you can relax and enjoy the beauty, there is boating

title: Peaceful place
review: The place I like the most in Jaisalmer just simply because of peaceful environment especially during evening and early morning.

title: Lake
review: Lake is best place in jaisalmer and boating experience is so wonderful . You were also give food to fishes and totally different type fish is here

title: Beautiful lake in desert
review: Only and beautiful lake in the city in desert. Well maintained, neat n clean n  is one of attraction of tourists. Boating facilities are also available. Temple on shore adds it's beauty

title: Calm and a quiet place
review: Gadisar lake is in the middle of Jaisalmer town. Take a boat ride for half n hour and enjoy the calmness of this place.

title: Local
review: Amazing time spent in an oasis in the middle of thar desert.had a boating and our local guide was very impressive in his knowledge of Jaisalmer history .his name is harish giri.9414761153.www.jaisalmertourguide.com

title: Worth a look
review: Gadsisar lake has an interesting history and quite large. Allow less than 1 hour for this site. Saw people feeding the fish for good karma. A small temple to go inside. Some families still live lakeside. Lake used in Hindi burial ritual.

title: Historical Lake
review: Such a beautiful old artificial water tanks from 14 century. With heritage old buildings around the lake site. Also we enjoyed boat ride with sunset

title: Old Shiva Temple at a Lake
review: We visited Gadaisar Sagar Lake on a warm day in July and enjoyed the beauty of the Shiva Temple - which for a part looks like a ruin. We rentes a boat and rowed to the islands with temples. Located at the edge of the city and the desert the Lake is beatufully situated. Flying Foxes slept in the tree near the entrance. A visit to the Lake can easely be combined with the Desert Centre Folklore museum, an initiative of an old school teacher.

title: Boating
review: This lake is so beautiful.. I am we went there for boating and enjoyed a lot. Very beautiful and and full of rain water... Must visit it... I

title: Good energy
review: I went here for the first time three days ago, and it is the perfect place to meditate, but, go after 6pm, before that you will find a lot of crowd...

title: Go in the afternoon
review: Go here late in the afternoon is the best time to go. You can feed the catfish that come to greet you!

title: The view
review: What i can say to this place is amazing, you will find the great view with many good spot to take a pictures with you

title: Boating
review: Very beautiful lake........full of water......boating possibly..nice to.spaint evening there...Two hours past VERY soon

title: Place to calm down
review: It’s a great place to calm down after an hectic day in Jaisalmer.

title: Calm, fun, beautiful
review: Lovely 30 minute pedal and a cheeky bit of exercise! Beautiful views of the buildings and surrounding nature. Recommend.

title: Interesting spot
review: The Gadsisar Sagar lake is one of the places you will certainly visit on your trip to Jaisalmer.

title: Gadsar lake
review: A Clean lake for booting. This place is located at the entrance of the city from Jodhpur. There are many things to explore in and around jaisalmer.

title: Gadhisar Lake
review: In the middle of the city, it is a beautiful quiet place. Like othe places of Rajasthan pigeons are covering the roofs of all structures covering the lake. Boating is allowed though I did not try due to tight schedule.

title: “PEACE IN DESERT “
review: It is situated in centre place in the city .

title: Peaceful
review: It's nice to see a water lake in desert...It's realy have good view of fort and time to relax..You can do boating also..

title: Nice place despite plastics everywhere
review: WE went to this place which is very quite and should deserve better maintenance... nobody seems taking care of this place with plastics everywhere ... a pity as renting a boat for spending some time on the lake should have been very nice

title: Lake in the desert
review: That lake is a very special place in the desert city of Jaisalmer. Providing water for centuries already it is home of several temples. In this peaceful atmosphere you also can do leisure activities like boating.

title: Good lake in middle of city
review: Good lake in middle of city, can skip this place if you are in tight schedule. better to visit at evening time.

title: Good Place
review: Gadisar Lake situated  in center of the City. Boating is available . Nice Place to visit in Jaisalmer. The maintenance of the lake is not good.

title: Do stop here - must visit
review: This lake is less of lake and more of reservoir, but the amazing thing about this is that you’ll feel elated after taking a pit stop of 5-10 mins here. Do feel it.

title: Nice vibes
review: Beautiful lake to visit in small town while i was in jaisalmer i visit there for lot of time,  peace place,  love it

title: dirty, smelly, falling apart
review: the water level means the water is full of algae, the equisite structures are falling apart and are not being looked after.  There is lots of birds though and we saw a hog

title: Lake temples
review: We visited in the evening when it was not busy and the light was mellow . Beautiful temples built in the lake and local people enjoying boat trips. Nearby Hindu temple and puppet museum makes for a nice little excursion

title: Nice place to spend sometime, Though average
review: I had seen Gadsisar lake in quite a few Hindi movies, so wanted to visit it when in Jaisalmer. It is a good place if you want to do some boating in the lake, but it is very poorly managed. It could be more better if taken care well.

title: Charming view
review: It was a beautiful, amazing, cool experience of doing boating in this lake in scorching summer of April... It's well maintained and prices for boating are very economical.

title: Awesome
review: Gadisar lack is the best tourist point of jaisalmer.this is historical place made by Maharaja of jaisalmer.good booting become there.its wonderful point of view.

title: MAGICAL
review: We got up at sunrise so that we could get some good photos here. We experienced completely uninterrupted bliss as there was not another soul in sight (except for a couple of dogs). We got some incredible photos here and I would recommend this to anyone- especially for sunrise!

title: Source of the Water
review: Good ancient lake architecture and one can really relax after going through the dessert so he gets his eyes really cool seeing the water lake.

title: Sunset at gadisar lake
review: The perfect place to start or end the day. I visited the lake at the evening time, it was relaxing after the days walking through the fort.

title: PEACEFUL LAKE
review: One of the best and must sight seeing in jaisalmer.

title: Visit to Jaisalmer
review: Good place to spend good time when you visit Jaisalmer after monsoon. You can enjoy boating if it is full of water.

title: A Lake in the Desert
review: As a start to a City Tour this was ideal. Quiet and with bird and fish life a plenty there are ample quiet spots to savour. We did not use them but self propelled boat tours appeared available and looked appealing.

title: Lake view
review: Beautiful in the early morning. A place for sitting down and stare over the calm water of the lake. Watching birds fly over, some settling on the chattris in the water.

title: To visit if you are not too far
review: If you want to take a walk to the lake, it's a cute place to visit.

title: Sunrise & Sunset.
review: Very awesome sunrise i saw here with friends, it was all golden and very peaceful morning that day, I was stunned and captured every different colors of sunrise in my camera.

title: Not worth visiting in the dry season!
review: We ran out of time during our visit, so just popped here for 5 mins en route to the train station - thank god we didn’t make a special visit! Sure it’s lovely in/after the rainy season, but definitely not in April!

title: Gadisagar lake
review: This tourist place in jaisalmer is lit and you can also do boating here ,this place is just awesome and was fun boating here!

title: Serene
review: A must visit place if at Jaisalmer. Boating is available at nominal rates and you can do that without guidance. It is very safe as well. The monuments in the middle of the lake are beautiful. Best time to visit is in the evening.

title: Beautiful Lake
review: The entrance is free but the view is stunning.

title: sunset
review: I liked going to the lake where I got to go on a small boat ride and see the sunset while on the lake side

title: needs a good clean
review: this could be so much better were it not for the plastic bottles and general rubbish.

title: Once wonderful
review: The lake was not up to my expectations but that could be more to do with the lack of water due to no rain. Beautifully carved and constructed pavilions and temples but a little disrevelled in appearance. Could do with a clean up and a lot more water

title: Worst Pond
review: This may had been a good place but as I visited that place and surprised to see that its now a dirty pond, Tourism Department WAKE UP, a lot of foreigner tourist visits Jaisalmer and Govt get a lot of revenue from them. It became a dirty pond not a lake

title: good view
review: must visit during evening / sunset hours, good place boating, good foo provided by RTDC outside the spot

title: Lake with a view
review: The Gadisar Lake is like a movie with a great script, except the poor direction does'nt do justice to the whole thing. Here the locale is good, the setting with the decent architecture could have been better maintained and the boating scene is not quite inspiring. Some good displays on the history of the place, some decent house keeping and some high spirited sales pitch of boating, with introduction of an entry fee might revive the footfall in the place. Lots of scope for improvement!

title: Lake between thar desert
review: Good thing about this lake that it's only one lake which is in between a big thar desert. Love the boat ride between the lake.

title: Its ok.
review: Just a lake with a jetti, island and a couple of nice buildings around. Gave us something to do and I found some nice items to buy at the entrance.

title: Pretty lake and that's about it
review: The lake has been restored (very obvious from the architecture) and is hence quite pretty. However, there is not entry fee and hence you can see the restoration falling apart in a few places.

title: Oasis in the desert
review: Gadsisar Sagar Lake is a scenic rainwater lake excavated 1367, a surprising oasis near the city of sand, Jaiselmer. It is a picuresuque lake surrounded by small temples and shrines, which attracts migratory birds in winter time. Increasingly it is threatened due to increased demands of a water supply. It emanates tranquility.

title: Serene site
review: This place is incredibly beautiful especially before and during the sunset. it is not very crowded either and you can sit there at length and enjoy the birds and some architecture (might be restored). No entry fee either

title: Beautiful lakes with thousand birds!
review: I was here two times during my stay at Jaisalmer. It was nothing special in the mid-day but in the afternoon (before sunset) then everything was perfect. Just dont stay in front of the lake, try to take some walk around the lake, you will have chance to see thousand of bird flying above your head. It’s beautiful there in the sunset time with dogs, birds and sunset. I totally love this lake and recommend you to visit it in the afternoon to see the glorious sunset over there!

title: Evening Attraction
review: An artificial lake, is a good option for a quiet evening. Boat Ride / Boating, Sunset, Old Shiva Temple Ruins and birds - what more you can ask for? You can feed Catfishes and enjoy evening time. Some Local Items are available in street. Enjoy Maggi and a cup of tea.

title: Nothing special
review: Just a small lake.  Relatively clean and peaceful, for India.  You can take a row boat out if you want.

title: A place to sit and enjoy the water view
review: Jaisalmer is a small town and Ghadisarlake is one among the attractions it holds. This beautiful spot canbe enjoyed either early in the morning or late afternoon. You can take in the beauty of the picturesque place by sitting on the banks of the lake or seated at the ruins of the stone steps.  Boating is available too. Parking is available at the spot. You would need to walk a considerable distance from the parking lot to reach the lake. The path is smooth. You will find street vendors selling their wares and food stuff on either side of the path leading to the lake.  The place is usually brimming with tourists. Mr N K Sharma’s puppet show team which used to conduct puppet shows  has shifted its base from here. I don’t remember the name of the current base though I did read the board.

title: Oasis in the desert
review: Constructed as a water reservoir in 1400 AD by King Gadsi Singh, it is today a major tourist attraction in Jaisalmer. It is fringed with a couple of temples, and a few cenotaphs can be seen within the lake itself. Unfortunately, due to lack of maintenance, some of the cenotaphs are in a state of crumble.

title: Average place
review: The hotel manager highly recommended it for the evening and so we trooped I’m eager to enjoy a nice evening and a boat ride. As lakes go in India, it was quite an average lake, quite small with some nice structures built along the side and near the middle of the lake. The mosquitos were the worst part and troubled us to no end throughout the 30 minutes ride. The boatman was however a treasure trove of information and details on Jaisalmer and gave us some good tips on where to go in Jaisalmer

title: very nice place
review: i loved this lake.Though there was not much water but the chattris and the jharokhas inside the water looked beautiful.There were ducks in the water and all the structures are golden.there are boating facilities and also camel rides.you can sit quietly on the bank and dream

title: Gadisagar
review: Lake in the desert town with boating facility.

title: Satarangi Jaisalmer... Golden city Jaisalmer
review: Gadsisar Sagar Lake is one of the attractive lakes in Jaisalmer. You will see the ghumar constructions supported by pillars in the lake. The sunset is awesome and a treat of natural beauty to our eyes.

title: Yo yo what a big big fish
review: Very old lake , it was little dirty bt nic. In the lake there was a big big fish......bt it's a gd place for boating.

title: Good view for sunset
review: Here is good for view sunset and relaxing. People gave foods for fishs, birds and dogs. You can spend chilling time.

title: Average
review: Gadisar Sagar Lake, as they say, is one of the main attractions of Jaisalmer.  We visited the lake.  It’s a lake with arrangements of boating against payment, which appeared to be a bit high to us.  During afternoon session one can sit at the bank of the lake, can have snacks...and that’s it.   Yes, there is a temple too.

title: Good boating place
review: This place have small pond. Where you can enjoy boating in evening. Good for photography. There is one small temple which is too good.

title: Cool architecture around a tiny ancient reservoir
review: The lake is quite cool and it’s fun to take a peddle boat out and around for a few minutes.

title: Nice ambience
review: You can't imagine boating in jaisalmer because we think jaisalmer means only sand dunes and camel's. But Gadsisar lake is amazing place, ambience is unmatched. Boating with family in jaisalmer is a nice experience.

title: Prefer visiting the lake for a sunrise or a sunset
review: The lake itself has not much to offer esp coz it was almost dry the month we arrived..but was peaceful and serene..there was an artist performing there his voice was the x factor for the otherwise quiet location..

title: Gadisar lake
review: I have visited udaipur..gadisar lake is not as cool as udaipur lakes...jagh jgh logo ne gandgi kar rkhi h. Khi beth nhi skte h. Toilet hi toilet har jgh...spl kuch nhi h..evng time is good ..but persn who visited udpr ..wil not like gadisar

title: Its pond rather
review: Dirty water, smelly place, once can visot for 5 min to click some pics, not worth spending time there.

title: Man made lake.
review: Its a man made lake. Its amazing considering the desert like conditions in Jaisalmer. Boating options are available. You can click few pics. Avoid visiting during midday.

title: Nice place
review: Gadsisar sagar lake is amagine place ,Ambience is unmatched .boating with family in jaisalmer is a nice experience.

title: Nothing special - normal lake
review: Normal lake in which you can hire a peddle or a rowing boat and enjoy the surroundings. Its located in the city.

title: Nice place to spend an hour
review: A nice spot in Jaisalmer to fill an hour - easy to find a quiet spot to relax!  Can rent pedal boats to paddle around the lake, although I didn't feel the need to as the lake is pretty small. Keep an eye out for the black winged stilts as there are good numbers around the lake shore.

title: beautiful lake
review: There are very few places in Jaisalmer which is clean and beautiful , this lake is one of them, in evening the  place becomes very crowdy you can boat in the lake but have to wait quite a long . but the place is really beautiful . I LIKE IT.

title: The Gadsisar Sagar lake
review: Visiting this place , we had the feeling of being in a Halima's fairytale! What an experience! Best time on sunrise or sunset , but the beauty is always a beauty!

title: A lake in  the dessert!
review: Well, the place comes in Jaisalmer district of Rajasthan, however, the lake offers a much soothing view of the nice clean waters (as per Indian parameters), boating rides and a couple of fast food vendors outside the lake that are required once spend stamina after driving the pedals of the boat for nearly an hour. The lake seems to be royal place as the lake houses structures as can be seen in pictures which are there to provide shadow for the riders to rest and then move on.

title: Timing is important
review: A very beautiful place. If you want to take pictures you should go there in the morning  In the late afternoon you have to take the picture against the light.

title: Lake and Yummy Butter Milk
review: This place is quite nice. You can enjoy half hour boating here. Also you can buy some Rajasthani products here. Must try Masala Butter-Milk (chaacch) outside sold by a small shop which you can't resist having minimum 2glasses, and we bought camel showpiece also. And nearby you can find food stall of jhal-muri, bhel puri etc, which is also nice.

title: A lovely little oasis in the desert
review: A most pleasant place to spend an hour at sunrise. People going about their business, birds on the lake and wedding photos being taken in the charming little building out in the lake.

title: Superb to Visit in Morning or Evening.
review: Must visit if you are in Jaisalmer. Very calming experience. Do go for Boat ride. It's fun..

title: Place to be in lake and calm yourself :)
review: Small man made Lake, almost all forts used to have water bodies for their supply of water during their time.

title: Jaisalmer tour
review: A worthy place to visit. It offers a very scenic view of jaisalmer. We enjoyed boating a lot. Authorities should care of cleanliness also.

title: Big lake with boating facility
review: You can enjoy  here. Inside some traditional shops are there from where you can purchase Rajasthani jewellery. You can capture your photos in Rajasthani dress. We didn't have boating. It took only 30 mins to roam this spot.

title: Small lake near the city
review: A very small lake near the city. The gate and the little house on the lake look nice but apart from that nothing special. But if you look for more quietness that’s a good place.

title: Very good
review: very good

title: Nothing great.
review: Nothing great about this place. There was little water where people were boating. They have an amphitheater sort of a place at the banks of the lake, not sure if any show is organized anytime. Can definitely give a skip if you have better things to do while in Jaisalmer.

title: Nice
review: Visit for a nice sunset view while boating. Best time to visit is ~6 PM. Nothing much to do apart from boating, but still a good experience.

title: Avoid
review: A waste of time and money for transportation . The dirty water will put you offhand who wants to ride a boat in the sun .

title: The only attraction
review: Gadsisar sagar Lake was the only place of visit after fort and you can enjoy boat ride but very small area was filled of water so not much of exictment.

title: Queit place but not so well maintained
review: It's a quiet place where you can do boating and relax for some time. But the water is not very clean. Definitely not a must visit.

title: So so
review: The lake is not really big, and in the lake there’s a building. And there’s a lot of painters. Mostly i like

title: Picturesque but needs maintenance
review: The entry to the place is quite good with Rajasthani music all around. Location is good too. The place is nice to click some good photos and that is it about the place.

title: Lake in Jaisalmer
review: The Gadisar Lake was once the only source of water in Jaisalmer. Constructed by the first ruler of Jaisalmer, Raja Rawal Jaisal, it is surrounded  by artistically carved Chattris, Temples, Shrines and Ghats.

title: Average
review: Heard about it as a major tourist attraction but did not like much , lake was not well maintained that time and this could have been taken care of in a better manner

title: Enchanting but needs maintenance
review: This is the place where you can sit and relax during the early morning and evening hours. The serene water and the small temples built all around the lake is a perfect place for alight stroll . Photographers can find some nice clicks during sunsets and early sunrise. One can also have boat rides which have different cost depending upon rowing and paddle.

title: Boat ride
review: Small lake but the boat was young but very informative about history...first time saw camel sarais constructed on the banks of the lake well restored

title: Dirty lake, picturesque vista
review: You can go here and spend at max an hour, even if you walk around the whole lake and take pictures from all angles.

title: Lake in the dessert
review: Beautiful lake, this is a man made lake. Jaisalmer is a small city and this is again at a walking distance from main fort. We were there around 10 am, there are a lot of small temples in the area and the place was divine at that time. One can enjoy boating in the lake. There are stalls at the entrance which offer tea and some snacks.

title: Good but need maintenance
review: This is one of the tourist attractions with some amazing carved Chattris and ghats around. However, this lake is not well maintained.

title: Nice view for a short visit
review: This lake, actually a reservoir, used to provide the water for Jaisalmer a few centuries ago. Now the water suply comes from the Himalyas, but Sagar Lake still is a nice place to visit and see the locals enjoy it.

title: Tranquil Picture Opportunity
review: Former reservoir for the entire city this is now a leisure lake and frequented by locals. It's free and worth going just to chill and take some pics of the pretty domed buildings reflected in the lake - about an hour should do it.

title: Wonderful quiet place
review: This a quiet a scenic place, with boating facilities and lovely golden buildings around it.

title: Awesome sunset view
review: We enjoyed the place. A nice and probably the cheapest boat ride. Awesome sunset view and nice surroundings to spend evening.

title: Beautiful
review: Gadisisar lake is the most beautiful lake in Jaisalmer. The water is very clean. Boiting is the plus point of lake.

title: Lake
review: A average lake situated in Jaisalmer. Nothing great about this lake. You can take a walk in the evening.

title: Awesome visit
review: The lake is not too clean but it's good experience in evening for boating 100rs for pedal boat experience a must have.

title: Beautiful
review: Beautiful man made lake from 14 centuries and from there beautiful view of golden fort.  Also we enjoyed boat ride with nice sunset. Nice historical building around the lake

title: Oasis
review: Lovely man made lake which is about 400 years old with lovely structures that dot the lake. The entrance is beautifully carved from golden yellow sandstone which is symbolic of the golden city

title: Beautiful and calm feelimg
review: Great place to visit. Lake is calm and quiet. There is no entry fees but parking is 50 INR. boat riding available if you fancy.

title: Peace
review: If you are the one who love sunset then this place is for you. Just go somewhere between 5 in evening so you can see before sunset and after sunset.

title: Paddle boating.
review: Nice place to visit in evening. One can do boating in lake. Paddle boat for couple costs around 100. And also other options for boating for family. Nice market outside the lake. You can take pictures in traditional dress over there costs around 100 per person.

title: Beautiful lake, but needs to be cleaned
review: The lake is one of the main tourist attractions in Jaisalmer and one can see beautiful cenotaphs and ghats around the lake. However the place needs to be cleaned as it seems people make it dirty. If the place is more clean then the visit will be more interesting

title: Boating & Photography
review: Good for boating & photography with the traditional dresses, Need to choose a right one to be memorable. Nice view from the lake,

title: Good for couples and family
review: Its a pleasant lake well within the jaisalmer city... lots of local rajsthani stuff shops to shop for... nice spots for photography...

title: Good place, nice scene, lot of history.
review: Nice place to visit while at Jaisalmer. It’s a short drive from the city. The place is filled with history on how water was managed in the old days. There is a Shiva temple around this place and the best view of Jaisalmer Fort can be had from this location.  They also sell local artefacts here.  The suggestion would be to hire a guide who can help you with the information and the history of this place.

title: Just a lake with really bad stench at the entrance.
review: A lake with very bar stench at the entrance to the boat riding place. It's Recommended that you take a longer walk towards the left when entering the place and then soak in the beauty of the lake from the left side after walking another 200 feets or so.

title: Nice click
review: Very nice black very nice what a beautiful nice people here black family life beautiful all film star here

title: Nice lake
review: Good lake for enjoying boating . Row boats and paddle boats both are available .Or u can walk around the lake and enjoy the walks.

title: Artifcial Lake made in the late 1400 AD
review: This place is mesmerizing and away from the crowd and peaceful, take a rick and halt at this place. some of the birds get attracted to this place  Don't miss to carry a good pair of binoculars and SLR camera for a amazing snap shots of the birds.

title: Gadhisar lake
review: I visited this lake and it was so peaceful .it was surrounded by Lord Shiva's temples

title: Do boating in evening
review: We did boating at noon n it was quite hot.so if u want to do boating go for it in evening.nothing more here

title: Nice
review: Most beautiful lake in rajasthan.clean water in the lake.Nice view in the fort

title: What a lake
review: A must place to visit in Jaisalmer for Boating ,watching sunset  and feeding fishes.Shops outside the we can see puppet show 2. see and hear music instruments being exhibited and sometimes played also.

title: Lake of Jaisalmer
review: Here in old times travellers and trade persons used to assemble midway on their trade routes. Discuss their trade and meet king appointed persons for taxes on their business

title: Nice place
review: It's like taking a break from the sand and stones... A big water body inbetween the city. Go for boating and enjoy the scenes around.

title: Water in Desert
review: It is like a picnic spot in Jaisalmer. We enjoyed here boating. Evening time is the best time to visit this place with sun set.

title: Paradise in Desert
review: only mode of drinking water in old period of jaisalmer. situated in heart of the city offering superb sunset and boat ride to tourist.

title: Beautiul lake
review: Visited the lake,but you can only experience it truly by boat,which on our visit we did not due to time factor. Usual soverner shops. No toilet facilities ,well there are but...  no shade . The entrance gate hs a good story surrouning it about the mahaajas concubine who had it built.

title: An awesome place for boating
review: A perfect place for visit in jaisalmer if you are bored of the repeating visit of the forts and hawelis, best time to visit is 4pm - 6pm.

title: A place for a short break
review: A man-made lake, the Gadi Sagar Lake in Jaisalmer, was constructed by Raja Rawal Jaisal, the first ruler of Jaisalmer.  We were told by the guide.

title: Chandani raat mein Nauka Vihar (Boating in Moonlight)
review: Its a fun experience. you can shop in local market. Get pics clicked in Rajasthani attire. Know the history of this and admire the beauty of the variety of umbrellas (Structures) around.

title: Boat Ride a must
review: a Small lake but nevertheless a wonder in the desert. A  boat ride in night can be very romantic for couples.

title: good location
review: very good location . we have visited and took boat ride  also enjoyed the puppet show . must visit and recommend to other tourist

title: ok ok place
review: an ok place, we went at the end of december, so loads of water in the lake for boating, but very unsafe, they do not follow any security precautions, you are on your own. A very local market around, so if you are interested to buy some rajasthani clothes/ local artificial jewlery you can visit this place. But OK OK stuff not of much good quality

title: Peaceful place to chill
review: This is a well touristed place that offers peace and quiet as well. Especially good for a visit early morning or sunset. You can walk around the lake, which not many do but is worth the energy.

title: an oasis of tranquility
review: The lake is definitely worth visiting, if only to get way from the hustle and bustle of the town. A walk around the top of the boundary wall gives you a view back to the fort, and keep wlk to the opposite side where there is a beautifully peaceful temple on a small island (connected by a land bridge), which looks back towards the main temples and the fort.

title: Great place to spend the evening/sunset
review: This place is great for photos in the evening. The structures (some resemble the centotaphs found at Bada Bagh) make it lovely to experience the lake atmosphere and to take photos. It can get crowded but there is ample space to walk around. It is a good mix of a lake environment, architecture and people. A must visit if you're in Jaisalmer especially during the evening when the sun is setting.

title: Beautiful Lake with history
review: Quiet place with history and good photo point too. ts a man made lake as per guide and has a beautiful view. Must visit.

title: A popular tourist spot
review: A man made reservoir,this lake was once the only source of water for Jaisalmer.Now very popular with tourists it can get uncomfortably crowded in peak tourist season.Boating is the attraction here but be prepared to wait a long time in a never ending queue.Climb up the stairs on the side and get views of the lake in much calmer surroundings.

title: Serene!! Beautiful
review: Boating in the gadiser lake with the sun setting in the backdrop is a memory which you are unlikely to forget for a long time. Serene, calming and peaceful are the words to describe the experience. Listen to the pigeons chirping and make some wot Sergio memories with friends and family. Also take some time to walk along the ghats to soak in the feel.

title: Beautiful place
review: It has boating, nice sunset view and good architecture. Its kind of picnic spot in Jaisalmer which offers food, photography etc.

title: Its a big pond, not a lake !
review: Suggest to skip this. the lake is more like a big pond with some structures thrown here an there. there is boating but not so enjoyable. Can be given a miss.

title: Calm and Beautiful
review: Beautiful place to be visit. Good time to visit in the evening and spend some time with your near and dear ones

title: Clean Lake with history
review: It is nice and quite place,  you will find old shiv temple and guide will tell you history.  Take a full walk of Lake,  and enjoy boating

title: Not to be missed, must visit in Jaisalmer
review: Such beautiful structures amidst water body is just marvelous, structures made of yellow stone is a unique thing to see, must go for a boat ride in the lake, there is entry fee about INR 50 per head, it's refreshing to visit this place...

title: Lake with a view but don’t go for a swim!
review: If you’re in Jaisalmer then this is worth a 15 minute detour from the fort, but no more. The few sellers on the short walk from the road highlights the lack of visitors which is a shame as the lake, despite the pollution, provides a picturesque setting so long as you get the sun in the right position - evening better than morning.

title: Good morning walk
review: Walked down early before the heat of the day and it was tranquil only 2 other people out and about very peaceful!

title: Serene
review: Visit this during sunset. We were expecting it to be busy like everywhere else in Jaisalmer but it was surprisingly quiet.

title: Boating in this lake is really good experience
review: going to this lake then take paddle boat and enjoy boating for 1 hour and take some pics enjoy sunset as must watchable from lake  also lighting in night is awesome

title: Sunrise Glory
review: We went early to catch the sunrise and it was glorious. Unfortunately, people/ tourists had really dirtied the place but still the beauty of the place is such that we could still find solace.  Please take care when you travel to leave a place cleaner than dirtier than before. Explore the nooks and crannies to really understand the complex architecture here. Support local handicrafts by buying from local people. There are not only some amazing photo opportunities here but also historical and architectural interest learnings.

title: Nothing great.
review: It's a small lake. Nothing great about this place. It's decently picturesque and one can spend time boating and clicking pictures.

title: Nice place with good lake view
review: This place offers good  lake view.One can enjoy  boating  also. A good place for kids .The place needs better upkeep . Worth visiting while you are in Jaisalmer.

title: Beauiful place, peaceful lake
review: Really beautiful place with heritage look. Took Paddle Boat ride and enjoyed a lot. On the gate had photo-shoot in Rajasthani costume and its really a great experience, everyone should go for it.

title: One of Best lakes of Rajasthan
review: he Gadisar lake is one of the prime sightseeing place in Jaisalmer Town. The view of lake is really magnificent at evening time. One can boat also in the lake and click multiple of picture during the evening time. Lake gets bit crowdy in evening as the view of lakes gives full charm this time.

title: Absolutely blissful and amazing sunset point
review: I’m so surprised in how calm and peaceful the lake is. Apart from a few domestic tourists on the paddling boats, there were hardly any other tourist here. For some reason, many people were not aware of the lake, perhaps being overshadowed by the fort and the desert. The place is a total bliss. Only 20 mins walk from the fort. The area feels a little more local along the way with street food and cheap shopping. Highly recommended

title: Really nice and peaceful lake
review: Went there by the sunset and took really nice pictures!  A peaceful and beautiful place with birds singing and people rowing boats. It was built in 1300s by Jaisalmer's founder as a water supply.

title: Another 'attraction' wrecked by commercialism
review: Like practically everywhere else in Jaisalmer, it seems if you are rich enough or well enough connected, you can set up a stall of some kind and blight the scene, create even more rubbish and further destroy the ambience.

title: nice place for boating
review: A great lake offering scenic views with lots of boats for boating.

title: Good for boating in evening
review: Another clean  lake, good for boating in the evening. You get great views while on boat.

title: good place for killing time in the evening
review: If you are in jaisalmer and have time to kill in the evening, you can go there, otherwise there is nothing special there.

title: Lake with boating facility
review: Good boating experience if with young children. The lake is not well kept as there were debris floating.

title: Many better place to visit
review: There are many good things to do in jaisalmer apart from this. Don't wast time visiting this place. One of check list not to-do list

title: Beautiful evening views
review: The lake offers beautiful evening views at sunset. Boating is also there. Overall it was a good experience

title: Good spot
review: Spoted lake are good for few hours visit and it does have many old art work also the atmosphere around the lake are very quiet and peaceful.

title: Sunset was excellent
review: We took peddle boating for 30 minutes around 5.30PM. Sunset was awesome. Puppet show tickets were also sold near lake. There is a sunset point nearby.

title: Avoid
review: Nothing much to see  . Poorly maintained  ... The place has boating and enjoyable but nothing else.. some shops are available but nothing much stuff is available for sale... the place has historic value but no major value for tourists

title: Relaxing and beautiful experience
review: This place is worth a visit for once. For a family ideal would be to take a boat ride for Rs.300 with a person rowing the boat. Couples can take a peddle boat. The lake is very calm with one side open to forest area. Evening rides look mesmerising with sunset and all yellow stone structures around. Good experience.

title: Historical but filthy
review: Lake itself is beautiful with historical significance. But it is dirty - there are boats available for rent but they looked really bad.

title: As large, smelly man-made Lakes go this is one of them
review: We visited this spot as our first stop on a day-long Tour of Jaisalmer, so fairly early on in the day, before it got too hot.

title: Must watch
review: Must watch lake in Jaisalmer. The beauty is amazing and the pictures turn out to be really great and natural. I took some shorts from wide lense dslr and they look amazing. I will upload them soon

title: A great memory
review: Totally worth getting up at 445 to catch sundries here. We were completely alone and it was magical!

title: Pretty but not clean
review: It's a pretty view, worth a visit... yellow sandstone n water make a beautiful view. However, water is not clean n is stinky. If the place could be kept clean like the rest of Jaisalmer, it would be better :-)

title: Nice place
review: Very nice place to boting in lake and place it on your way back from the start of the African countries and I have to go back to the sun set up the roof of the lake

title: Boating Gadisar lake - Good experience
review: GADISAR lake in jaiselmer is one of best attraction in jaiselmer. It is located very near to jaiselmer railway station & bus stand too. Boating at evening time gives you a good experience.  Do visit in the evening.

title: Lake is excellent but if u have visited udaipur then dnt go
review: Lake is excellent but if u have visited udaipur then dnt go as there small boating but one kind of peace is there near shiva temple if u r frustrated in life nd hv some relax time u go and don't forget to take food to fishes as there are big bif fish

title: Lake wih monuments
review: My experience of visit of gadisisar lake was mixed. We have to call police to report some unauthorized locals demand of extra money for parking the car. These kind of local Gundas did not understand what wrong impression they sent to tourists . People who are given authority to collect parking fees tried to slap our driver but when police arrived they ran away.Request every visitors to raise your voice if they start unjustified demands. Overall lack view is good. Water is not clean . Boating facility is affordable.

title: Tour
review: Nice place. U can do pedal  peacefully. Beautiful and calm. We chose to stay in place of serenity than rushing and visiting too many. The lake visit was one of the best decision made by us.

title: Good place to spend the evening
review: Nice place at the heart of the city. You can enjoy the sunset here. Birds all around. While entering the place you will find a small stall selling glass of milk on your left. Try it. Best time to visit will be during the evening before sunset

title: Good Place but maintained poorly
review: Place is very good and right in the heart of the town but its upkeep and maintenance is not upto the mark.

title: If you want to add to your list of "Seen Things"
review: It was an abandoned site! Found it filthy, didn't like to boat.  Your excellent photography can show how beautiful the lake looks!

title: Peaceful
review: A great place to see the sunrise.  Very peaceful as the city awakes.  Locals visit in the morning to pray and exercise.  Good for sunrise photos.

title: Beautiful lake
review: Gadisar lake is a beautiful lake in Jaiselmer.
