We walked about 2 km from our hotel to the lake,but after a long walk were disappointed that there is not much space around the lake to sit and relax.There is only one corner near the entrance where you climb a few stairs to get the view.The main entrance is blocked by the boatmen.There is no walkway. If one doesn't opt for boating there is nothing much to do.

title: Picturesquely clean
review: We had sometime before our train left the city so we took an auto to the lake. About a 15 min drive, it is a quiet and clean place to relax and reminisce the olden times.

title: A nice place that has been poorly maintained
review: This man made lake could have been a much better tourist attraction had it been maintained and had the place not been encroached by hawkers etc. I'd thus give it 2.5 - 3 stars even though it could easily have been a 4 star place.

title: Nice break from all the selfies
review: It was nice to actually rent a little pedal boat and get out onto the lake. It's only 100 rupees for 2 people for half an hour and it's well worth it just to experience some peace and quiet away from the crowds and people constantly hassling you. The lake is small and not much to see, but again just a good spot to relax.

title: Nice quiet trip out in a pedalo
review: It's always nice to get some time to yourselves in India without people nagging for selfies, rickshaw rides, leather bags and almost running you down before tooting their skull-penetratingly powerful horns, and where better to get away from everyone but the middle of a lake? 100 rupees for half an hour for two in a pedalo, and with a small island to visit, a couple of pigeon inhabited temple-islands combined with minimal human faeces make this a winner. There's also a nice view of the fort from the water.

title: amazing lake for boating and ghat
review: You can sit by the lake or do boating.. we spotted swans on one of the island structures in the lake

title: Peacefully and nice view
review: Small lake, with a good view. peacefull to read a book and wander around a little. worth the visit, and its free to enter.

title: Evening hanging place
review: It's a good hangout place for the evening. Do take a 30min boating ride. Around the place there are street shops. Dropping food to cat fish will be fun for kids.

title: An oasis in the desert
review: Small lake used to be the chief water supply of Jaisalmer in olden times. Not much to do here except take a few photos

title: Could have been maintained well
review: Like any other old cities in Rajasthan, this is a huge lake that offers boat ride and is a major tourist attraction. But the effort to maintain it is very less and could have been cleaner. Don't miss the shops beside the lake, where if you bargain can get some stuff at a cheaper rate than in shops.

title: For the real joy, go on the other side
review: Great place for relaxing and having some contact with nature.

title: Nice walk
review: A nice place for a relaxed walk and to do some photography

title: A beautiful destination
review: The Gadisar  lake is a must visit destination for tourists in Jaisalmer. Beautifully maintained , it has a grand entrance and some beautiful monuments amidst the lake. All kind of boats are available for boating and pedal boats are fun. Spend the evening part of you are a photography freak to capture some Magnificent shots. Located in the heart of the city it's walkable if you are staying close to Air Force Circle.

title: Beutifull  Lake
review: A Beutifull Palace that must be see in the early morning when is fog is not lifted on the lake. Best time to visit  sunrise and sunset time best.

title: Tranquility
review: Gadsisar Lake is a man-made reservoir just outside the old town of Jaisalmer. It's a short (50 rupee) tuk-tuk ride from the fort.

title: Beautiful lake in Jaisalmer.
review: Walked down to the lake today and was really mesmerised by the tranquility and sereneness of it all. There is an option to take a boat out on to the lake there too.

title: Pretty.
review: Worth a look, especially around sunset, if you have the time. Quite a pretty lake! We walked around a bit to get some photos from various angles. Not sure how much boat rides cost; we didn't feel particularly called to do one.

title: Boating
review: Nice view. Self pedaling boat for 30mins is 300 rupees and if you hire someone for a rowing boat while you enjoy the view then its 400 rupees. Its very hot but worth the money.

title: Beautiful place to relax in the shadows
review: The lake is very calm and quiet. At the entrance are the usual suspects trying to see you something and you can opt to paddle in a boat over the lake. We just found a quiet place under a tree and relaxed for a while.

title: Clean it up!
review: Could be a wonderful place, but locals are leaving a message. Plastic bottles inside the lake... That's really sad.

title: Magical!
review: A lovely spot to get a little calm and rest in the shade of the trees while admiring the beautiful scenery.

title: So Beautiful Lake
review: One of the best place in Jaisalmer. Lake is so beautiful and clean . We enjoy the voting in lake with Friends and have fun.

title: Good place for Boat Ride
review: One of the very few attractions in Jaisalmer city.. nice view for taking pictures. It offers manual and pedal boat rides for small to medium size groups.

title: Oct Visit
review: Good lake. Lot of Construction around it. Govt must take strict action for its maintenance. Must visit and is next to city

title: Fun and Entertainment with family
review: Awesome historic  place...we do some activity like boating ,take some photos in rajasthani dresses...take some rest to become fresh for next TRAVELLING .

title: not a bad spot to relax from the hustle
review: If you walk away from the main boat boarding jetty along the ghat area than it's a nice place to sit in peace and watch the boats and view. Nice flooded structures and beautiful sunsets.(and it's free!)

title: Nice View.
review: You can just walk to the lake from the city proper. You get a nice view but that's it. Didn't try the boat ride though. Go in the afternoon around 4pm is okay.

title: A must visit in Evening in Jaislamer
review: Gadsisar Lake – Excavated in 1367 by Rawal Gadsi Singh, it is a scenic rainwater lake surrounded by  artistically carved Chattris, Temples, Shrines, and Ghats

title: Nice
review: Nice lake as far as Jaisalmer is considered. Should be visited in evening as in day the temperature is very high. There is boating facility, can shop for local famous artistic things. Photographs in traditional dress is very famous here.

title: Good to see
review: Only the catfish is the attraction of this lake. Over  all good experience to see thousands of fish. Great experience.

title: Good place to spend the evening
review: This man made lake in Jaisalmer is a nice place to hangout with family and friends. You can also do boating here...it has the old world charm...

title: Nothing much to do
review: Just a water tank, very significant given it's in the Thar desert. Not much to do in the place - click selfies perhaps if that's your wont.

title: lake
review: average lake but with a good view of buildings surrounding it. Boating is average. Avoid boating after sunset as this place has mosquitoes

title: Decent
review: One can go in the evening and boat around in this lake. It a calm and decent boat ride. The lake was well-maintained.

title: Feeding the fishes
review: If you are at Jaisalmer spend the afternoon at Gadisar Lake, a 14 century man made lake built by Maharawal Gharasi. Enter through Teelon ki Pol( try to know who was Tilon and a fascinating story behind the building of this gateway).Take a boat, you have the options to choose the type and enjoy the sunset. Else just sit at step and watch feeding of hundreds of fishes by some devoted people who believe it will give them 'punya'(virtue), even you can gain some 'punya' by feeding them!

title: Stinks, please dont go
review: its more of a pond than a lake. long queues for boating for which do not venture. its also a open public toilet so be ready for the stench

title: Gadisar Lake
review: This lake was built by Maharaja for people welfare, for drinking water as well as other utilities. The architecture was so unique that it had a filtration system, on other half which used to make the water so clean & pure that you can see the small stone in the depth of water. Now it has changed a lot.

title: Great view from boat
review: This is nice lake in jaisalmer. The water level was somewhat lower maybe due to the time of the year. Yet, it was a great experience boating around  the structures in the middle of the water. Provides a lot of vantage points for great photographs.

title: Very nice market and well organized facilites for boa rides
review: Good place to pick up a few handy Jaisalmer souvenirs to share when you're back from your trip. Exceptionally clean area, finding parking is reasonably comfortable (at least when i visited on a bike on a Sunday evening in early October) and the boating setup seemed pretty well managed.

title: Nice view
review: Peaceful site where it is nice to start the day before going to the crowed fort. Nice view where you can réel the past history

title: Good lake
review: A good place to visit in the afternoon as it provides a beautiful view of the shining rays of the sun reflecting the lake.Boating is also there for upto 10 members.Capture yourself in the Traditional Rajasthan attire.

title: Voluminous evergreen
review: Had a wonderful evening at the lake feeding fishes and shopping for rare fossils and ornaments near the banks.

title: Fine to see .
review: Should visit if you have visited Jaisalmer.

title: Gadisar lake
review: Very scenic lake with boating,the steps and the platforms with minarets in the lake are worth seeing

title: Peaceful lake
review: We had a good time sitting by the windy banks and enjoying the cool breeze. Boating is fun and the umbrella structures in the middle of the lake look beautiful from the banks.

title: Nice lake
review: go for a walk on the lake. not pozheleete. umirotvorenno, nice and quiet. beautiful architecture, filled with history. in the lake many fish, swim turtles. you can swim boat

title: Beautiful Atmosphere
review: Gadiser Lake is one of the my favorite palace in Jaisalmer.  It is very Relaxing and good to do Boat.

title: A man made beauty...
review: Located centarlly in Jaisalmer has a long history which dates back to centuries with many stories told by our guide Prem Singh.

title: Lake
review: This Lake is the only reservoir in Jaisalmer and they offer boat ride in the evening and you can see the fort too.

title: Walk arround the lake
review: The tempels are nice und you have a nice view.

title: Picturesque
review: Almost deserted in afternoon. Wonderful calm lake. Boating was good. Looks majestic. Can easily spend some quality time here..

title: Floating temples
review: Beautiful lake with lots of interesting monuments and temples built in the water. Also visited a Hindu temple by the shore . Lively with locals enjoying the boating on the lake and worshipping at the temple. Worth a visit . Beautiful vistas.

title: A must-visit in Jaisalmer!
review: Loved the lake. Such a pretty setting! We hired a pedalo and it felt so peaceful and calm away from the busy honking on the roads. Scenic landscape around the lake and wild animals to see. We went at sunset which was perfect! Definitely go.

title: Nice Boat Ride
review: This is a scenic lake surrounded by temples.

title: Lake at desert city
review: It was nice to see a lake with deep green water in the desert city . The nearby climate became cool . Most attractive part was the gang of hungry fishes ( magur) coming at the ghat when you throw muri on them .

title: Lovely time spent in the afternoon.
review: The lake is very scenic and we very much enjoyed our boat ride there. The sunset from the lake also looks good.

title: Serene, Peaceful and Calm Lake
review: Went to Gadsisar Sagar Lake in the Evening during the Sunset, it was Serene and Peaceful. Spent 1 hour there, did paddle boating along with family it was fun. Lot of Ghats are next to the lake. Must visit the place during the evening to catch sunset.

title: Sunset over the lake
review: The lake is a relaxing place to visit. For a charge of 100 rupees (for 30 minutes), you can hire a paddle boat for two and spend an evening watching the sun set over the lake. The temples lining the ghats, the outposts on the lake, the half-submerged trees, and the birds that flock the banks, all make for a scenic, peaceful, and calming experience.

title: Cool and calm lake
review: Lake within had lots of ancient structures to make it special. Very calm and a good place for leisure. Boating was the special attraction.

title: Gadsisar Lake - man made
review: Located in the Thar desert, this man made lake was the rain water supply for the town. Interesting history, especially the story of the pol (arched gateway) to enter the lake. Temples and shrines to be found around the lake.

title: Not a must do but a pleasant walk at sunset
review: Free to wak to and relatively clean ,a good place to sit by the lake on the steps and watch the sunset .There are rowing boats for hire and large catfish in the lake .A giant plastic swan boat makes for an unusual photo in this setting .

title: Rajasthan trip
review: Nice place, ancient places, have their own beauty and importance. Best thing is there architecture, approx 800 year old place.

title: Decent attraction
review: Its a lake with history to it. Definitely not a main attraction of Jaisalmer but can spend 15-20 minutes before the sun gets to you. People who wish to do boating can do so too.

title: beautiful scene
review: a small lake surrounded by old temple-like structures. absolutely gorgeous to visit just before sunset. don't expect much in the way of tourist infrastructure but that also comes with, well, peace.

title: Great sunset view
review: You can take boats on the lake, but you can also just go there and watch the sunset over the Jaisalmer fort, which is amazing.

title: Very pleasure time on a boat
review: We've been there when there was water in whole lake, so it was very pleasant boat ride, with nice views on the buildings around the lake. also the view of fort from the lake is magnificent, but you have to be there in the morning for good sun.

title: Beautiful
review: Man made beautiful gadisar lake .lots of people were feeding bread to  fishes in lake .we enjoyed boat ride .kids liked it lot.

title: Cat Fish!
review: To feed the cat fish in the lake is a sight I've never experienced before. Take a paddle boat out onto the lake for a relaxing time.

title: Go there in the Evening
review: Nice big lake right in middle of city. The fishes are huge & if you throw them some food they collect in 100's.

title: nice place to look around and get some great pictures
review: We had a guide take us here and give us the brief history of these, which was interesting.

title: Typical lake view
review: I was not very impressed to be honest with this place. The boating is an option here if you have kids. Apart from it I did not find it worth the money to be spent. It was quite in the evening though but I am sure during the tourist season, it is bound to be crowded taking away the only USP of this place

title: Nothing special but worth a visit
review: The lake was quite full when we visited after monsoon and is surrounded by some beautiful buildings with good views of the fort and plenty of sellers of handicraft goods.

title: Nice view
review: Was planned by Vacation trip India and went along with the tour guide. Shows the real futuristic view of our previous kings about conservation of water.

title: Beauty full place and quat
review: Relax fell .nice view of golden fort . Very near all monument of jaisalmer .but these no aney Restorent to take coffee and break fast . But nice place

title: delightful
review: feeding the enormous school of huge fish in the lake is a sheer delight. A peaceful area to spend some time pondering over the calm waters.

title: Ravishing
review: Even though being a typical lake, the time and day I visited the lake made it worthwhile. It was drizzling and the boat ride was kind of unusually enjoyable.

title: Excelent Place in the City
review: This is a well maintained Lake in the City itself , with boating facility, we have enjoyed a lot in the couple Paddle Boat available at the Lake.

title: Amazing Place!
review: This place is a beauty after desert safari. As soon as we reached here, it started raining. After half an hour, the sun was back again, a little dim this time. We enjoyed boating and eating local food items there. They say the weather keeps changing like that everyday. The best thing, The People are really good. They are the best to experience while in Rajasthan.

title: Beautiful sunset!
review: It's a beautiful place.It is calm and peaceful.One can spend some time in the evening and watch the sunset here!

title: Very pretty but busy
review: Very pretty and nice to see a lake in the desert. However very busy and Indians never seem to respect personal space here!!

title: Beauty!!
review: Peaceful and beautiful place in Jaisalmer! only the lake needs to be cleaned for a better experience!!

title: Very Photogenic
review: Nice small lake in the heart of Jaisalmer city. It is very calm and quiet place. There was a boating option too. There are some small temples around the lake. Overall the place is very photogenic, best time to visit is when the sun goes down

title: Nice spot to relax
review: I enjoyed the lake quite a bit but unfortunately there was quite a lot of litter and I was stopped for a selfie a few to many times.

title: source of drinking water in olden days
review: collects rain water and huge lake which was source of drinking water when other source was not available.now water is contaminated by tourists and used for boating which most enjoyable

title: Great Lake and Beautiful Structures
review: It is a beautiful man made Lake that serves as a lifeline for the local community for years before a canal was built. The historic structures around the lake have beautiful carvings in typical desert style. The locals are well meaning and hard working. The biggest complaint I have is the state of affairs. They have folks cleaning non stop but there is still debris around. One solution would be to charge a nominal fee (Rs. 100) to foreigners to visit the lake which can go towards education and maintenance and preserving the heritage.

title: The thar lake
review: Wow what a beauti in thar desert.before I just heard about lake.but when I am going  to there. When

title: Fantastic place
review: If you want to relaxation than go Gadsisar sager lake

title: Nice boating experience
review: We had an amazing boating experience in this place. You have a lot of stuff to do here. Feeding of ducks, fishes are one of them.

title: A beautiful sunset at Gadisar
review: Located in the heart of Jaisalmer, this lake is literally a treat to the eyes considering that it is an architectural wonder.

title: Nice place to watch the sun go down!
review: Nice lake in Jaisalmer where you can go boating and watch the sunset or just sit down and relax. The structures in the lake are intricately carved and is a good spot to visit in the evenings!

title: Visited during our 11 days of backpacking around Rajasthan.
review: A beautiful place, with lots of shade. We sat down and absorbed the atmosphere before being offered bread to feed the cat fish, a first for both of us. A lovely walk there and back from our accommodation in the fort.

title: Huge lake
review: This lake is known as gadsisar sagar and it is the best feeling to see it..

title: Gadisar Lake
review: I have been there in 2012 and had a great time with college mates. The place has its own history and to know that you must visit this place. apart from history, Bollywood shooting for a film has made this site more famous. if you are in Jaisalmer  Do visit Gadisar Lake

title: Good Talab
review: Very good tample situated on outer side of Jaisalmer on gadisar road there is very fine art on stones of tample

title: Beautiful sunset view
review: Go there at the time of sunset and experience the shadows and the reflections of the temples at the bank. Boating can be done too

title: Jaisalmer's precious waterbody
review: Though this lake is not stunningly beautiful, but one can very well understand its importance as this lake is in Desert and is in water starved city of Jaisalmer. Easily accessible and one can spend quite evening here. catfish in this lake are another attraction

title: An evening with the beautiful memories
review: I have seen my fair share of lakes but Gadsisar Sagar lake have a special place. It has a huge entrance with great work on stone and with tradition boat ride one can enjoy the scenery very well.

title: Beautiful
review: This is a very peaceful and beautiful spot. And we were really lucky because we could see it full of water. The tour guide told us that they are having a unusual rains which have benefited this situation.

title: Good
review: This leg was really great I really like this good sunset and Fort view I really like this place happy

title: good
review: good palas olde old building Good Shepherd. Full of water I like it this place you come in Jaisalmer and visit this place

title: Jaisalmer Lake
review: The lake was quite full with water. But the approach to the lake was disappointing. Only those who are interested in boating will enjoy.

title: Photogenic
review: Beautiful lake with flocks of migratory birds, paddling boats to roam around in the lake and photogenic architectural structures fab for portrait mode photography.

title: The only blue place in the yellow heaven
review: Things to do definitely in gadisar lake

title: Ordinary Lake
review: Lake in City very near to Jaisalmer. Ordinary lake. nothing new except yellow sand stone construction in lake. activities like boating is there. The only thing that you will feel surprise is lake in desert area like Jaisalmer. You can avoid if running lake of time. Nothing excited.

title: Trip to the Desert Lake
review: A lake in the heart of the desert is a beauty apart... "Chattris" reflects its architectural past... It is indeed a oasis in the desert with its cool evening breeze...  Most of you would have seen this lake in some  movies...Boating is allowed only after the rains.

title: If you have nothing else to do
review: Neat and clean ,  but not much to do other than sit by the small pond or try your hand or leg at a paddle boat

title: A lake in the middle of the city.
review: A lake built in the 15th century to provide water to the city , it is now a spot where tourists go for boating.

title: Nice Place to spend the Evening!!!
review: Want to spend the evening at leisure then visit Gadsisar Lake. It's a beautiful lake surrounded by temples. You can relax siting at the boundaries or even enjoy a boat ride.

title: Nice
review: Small lake. Nice but nothing very special. Pleasant place to sit and rest by the water especially in the heat

title: Nothing more than a pond in shambles
review: The lake is nothing more than a pond which is in a bad state; the few structures in the middle of the pond are in a state neglect.

title: Beautiful
review: Go! Is one of the few attractions away from the bustling citadel and surrounding village. Get yourself a good guide to enjoy this beautiful city.

title: One of Romantic Lake of Rajasthan
review: Gadsisar Lake is one of the major tourist attractions of Jaisalmer. Gadsisar Lake was a water conversation tank built in 1400 AD, and was constructed under the reign of Maharwal Gadsi Singh.

title: Large man made lake
review: Reached Gadsisagar Lake around 1.30pm under scorching sun. The waiting boats were tempting us for a boat ride but hot sun stopped us. A young boy was selling bread loaves for feeding the fish, which we found a wrong thing to do as these make these fish too big. This man made lake is giving water for this town.

title: Big fishes
review: This lake is very beautiful  as it is full of sand stone chatries  and famous for its big cat fishes  thousand of fishes. U must see this place

title: near the Sonar Kella
review: Gadi Sagar Lake is 1 km away from the fort. It is a man-made tank built around 1367 AD. Temples, shrines and chhatris are dotted around the lake.

title: Lake in the dry town of Jaisalmer
review: Gadsisar lake is an artificial lake built in 14th century to conserve rain water and provide a source of water for the residents of the dry town of Jaisalmer.  This lake is very beautiful with several small islands and temples/structures within the lake.  Within the lake and on the bank of the lake several structures of yellow sandstone can be seen which are beautifully designed.The lake has boating facility which can be enjoyed.

title: Nothing Exciting
review: I was not really over thrilled after seeing the lake u may have much more big and beautiful lake in your own city,but oky to visit once when you are in Jaisalmer city tour.

title: Amazing lake
review: Once again i talk about Jaisalmer the famous lake GADISER with is best for tourism and best for photo shoot. It is historical place or look was awesome when sun rise & sun set moment appear. It's really beauty of real nature..

title: Gadiser
review: A memory with friends and this place is superb for travel & for fun . It's a place where you can feel the nature or superb place for awesome photoshoot.....

title: Good location of sunset
review: Good location  to see the sunset point.  Must see location of jaisalmer  city.  Enjoyed a lot lovely  place

title: Good sunset views
review: Giid sunset views, boating, good photographic views, clean water. Not a must visit place, but you can pass time here.

title: Exquisite!
review: There is a boating facility! However all I did was take a nap on the terrace under the banyan tree. Peaceful

title: Evening Time Lake
review: Gadsisar Sagar lake was Drinking water lake of City. Now it is boating place and evening walk place. Place maintained very well and visit if u have extra time

title: Decent place to spend time with your family and witness the sun set.
review: Could have been a greater tourist attraction, had it been well maintained. Personally I felt that this place has been ignored and hence this statement. Boating activities are not on par with the expected standards. However, you do have a lot of walking to be done if you want to see the place around as it is really vast.

title: Pleasant at evening time
review: Its a small lake. Right time to visit is sunset time. When you get the right light for click thr pic and get to see a lot of birds.

title: Romantic Evening with Your Wife
review: Well we went around 4 in the evening, took a self driven paddle boat. Experience was so great it can't be describe in words. Place is romantic, I am sure if you go with your wife she will be happily smiling while paddling the forceful paddle of boat experience with the touch of the clean and mesmerising environment. While paddling you will across various ancient structures. Do not try to climb or approach the structures as they have been weakened with lake water and weather. Buy a bread packet and one by one breaking the bread into pieces throw them in the lake, you will see magic. Lots of moustache long big fishes gonna come out to fight for the bread you giving them. In the end take a walk on the corner of the river sit back enjoy the sun-set, and complete your tiring day, by going back to the hotel.

title: Nice lake with scenic view
review: This place I saw in Swades movie. From then onwards, I tired of visiting. after long effort, I could able to visit this place.

title: Awesome lake
review: This lake is good place and we seen lots of fish in it and also we feed them. Love to see a lake in rajishthan

title: Nice place visit at evening
review: Gadisar lake is one of the best part in jaisalmer seedsing..best timing visit evening 5 to 6 pm winter period

title: Evening activity !
review: This is a nice place to visit in the evening. they have Aarti on the bank of the lake in the evening. also you can witness a nice sunset from here. the chhatris and jharokhas provide a nice photo op.

title: Beautiful Lake - Relief from the scorching heat
review: A popular local hangout, mainly famous for its peaceful environment and a break from the hot desert heat. Major pass-times here are feeding the giant catfishes and paddle boating. Good place to get relieved from the scorching heat of the desert city.

title: Just another Lake
review: If you have seen some good lakes in your life of travel then please avoid it as much as you can. As except for boating there is nothing much interesting to see or do.

title: Good
review: Good to see old type of Lake. Only attraction to offer eatable items to so many big fishes of this lake

title: So beautiful
review: This is a not to miss attraction in the Golden city of Jaisalmer.  It's an artificial lake with several small islands and temple in yellow sandstone in it.  Boating facility is available in the lake. You get to spots few birds in and around the lake.  There are also several monuments on the lake bank which could be visited.

title: Ideal after a busy day
review: This small  lake with its various temple islands is a nice sight and quiet place for relaxation after a busy day in town.

title: A lake in the desert
review: Jaisalmer is a part of the Great Thar Desert which gets rainfall only once in 5 years and has scarcity of water.  This lake was built by Rawal Gadsi Singh in 14th Century to conserve rain water.  This lake was the main source of water for Jaisalmer city for several years.  The lake is located in a scenic surrounding. You can see temples around the lake, islands in the lake with small temples on it and shrubs and hills at a distance towards the horizon.  Boat facility is available in the lake.

title: Pleasant boat ride
review: The structure in the middle of the lake is good. The boat ride was very pleasant. My son enjoyed the sight of ducks in the lake.

title: Beautiful lake of Desert
review: We visited this beautiful quite lake of Jaisalmer which was nice nice experience. It was nice moment to boating in the lake afternoon

title: Interesting for a walk round
review: Nice to walk to/around, didn't take boat but you can If want . Saw some people feeding catfish, also lots of birds,

title: Nice calm place for evening.
review: I went here in the evening. Its a nice calm place to sit, relax and enjoy the night creeping in to Jaisalmer. There is boating facility here which i did not opt for. Nothing as such to do here but still a not-to-be-missed location. look at the pics and you will understand why...!!

title: Lake
review: The lake is surrounded by many architectural structures and is a good visit in the evenings. Kids would love seeing and feeding the fish here.

title: Goden stone temples on the edge of lake in desert.
review: Gadisar sagar lake is one of attractions in jaisalmer city. Golden stone temples and 'ghat'are there. Boating is also avaailable. Its awesome to see this lake having big water storage  in the desert.

title: Nice lake
review: If you have time, you may visit Gadisar lake in Jaisalmer. Please try to visit this lake in afternoon or before evening.

title: Peaceful lake
review: It is located near jaisalmer fort. This lake build with yellow sandstone and best part of lake is that this is artificial lake.

title: An Average Place
review: Its simply an average place that can be skipped if you have been to more beautiful bodies of water...

title: Journey
review: Awesome Gadisar lake &

title: Beautiful lake by the road
review: Nice scenic beauty. Pleasant evenings. Temple on the side. Ambiance is excellent. One roadside tea stall nearby.

title: Amazing lake....
review: if you are in jaisalmer then you cant just go away like without visiting this place. Beautiful scenery and rajasthani architecture memorials inside the lake. there are many options for boating in here like if you are big group of 10 or so you can prefer an 11 seater boat or if you a nuclear family or 3 or 5 members or so then you can book a 5 seater or a 3 seater boat. Also there are paddle boats available for couples.We had visited this place at around 3 or 4'o clock in the afternoon. i will like to prefer you to visit this place in the evenings when there is special laser and lighting. Also outside there are many photographers where you can click photos and that too in traditional rajasthani clothes. Really an adorable lake of Rajasthan.

title: Peace and Charm
review: We visited Gadsisar Sagar Lake the day after we arrived in Jaisalmer. We had been traveling for around 48 hours so we're wrecked and needed some peace and quiet. We had walked into Jaisalmer town centre in the morning which had done nothing to relax us! In the late afternoon we took a Tuk-Tuk from our hotel to the lake and immediately relaxed. The area around the entrance has a number of shops and stalls selling food, drink and the usual sort of tourist offerings but all appear to be of reasonable quality and the vendors themselves were relatively relaxed. Around the lake there are plenty of areas where you can sit and relax and watch people getting on and off the boats.

title: Nice Moment at Lakeside
review: Most impressive to me were the little temple to the left of the ghat and the devotional activities.

title: Peaceful
review: It is one of the most peaceful and beautiful places in jaisalmer. The view of the lake gives a calmness .

title: Nothing special
review: There is catfishes inside. You can feed the fish and also go boating around the lake. Paddle boats are available but nothing special.

title: Catfish lake
review: This lake very famous for Catfish development.

title: Beautiful lake in a dry land
review: This is a beautiful lake located within a range of 2-3 Kilometers from Jaisalmer fort.  There are several monuments on the lake shore and within the small islands in the lake.  This is an artificial lake built to act as store house for rain water.  Boating facility is available in the lake.  This lake set up in a surrounding of all monuments built in yellow sandstone offers several spectacular views.

title: First time
review: Most awesome and lovely place of jaiselmer, very quiet and calm... loved it during the sunrise and the sunset. Nice spot for taking pictures.

title: Awesome
review: A man-made water reservoir, the Gadisar Lake was once the only source of water in Jaisalmer. Constructed by the first ruler of Jaisalmer

title: Beautiful...
review: Was a great visit on a hot sunny day.. feeding such huge cat fishes was a great experience at the lake..

title: Beautiful Sunset and Calming Experience
review: This lake is best lake when compared to lakes at udaipur, saputara and mahabaleshwar.  Very Calm and beautiful. it has these monument built in it. they add to the beauty. there is ample place to sit and relax and the access road is beautifully made. the pedal boat is also good @ rs  50 person.  make sure you go there much before sunset to get good pics. there are lost of fishes in the lake which gather near you if you feed them something. its good for kids. there are 100s of big cat fishes .  there is a also a dargah and a temple nearbuy.

title: Sunset
review: Gadsisar Lake is a nice place to go for sunset and to take some pictures. At the lake there were men feeding huge amounts of catfish and they gave me some of their bread so I could feed them too. A bit dirty from people not using garbage cans, but not anything abnormal for India.

title: A artificial but nice lake
review: It's artificial small but Good lake in the heart of city.Ghats are built and entry have a beautiful gate and lake is surrounded by many temples.

title: DIFFERENT EXPERIANCE
review: When one travels to Jiasalmer, expectations are of Desert only but this Lake brings a relief to the thought of heat in the city. Its a beautiful small artificial lake to visit. The best experiance feeding the fishes with breads. Breads are sld outside the Lake itself at a very nominal price.

title: Gadsisar Lake
review: Beautiful lake with boat ride facilities in the evening.Very near to the fort .Not much to see.We went in the afternoon so it was very hot.

title: Beautiful spot
review: This small artificial lake with beautiful buildings near and in it is a gem. You can take a boat or you can feed multiple and huge cat fish. Amazing location!

title: Nice spot for a short stop
review: Nice spot for a short stop if you are staying in Jaisalmer. Count 15 minutes to take a short walk and some pictures.

title: Boating
review: Very nice boating in a the lake sunset was very nice to visualise there is a mathaji temple in the midst of the lake and the lake carries a history behind it

title: Evening time pass
review: Located in the center of the city, this lake has boating facilities and fish feeding. The fish are dark, ugly and forever hungry so don't expect too much joy in the feeding. Boat ride is OK with a variety of options at all price ranges.

title: Nice to visit for 30min-1h
review: We were here for 30 minutes at sunrise and it was very peaceful. Good views. If you are in Jaisalmer, it's definitely worth a visit.

title: Evening serenity
review: Located 15 mins from the fort, do go to the lake to save yourself from the harsh sun. Man-made lake with huge catfishes inside. You can feed the fish and also go boating around the lake. Paddle boats are available. It'll help you pass the time before your bus.

title: Short visit but worth it!
review: This isn't a place you want to stay for long, their isn't really much to do but take in the wonderful site. It's a short walk from the entrance, we were dropped off by our driver and just told to walk a couple minutes till we bumped into the lake. There are some stairs to the right, immediately before the ramps were some small boats leave to tour the lake, that lead to a nice view. The lake is very dirty, a very sad thing to see, but there is something very magical about it, especially during the sunset hours.

title: Great location to enjoy evening time
review: Ideal stop to enjoy your evening on your first night at Jaisalmer. Enjoy music played by local singer. Enjoy Boat ride and just sit quietly and enjoy your evening.

title: Cute little lake. Locals go there to relax too
review: Small reservoir for the town, I think. Free, unless you want to take a boat and go on the lake.

title: An oasis a short wa Fort Jaisalmer
review: You don't need a tuktuk to get to this surprising feature of Jaisalmer. It's a twenty minute walk down from the Fort through a residential neighborhood with its commercial center where you can get the local ice cream or have chai. The lake is surrounded by temples and accessible by stairs and walk ways. Very pretty and romantic. A real oasis in the desert. The legend about this place involves a maharajah's courtesan who was persecuted and found refuge here and built a small palace out of gratitude.

title: No guide needed
review: This is just a lovely relaxing place to wander and enjoy the aesthetics... you can actually walk all round the lake in about an hour and some of the best photo points are opposite the entrance, across the water.

title: Great in the morning or evening time
review: Such a good place to visit , reflection on water , quiet and very good light for pic when sunrise or sunset

title: Nice Serene lake
review: Visited Lake in early morning and views of sun rise were excellent from here. One of the important tourist attraction of Jaisalmer.

title: A normal lake and no much amazing
review: This lake is very near to Jaisalmer fort. We could not see much water in the lake, but could understand the ideas of kings who took water to the desert. We had brought breads and grains to feed the fishes in the lake. We enjoyed feeding it and that was very lively. It's not a hyper experience for us in the lake, which had little things to do.

title: Catfish and a quiet boat ride
review: This lake is easy to access by road, abundant in catfish and interspersed with a few chattars which are good to photograph. I wish they could add some nice lights to make it all look far more beautiful in the evenings. Feed the catfish, sit at the bank for some time, take a quiet boat ride and you would have spent a calm 2 hours here. Visit evening time, before dark and when it is cooler

title: Sunset at Gadsisar Lake
review: The sunset view at Gadsisar lake is very beautiful. Boating facility is also available there. One can sit back and enjoy the beauty of the surrounding area.

title: Enjoyable boat ride...
review: A scenic rain water lake & is full of Catfish. Tourists can take boat rides in the lake which is enjoyable experience.

title: Very nice pic
review: The picture is very very nice. We didnt take the boat because the lake is disgusting. Indian people are so dirty so we didnt fancy get the risk of getting something.

title: Short stop here on way to fort
review: Cat fish were ready to be fed bread which was bought at a nearby stall. Jumping everywhere, fun to see. The worst part for me was the plastic bottles which were floating around in and amongst the fish. I hate the was rubbish is discarded in the streets, now today spoiling the beautiful lake

title: Beautiful at sunset
review: If you have the time, you can walk to the lake from the Fort.  It wasn't so busy when we were there, there are lots of photo opportunities to be had.  Indians out on pedalos and row boats.  Stunning

title: Average place to visit!!!
review: It was just an ordinary place and good for a boating in evening. Nothing special about it. They hv both pedal and rowing boats ( pulled by oars)....

title: Peaceful and serene
review: We visited the lake during our Jaisalmer trip and it was pleasant. A quiet and peaceful setting, not very crowded, a folk artist was playing his musical instrument which added to the charm.

title: "Great sunset opportunity"
review: Gadsisar Sagar Lake is a popular place Indian tourists and locals visit to capture the afternoon sunset.

title: Supb historic lake
review: Awsm palace with its history must visit that palace  some handicrafts items were available there and boating facilities are available

title: Good lake
review: It's welcome sight to see a lake in desert. few islands in between are good sight. its not disable friendly.  Very limited parking.

title: exactly as shown in pictures
review: if you have time then go and visit, not worth it for sunny days, nothing much to do there. Its exactly as shown in the pictures.

title: Small lake to visit for boating
review: Its a small lake with boating facility. You can feed fishes with breads available. A good evening hangout.

title: Dilapidated and dirty
review: This was near our hotel so we went for a walk around the lake, which didn't have much water in it although there were some Indian families boating there. The whole area around the lake is littered with broken beer bottles which makes walking anywhere apart from the step area, extremely hazardous. There is also loads of rubbish everywhere, despite which, it is a picturesque setting in the evening light. However, it's not worth making a special trip to see.

title: Must visit between 4-6pm
review: Amazing place to visit specially between 4-6pm during Desert festival, Jaisalmer. One can enjoy great view of sun going down while boating in the lake along with some birds swirling around the old monuments in lake.

title: Nice
review: Our group visit to  jaisalmer  we visit this place it was good if are you go midal of the lack so are You See beautiful  jaisalmer fort it is nice but not much clean

title: I like it.
review: Very beautiful lake..

title: Its okay
review: Cant say much about this place. Its a small lake where you can hire a boat (starting Rs.100 for 2 people) to see a few structures on the sides and middle of the lake. We didn't take the boat, just took a few pictures and left. There are some souvenirs shops on the lane to the lake and some local shops and cafes. Don't account more than 30 to 45 minutes here.

title: Small and dirty lake
review: Gadsisar Sagar or Gadisar Lake is a small lake in Jaisalmer. A lot has been written about it but in actual its quite a small lake like any other lakes in any small city. There are boating options of paddle and row boats here. Lot of birds do visit here. Surrounding area is quite dirty and a lot need to be done beautify the area. May be one time visit recommended at max.

title: Best place in Jaisalmer to relax
review: Best place in town to spend some time and relax. There is no entry fee or time limit here. Morning or evening would be a good time. In our 2 days stay in Jaisalmer we visited this lake 3 times. The entry gate to the lake called Tilon Ka Pol is an architectural beauty.

title: Mesmerising
review: Lake and its history will take your breath away. Take a boat ride or just sit back and watch sunset. Lake will bring calm to you.

title: Amazing place to visit in morning
review: Mornings are serene around the lake with less crowd and photogenic reflections of the temple structures on water. Beautiful architecture, you can stroll around the lake or take a boat and enjoy a good view from the lake

title: Best place for sunrise
review: If you are a camera buff don't neglect this beautiful place. Try to reach here in the early morning before sunrise. There is a famous puppet show in the evening in this complex.

title: Amazing place
review: Sisar Sagar lake is the best place to view the Sunrise and Sunset. Dont forget to go to the campus and see the puppet show in the evening.

title: Good
review: What's really nice wonderful explain good boating I request this place good location clean thank you so much

title: Nothing Special
review: Nothing special, time pass for locals. It is very crowded some time for boating and the lake is not very scenic.

title: Rajasthan tour with Taj Mahal
review: The lake is extremely beautiful! The local culture is show cased well along the pathways towards the lake. The surroundings should be kept maintained a bit more but overall a wonderful attraction for tourists!

title: Nice place
review: Beauty full place. good see sunrise.nise carvings. good for boating.also very romantic in evening .Thank you

title: A lake with tales to tell
review: Lake Gadisar, is a beautiful and historical lake. It has tales to tell, it is not an oasis but a water conservation tank made around 1400 A.D. by the then maharaja of Jaisalmer, Maharwal Gadsi Singh. This lake acted as the water reservoir to the entire golden city.

title: peaceful sunset point
review: we took a nice evening walk around, watched sunset and the boats sailing on the lake, got to the peninsula in the middle of the lake and watched evening prayers in the temple there.

title: Beautiful lake and architecture
review: We visited the lake in early morning hours. Still could find tourists around. The guide gave us nice info about the lake. Its a plesant place to be. I am in love wit the Shiva Temple there.

title: Good place
review: Lake in desert much surprise for us. When we visited we feel a good place and very well maintained we enjoyed boat ride

title: Gadsisar Sagar Lake
review: Water in Rajasthan..yes that could be the main reason to visit this place, specially when u r in Jaisalmer. Udaipur has many big lakes but don't compare when u r in Jaisalmer. This is a place you may visit during afternoon and have a boat ride. After that you can visit local markets like Gandhi Chowk etc to buy Jaisalmer products and have dinner at Trio before you go back to your hotel. This is best when you reach Jaisalemer around lunch time, and don't want to explore more because you are tired. This could be your very first day tour plan from afternoon. Not much to see in this lake but one can enjot water boating and relax on the day.

title: Amazing place
review: Another amazing place to visit in jaisalmer. Insaw this place in one of the movie and wanted to witness my self. Its quite and ppl around are good. Like the way they feed the fishes with bread crumbs. I also took an opportunity to feed some.

title: Worth a visit
review: One must go here if in jaisalmer . The architecture is beautiful , built in the middle of the lake , u have some ducks and fish to feed also . U can rent a boat and paddle along .

title: It was nice
review: It was a nice trip around the lake. I was by myself so I helped my boat guide peddle in the water. I tried to get off the boat and jump on top of one of the temples in the lake but found out I was not allowed. So for anyone expecting to take pictures from one of the monuments in the lake you are mistaken. Other then that, there is a beautiful view when you are drifting in the center of the lake. I believe it's a must see and don't forget to tip your boat guide, give him at least 200 rupees, he is working really hard to ferry you guys around this massive lake.

title: Good and peaceful!
review: The Environment is great. Peaceful and you could sit for hours. We reached quite late so could not do boating.

title: Must visit place
review: Beautiful scene while boating.

title: Fishes
review: Good big lake. Not well maintained. Boats are easily available. Lots of cat fishes in this lake. Good place for kids. Sunset view is amazing. It's in the heart of the city.

title: Beautiful entrance to a lake
review: Bit crowded, way too dirty. Can be beautiful if cleanliness is maintained. This could become popular as it is the only lake here in a desert. It should be charged for entry. Minimum Rs. 15/- and the whole pathway can be a walk to remember.

title: A place you must be while in Jaisalmer. .
review: I have gone during sunset and also early in the morning. The view across the lake and the activities around it in the evening always been very attractive. You can have a nice view of the Fort from a view point nearby in the first rays of Sun.

title: Worth to visit
review: Calm and nice. Artificial lake built up by needs in desert.

title: Beautiful scenery
review: Worth visiting - surroundings offer kind of tranquility and its beauty will make you remember it for a long time.

title: Peaceful and coloured
review: Is a place where many Indian tourists are. Colourful and peaceful at the same time.

title: Calm and peaceful
review: Sitting and watching the sunset over this lake feels so good. They even have boat rides. So many photography opportunities. A must visit. It's few blocks down the fort.

title: Golden Colored Lake
review: We had gone to Lake around sunset. We did boating at the sunset time, so the whole area was actually a golden shade and looked beautiful. Lakes had fish n ducks, so fed them bread (available there only) A pleasant short visit.

title: Enchanting!
review: It is a very pretty place. The fact of hvng such a big lake in the midst of the dessert is awesome. Looks very familiar, perhaps coz must hv seen in umpteen movies.

title: Big Fish!!!!!!Wow
review: Superb Big fish you will find here....dont miss it, the peaceful and so natural lake. But please dont throw waste here.

title: Beautiful Lake in Jaisalmer surrounded by History
review: This is one of the best parts of Jaisalmer as this man made Lake was the only source of water for the city in historic times and Royal family used to spend time here with platform for cultural programs and dance on one end and two structures within the centre of lake each for Men and Women to sit and entertain. Boating facility is offered to experience the beauty and looks beautiful during the evening time. Some of the structure inside the lake are damaged due to natural disasters however still standing to tell the history. Remember to shop local stuff on your way out with a bargain.

title: Great Gadsisar Lake
review: A worth visit place in City of Jaisalmer. We enjoyed boating there in late evening. The location is also very good. You can find a lot of hotels near the lake. Structures inside the lake also looks amazing.

title: Lake in the desert
review: Its a pleasant surprise to find a lake in the desert. We took a boat ride at sun set and had a most wonderful experience.

title: An Amazing Point to Relax and Spend the Evening
review: Pros:

title: Golden city
review: Whilst our view of the lake was wrapped in mist it showed off the yellow sandstone which nicknames Jaisalmer as the Golden City. Look out for the fish being fed from the ghats, the rowing boats and then enjoy acrobatic children dancing for Rupees.

title: good sunset point
review: View was good but lake was in bad shape...kids loved ducks and feeding bread to fishes..dont miss puppet show nearby

title: Tourism has spoilt the beauty
review: Had visited the lake back in 2006 when it was much less crowded. In January there is a whole rush of tourists which has spoilt the natural beauty of the lake. Floating packets of chips and bread ( used to feed the huge cat fish in the water) make the place dirty. There are whole lot of shops selling local rajasthani stuff and food stalls at the entry point to the lake. There is no entry fees.

title: Nice lake.
review: Good view. If you have time, do visit. Only tourists around when we visited. The structures in the lake look beautiful, like most stone carvings in Jaisalmer.

title: Amazing Artificial Rainwater lake
review: There are numerous shrines and small temples on the embankment of this lake.The main attractions of the lake are the different species of birds,which migrate from distinct places.There was also a gateway located near the lake.

title: Another lake to soften the desert atmosphere
review: We arrived early and it was very misty which added to the charm of this lake. The entrance is interesting and then you see the platforms for the maharaja and the women to enjoy the cool water breeze and the events that take place.

title: Its good for boating
review: Its only good for boating and cost INR 100 per person or INR 500 per boat .

title: Tourists
review: Nice walk and good for photographers, no need guides

title: Very small lake
review: We did not spend more than 10 minutes in the lake area , as it was a very small . May be because we visited this place after visit to Udaipur , the city of lakes

title: Nice
review: This lake was so super there in jaisalmer .never forget there camp was always look same tipes this lake near mney people leaving there .thay always give for desert camp package be care ful there direct look interesting

title: Rainwater conservation mechanism
review: This is an artificial lake built in 14th Century by Maharwal Gadsi from whose name the Lake's name is derived. The objective behind constructing this lake was to preserve rain water to be used by the people of Jaisalmer town.  Jaisalmer is a dry place and part of the Thar Desert. It receives very less rainfall and this lake was a mechanism in the past to conserve the rain water.  The lake is very beautiful and has temples within it.  There are palatial structures along the lake shore. Sand dunes and shrubs can be seen in the distant shore of the lake. Boating facility is available in the lake.  Boating in the lake while the sun is setting is a mesmerizing experience.

title: Peaceful, like a dream
review: A beautiful place, out of a dream. The lake and the constructions are incredible and like everything in aindia, it is colorful and lively.

title: Lake view during sun set
review: It was great always visiting this lake during evening time for boating and sun set view. I always enjoyed activity at this lake.

title: Lovely place
review: Lovely place to relax and go for a walk. you can also hire a boat there. water quality is very bad as almost everywhere in Rajasthan ;-(

title: It has lost its ancient flavour
review: It was nice and charming when i saw it in chilhood. now it just lost its heritage in modernization. nothing great left there.

title: Nice lake for boating with your family...
review: After visiting the Fort and various havelies in Jaislamer, this lake is the nice place to spend some relaxing time with your family in a very peaceful atmosphere.  Go for boating; there are lot of fish; you can feed them.  Evening is the best time to be there.

title: Lovely afternoon, Shikara ride
review: It's a great place to spent a few hours after lunch on a winter day! We took a shikara out for a ride in the lake, or you can opt for a pedal boat. Either ways, it's a great experience!

title: Nice lake
review: Hotel staff recomand me to visit Lake in Evening.

title: Peaceful and full of cultural heritage
review: we went there late evening and it was pretty crowded. As soon as u board the boat and get in the middle of the lake, it feels soothing. Prakash, the boat man was rowing our boat and happily answered all our questions we were firing on him about the lake and surroundings. He was quite friendly and informative.  Had a good 30-35 minutes in the boat under the stars. Finish the boat ride and shop for the souvenirs if u want. This place has a lot of shops in the vicinity.

title: All about money
review: The guides and pundits force you by guilt to shell out money for poojas even if you don't want to do them ..... not nice

title: Boat ride at sunset!
review: Quaint little lake with good boating facility in the middle of town. Can't believe it's man made and built in 1300s. Great place to be during sunset.

title: Sunset
review: Good spot for watching the sun go down. Tuk Tuk cost was 50 rupees for all 5 of us from the Fort area one way. There boats for hire but unsure of pricing.

title: Peaceful
review: Nice little local lake that's easy to find and get to. A few shopping and food stalls on your way in. A peaceful lake area in which to sit and enjoy or have a boat ride. By a loaf of bread and feed the catfish

title: Lake
review: Pleasant sight to eyes, boating is good, water in Desert is surely a welcome sight, traditional architecture. Historical significance of how the main gate wes constructed with Krishna temple on top

title: Picturesque lake
review: So serene and beautiful lake, which is manmade. The architectural structure in the middle made it so picturesque. We went in the morning, fog with hue of sunlight made it divine. Colorful boats in the foreground gives you beautiful view and photographic element! Must see.

title: Scenic
review: Scenic lake. Nice architect around the lake. But the water is dirty and the paddle boat was a horror to be in. The life jacket gave me the creeps. Pl so something . Charge more for the boats but make them neat and leak proof.

title: Gadisar Lake
review: Gadisar lake is good sight for boating and see sun set point in the evening. It is nearby railway station and easy to go by anyway.

title: boating and beutiful view
review: this is the place where you can find peace and golden reflected view of buildings in lake. A place where you can enjoy boating.

title: Catfish & Pedal boating
review: If you want to take some time-off from your sightseeing schedule visit this place. Pedal boating can be done. Plenty of catfish in lake. 5 mins from here there is kathputli show mostly in afternoon.

title: Must for Paddle Boating & Sunset view!
review: Best place to enjoy sunset ridding a boat! You can also feed many catfishes and ducks in the lake! Overall view of temples nearby is astonishing.

title: Wow Romantic Boating
review: Many movies has been shot on this location and it's very beautiful at the time of evening where u can see the best sunset in jaisalmer.

title: Good lake with fishes
review: Good to see a lake in middle of Desert. Boat riding and fish feeding are the activities which can be looked for. nothing much else there.

title: Fantastic view of fish in the lake
review: Beautiful view of the lake with resting places inside. The temple just beside the lake carries beutiful carvings as expected in Rajasthan. Cluster of fish in the lake is an added attraction.

title: Lake amidst desert but needs facelift
review: Little artificial lake amidst the arid landscape but needs a serious facelift as garbage are strewn at few places.

title: Precious lake for Jaisalmer
review: All Jaisalmer depends on this lake's water. Its also open for boating for tourists. and there is parking very small only for 5 to 7 cars. so no need to go by your own car if you have driver then its ok.

title: Beautiful lake
review: It's great place to visit with family and friend. We had great fun. There is boating with small and big boat option.

title: Poorly maintained
review: The boundary wall damaged.The water is very polluted and green ,foul smelling.Few boats without life guard.It is just a small stagnant water pool of 150sqmt

title: Soothing Experience
review: Must try boating. We went there in February so it was cold but worth it. Small traditional market outside the lake area. Great temple architecture to see. Recommended to visit.

title: Boating experience is good
review: Book a boat and enjoy the boating in the Gadisar lake. A place for couples to feed fish and ducks around.

title: Shocking
review: Lake could have been a lot better with some maintenance. Poor management, polluted water, no health and safety of tourists considered.

title: As the sun sets
review: Lovely place to take a boatride and feed the cat fish. Since we visited as the sun set we had a lovely romantic experience. The opposite bank of the lake is poorly maintained and could be done up. The buildings where the queen and her friends spent time causes one to visualise how interesting it may have been. As the red glow of the setting sun reflected on the waters one could imagine the royal family revelling in its glory. At the entrance you can get yourself photographed in traditional Rajasthani attire or buy something to take home as a memento.

title: gadisar lake is picturesque
review: nice lake with good architectural structures in the middle, boat ride we did not go,  fossil garden nothing is there, when we went december, it was hot, go with hats or umbrellas

title: Picturesque and a photographer's must.
review: Stunning views of the lake and the pavilions make this a photographer's dream with the tranquil water reflecting serene views.

title: Not much happening
review: Some crumbling historic buildings on a waterfront, rowboating available.  We spent 5 min here and left.  You can stop by if it's on the way somewhere, but would not make a trip for this.

title: A boat ride
review: A must do at Jaisalmer. Go hire a boat and pedal around for a while.

title: Not well maintained
review: The pictures look more beautiful than the actual place but had it been well maintained it could have been a very good attraction. Few monuments are available both within and beside the lake. Boating is available. On major attraction for kids is to feed fishes in the lake. There are lot of fishes in the cat fish category and they all swarm in the area where you provide food.

title: Great boat ride
review: Lovely lake. There are pedal boats available. Kids enjoyed the pedal boat ride. Would suggest boat ride in the morning or late afternoon. Can be every hot in the afternoon.

title: Fog gives a magical feel
review: We went on a foggy morning, which gives the place a magical feel. Try go early when there are less people. There is an interesting Hindu temple too. Look out for the masses of catfish that live in this very polluted lake.

title: Not worth the visit
review: The lake is too crowded with people and it is difficult to get a proper view. Did not go for the boat ride as well. The place was very crowded

title: Beautiful place
review: It was very nice to see a lake in desert area.although the water was not clear.There is boating facility. The place is very nice for photography

title: Just an average lake
review: If you have nothing to do, it's ok to visit. If it is maintained well it would have been great. The boats there looked terrible. There was a lot of feeding of some kind of fish in the lake. Frankly I would skip it.

title: Peaceful place for boating
review: I visited this lake in december, 2016 with family and friends. We had planned to view the sun set while boating in the lake. Though there was rush and a long waiting time. We somehow managed to view the sunset as we got the boat just on time. Well the view was nice. One can relax on the boat while seeing the sun going down the horizon. Its a small lake but water was clean. One piece of advice if somebody wants to view the sun set he must reach the lake atleast one hour in advance or he/she may miss it while waiting for turn in the queue.

title: Good scenic view, ignore the shores!
review: Beautiful once you start boating, on the shores it is a bit unclean but it does not smell bad. It has beautiful view on all sides. Good at both times - morning and evening.

title: Very dirty and underwhelming
review: When we went there (at noon) there were a lot of people at the spot and the whole place was dirty. And the lake is very disappointing.

title: enjoyed boating
review: we have enjoyed boating at gadisar lake. well maintained also enjoyed the local rajasthani music atlake

title: Good for a nice short stopover
review: If you get bored of the desert and the fort, you can head to this small and quiet lake. You can find people feeding catfishes on the boundary of the lake. Boating is also an option but it should be avoided in bright sunshine.

title: Wonderful
review: Jaisalmer is a must see place. One cannot visit India without spending time in Jaisalmer. The lake view is wonderful, like paradise scene

title: Worth a visit
review: A good place where you can carry some bread (also available at site) to feed the cat fish. It is a good sight for fish lovers to see the cat fish come close to the shore to eat the bread given out.

title: Nice place in middle of desert city.
review: Gadisagar lake is cool place for family visit. You can spend hours along the banks of this lake. Boat ride is good but a bit tiring.

title: Nice Lake
review: You can just view the lake. there is no point of doing a boat ride in this lake. On you way take a few snaps

title: Relaxing
review: Nice lake to relax/boat after a tiresome day. Its around 2-3 kms from the Jaisalmer fort.

title: An average lake
review: As there is nothing much to do in the city it is better to do boating in this lake during sunset time.You will not repent it.

title: Only lake with water in Jaisalmer
review: This is the only lake in Jaisalmer having water, rest other lake mentioned are totally dry.

title: Must visit place for boating and puppet show
review: Located near fort, good for boating in evening, very peaceful place.. but the main attraction is not the lake.. its the Puppet show which happens daily in evening just opposite to lake gate..

title: Good view
review: The views of the lake is nice. However, I observed lot of plastic of bread packets thrown around the lake steps. No one cares about cleanliness here and its horrible to see such a beautiful place like this spoilt by public apathy.

title: Beautiful place to be during the sunset.
review: We just went to this lake because we had nothing else to do. But, we were so glad to be there, enjoying our boating and watching the sun set and birds flying back to their home. Do not take a guide. It is more a place to just sit back and enjoy a boat ride. And if you happen to be a photographer, it is the place to be.

title: Nice Lake
review: Nice place for boating and amazing view of sunset . The lake is surrounded by two main temples first is of Lord Shiva and the other is of Lord Krishna.

title: Good place to visit for feed fish and boating
review: This is good place to feed bread to fish over there. Fishes are very big in size.

title: Loitering Lake
review: I had no plan of boating on the lake, until Gen said it's 100 for 2. And we went. It was enthralling as we spent so much time together chitchatting on the boat and simply letting it flow on its own. But yes each boat can b taken for 35 min.s

title: sunset is pictureseque
review: the beauty is the presence of lake admist a desert arrea.

title: Boring
review: There is nothing different that you can expect from a lake. The view is ok. Boats are of low quality.

title: Average lake with good sunset views
review: We found only two things worth doing - boating and watching sunset!

title: nice place to visit
review: its amazing lake in the heart of the city and easily reachable and nice fun in boating and seeing the historical monuments

title: Beautiful lake with amazing boating experience!
review: This lake is a must visit. We saw ducks, cranes and turtles in the lake! The boating experience in simply beautiful and it is totally inexpensive. Do take ur goggles along and it is best if visited early in the morning. :)

title: Fine place to rest
review: This is a huge water expanse in the heart of the city. It has many mythical stories behind it. The passage towards the lake is crowded by shops attracting tourists.  The prices are however irrational. The lake has a boating facility of various types. A must see place in these arid lands..

title: Its more of a pond than a lake
review: Its more of a pond than a lake.

title: good to see
review: It is just on the road, and in eve while you may have free time you can go on foot. Maintanace is pooor

title: loved it
review: visit the lake in the evening during sunset after visiting patron ki haveli by auto. take a boat ride which is awesome. feed the huge fishes some bread which they sell over there .kids will love it. some great photographic points there.you can see the fort with sunset view.a movie location.many movies made here.

title: Boat ride
review: Yea yea I did boat ride enjoyed the beautiful view of this place and the architecture i was feeling like a king for a while . so good to visit this place.

title: Nice lake
review: We visited this lake around sunset. It is a nice place to relax after a full day of sight seeing. Pedal boats are available for a good price and you could hire them to enjoy a pleasant ride in the lake.

title: The only water source to the city for a long time.
review: The lake is surrounded by two main temples first is of Lord Shiva and the other is of Lord Krishna, the Tilon ka Pol. Beautiful attraction and entry free.

title: Nice place in the evening.
review: Nice place in the evening. Boating. And take bread to feed the fishes. Big huge fishes. Apparently there is a history of this place ....

title: Waste of time
review: The lake is dirty, lots of garbage around, needs a clean up. Granted the gate is beautiful, but after seeing the fort it's not so impressive. Touristy, though no cafe to sit and enjoy the lake. Not worth going.

title: Beautiful
review: It is beautiful place, history attached to it.

title: LOCALLY RECOMMENDED PLACE
review: This place could have been very good however when we visited , this called for more cleanliness.

title: Romantic and picturesque
review: After a short walk uphill from the parking lot a brand new vista opens up. Just so wonderful, especially during the evening and morning hours. It gives a person the real feeling of India! A perfect photo op

title: Fun
review: This lake is on of the most awsome place to visit as the lake might have thousands of fish. I loved feeding them. As i throw food into the water for them all of them rush towards it. It very fun. And good place for taking photographs.

title: Only catfish here
review: This lake has an insane amount of catfish inside it. Highlight of this place is to feed bread to the ever-hungry catfish. Other than that, not much to see here. Can get uncomfortably hot in the afternoons.

title: A lake for his majesty's people and a gate for Tilon
review: We hired a guide to tour Jaisalmer and the first place he took us to was Gadsisar lake.

title: Must Watch
review: This lake is on the walking distance from the main highway and it is a awesome place to visit and don't forget to feeding the fishes. I am also posting some picture for you guys. You can also enjoy the boat ride at the lake.

title: What a lake !!! Amazing fish and boatride!!!
review: You better go there for sunset, but my opinion is that all day incredible.

title: Nice place to watch the sunset but surrounding waters edge and banks over run with rubbish. What a shame.
review: We stayed within Jaisalmer fort which was wonderful. Walked down to the lake to take in the sunset across the water. This could be a very beautiful lake if only the water and surrounding banks were cleared of all the rubbish. There is a lot of it. The lake has potential to attract a lot of people but is unfortunately let down by neglect and heavy littering. While we were there, locals were preparing for a ceremony and were cleaning up about a 20 metre section of steps and waters edge for that night. They had removed rubbish from the water where ceremony would be taking place, filling a large bin then just emptying it back into the water a few metres away from the ceremony area. ??? Desperate need of  a clean up. A real shame because it could be such a nice attraction, great sunset with fort in the background is the only thing worth seeing here.

title: Good place.
review: Very nice place to spend the late afternoon. There are some options to take a photo with traditional costume just outside the entrance and you must take some pics there.

title: Scenes which you have seen in Bollywood flicks
review: This place is very scenic but little crowdy. You can have very good snaps views here.. hangout here with friends or family..entry gate architecture is worth praising..

title: Beautiful Natural with Cultural Values
review: A very beautiful lake to spend quality time with cultural values. Good for shopping traditional items.

title: A beautifull place
review: At the evening short walk to gadsisar lake abd enjoy the serenitythe beauty and the sunset. May be you try à boat ride

title: Gadsisar lake
review: Best place for pedal boat riding and can see sunset and sunrise. Pedal boat for two cost 100 INR. It look like a gold we sun rays fall on the peripheral of Gadsisar lake.

title: Must visit place
review: Lake view in evening is super awesome :) had so fun it was so relaxing n cool :) a must go place in jaisalmer, all your worries will vanish :)

title: must visit
review: Its beautiful, not maintained very well - just as most Indian tourist places but not bad. There is an over population of catfish in the lake which is a definite must see, its crazy. You can also do boating in the lake or visit the nearby temples which are beautiful. Personally I would have liked no boating to be allowed and to stop people from throwing garbage in the lake maintaining the serenity of the place but then again its India n if you ignore the trash its a beautiful place to spend the evening sitting on the stairs by the lake.

title: Beautiful lake
review: This is an artificial lake built with the intention of conserving the rain water to help supply water to the dry desert city of Jaisalmer.  Gadsisar lake is a very large lake.  The beauty of the lake is enhanced by the beautiful temples in golden color seen within the lake.  The distant sandy patch with a little thin shrub vegetation looks picturesque.  There are boating facilities in this lake.

title: Cool breeze in the hot city
review: We visited the lake past noon. It was very hot, but as soon as we reach the lake shore it was pleasant. The view is amazing.

title: Peaceful and cool visit
review: A must needed break from exploring the fort and surrounding markets, we took a paddle boat out onto the lake and fed the catfish with bread (20rp from woman at dock). It was 100rp for a 2 person boat for 30min. While the lake is small, it's beautiful and cool, with a little afternoon breeze breaking the otherwise relentless desert heat.

title: A Peaceful site to visit
review: Nice lake boating experience was so good. Cat fish is In very large number . Temple situeted near lake was awesome .

title: Not much to do here
review: There are boats and a few shops around - not much to do here. We spent just 5-10 min walking around but got bored. Can easily avoid.

title: Beautifull but dirthy
review: The lakes are/were very beautifull. You can rent a boat and just enjoy it... but all the trash is just to much. They should be proud of this, not usr it as a trashbin.

title: Simple boat ride with family
review: A soothing boat ride with family for a little us time. Midst are the tailings of ancient jaisalmer. In case you hire a pedal boat..then a fun ride for kids but hard-work for parents esp. Dads

title: Best left inseen
review: Having been really impressed by Jaiselmer fort and the Jain temples in the day I hoped to enjoy the sunset down by the lake. My expectations weren't high but I hoped for a pleasant enough evening but to be honest this place really detracts from the beauty that surrounds it. If maintained (or just respected better) it would be worth dropping by but to be honest it's the only place I've actively wanted to leave. It's just not really a place to sit and relax...only go if you fancy feeding the fish which slightly overrun the place!!

title: Good place to visit.
review: There is boating and fish feeding activity. Simple place. Not much of an activity to do. There are better lakes than this

title: Relived my younger days!
review: Found this place really great as it had a mix of everything - food, souvenirs, food, good people and on top of all it had rowing!!! Tried my hand on row boat for about 10 minutes, loved it!

title: Lovely place but unkept
review: The lake and architecture on it is beautiful.... the same can be enjoyed close up in a boat ride. Unfortunately the lake and the surroundings are not kept very clean... hopefully this will be taken care off soon.

title: Go early morning or before sunset
review: It is the place where travellers used to halt for the night, on the silk route, after the fort gates were closed. There is boating -hence, best time to visit is early morning or evening.

title: A lake in the desert!!
review: When people go to Jaisalmer its true that the important destinations are the fort and dunes.. But it will be great experience if you visit Gadi Sagar lake..The source of water in jaisalmer build as a rainwater reserve is now formed as a lake over years. Spread over a vast area it can be reached by walking about half our or 5 min in tuk tuk. Boating also available here for people enjoying it. There artisans selling traditional cloths and crafts near by making their livings. Temples of great beauty are near by which the main one is devoted to Shiva.. Its a great place to rest in Jaisalmer. Food and packaged water also available near by.

title: Worth a look
review: A pretty lake with lots of catfish bring fed by the locals for good luck. There is the opportunity to take a little uncovered boat ride but with the heat and the children we didn't give it a go.

title: Beautiful ... But ...
review: It is nice to go and enjoy the view of this lake. But ... Oh my god... It is so dirty... What a shame... The fishes are fed with white bread all day long and swim in a lake of plastic. Kind of ruins the whole moment...

title: Really worth a visit and walk around
review: Gadsisar Saga Lake is an easy walk from the fort.  You can hire a row boat and be taken for a paddle on the lake which many were doing the two times we went there.
