If you walk to the far side of the lake, opposite where the entry is, you get a great view of the Jaisalmer fort with the lake in the foreground.  There is a distinct lack of maintenance around the lake with so much rubbish and weeds growing through the paved areas and collapsed cement on walkways.  However, saying this... it is really a pretty lake (was built as a reservoir for the area in the 1400s).  The gateway to the lake is a good photo opportunity... where the boat hire is.  It is, as all water bodies are, a nice relaxing break from the mayhem.

title: The Place is Good, but Authorities need to keep it clean
review: Gadisar Lake is one of the major tourist attractions in Jaisalmer.

title: A Lake which was the only water source before IGL canal came in
review: A lake where the royals would conduct cremation rituals as also treat the lake with reverance being the only water source. Its picturesque. Saw a lot of fish being fed

title: worth a visit
review: small museum inside with historical facts and artifacts- an attraction.  you can see the lake from a distance. Take a few photographs.

title: A beautiful lake
review: It is one of the main attractions of jaisalmer. A huge man made lake made by that time king gadsi sing in fourteenth century. It was the main source of water for the people. Today it doesn't serve that purpose. Rajasthan tourism should maintain it more appropriately. The bank of the lake is dirty. There are lots and lots of fish in the water . tourists feed those. If the government can take right care of the lake then this place would be more attractive to tourists.

title: Do not miss the sunset on the lake
review: When the lake is full of water and the sun is about to set is the most ideal time to be on this picturesque lake. Hinglaj Devi Temple, Queen's swimming pool, Mahadev Temple, Tillon ki Pol are some of the interesting viewpoints.

title: Gadsisar Sagar Lake
review: we some friends again visited jaisalmer and enjoyed at Gadsisar Sagar Lake which is situated in the heart of jaisalmer Near Tilon Ki Gate | Near Jaisalmer Fort, Jaisalmer. very famous sightseeing place in jaisalmer. we enjoyed boating also very attractive sightseeing place for foreigner and indian. lake is very beautiful and maintained by govt.

title: Boating place in the City
review: The lake is very old and the water has been stored there for quite a long time. There is a boating club to enjoy boating  in a group or individually by tourists. you can hire padel boad for Rs.100/- per hour etc. The lake is also not big just small and can be finished with in half an hour maximum.

title: Lake walk
review: This is a beautiful lake with huge fish. Some lovely buildings and an ideal place for either a short or long walk. Very peaceful.

title: very nice gadisar like
review: gadisar like is very nice like .evening time big people in the gadisar like gadisar like near fort view is very nice

title: Pleasant
review: Nice lake, specially if one visits during sunset. Boating in the lake provides the good view of entire lake.

title: Good place for baoting
review: nice place we can visit in evening. food options are available. camel ride is costly. pedal boating only available.

title: Very different temples
review: This lake is a marvelous example of the lifestyle and conventions of the old hindu raja society and tell lot of stories about their day today activities.

title: Gadsisar Lake - Average
review: The overall lake was nice surrounded by nice architectural buildings . However the maintenance of the lake was poor . The cleanliness of the area should improve . The feeding of Cat Fish is one of the attractions but the throwing of the plastic bread covers are a disaster for the life of the Lake . Overall average experience with the boating also. Walk able distance from Jaisalmer Rail Head .

title: Good place to spend evening
review: Try boating at the time of sun set, good views will be there for photography. Evening time is great as most of the crowd will be there.

title: Good place to Spend time
review: I visited during Jan 2016, it is good for photography, I walked along the bank of lake, good to see birds, Ducks etc.

title: Just another lake with a bit of history!!
review: Well apart from just another lake it has tremendous amount of cat fish that will hog on to the bread that you give em like hell.. again a good photo spot and good centre place where the courtesans use to show off their talent..

title: Gadisar Lake
review: Man made lake by the then ruler of Jaisalmer. Nice locale. Lots of fishes in the lake. One thing I didn't like was that people were feeding bread to the fishes. This should be banned. The authorities should take necessary steps for proper conservation of the fishes as well as to maintain the lake. Overall, it is a very nice and beautiful place.

title: Lake visit
review: We do paddle boating, serve aata to fishes. Visit shiv temple. Purchase small antique material, caps. Find some good fastfood also... enjoy a lot.

title: Good 2 hour Trip
review: The view of the lake with the temple around is excellent.Good for photography.

title: Surpising in the dessert !!
review: Great view before you enter Jaiselmere. Good history around it . We were also lucky to see it full of water to the brim.

title: Scenic lake with temple and shrines
review: We visited during a city tour in Jaisalmer, so arrival at Gadsisar lake was little after mid-day and hence even in mid-October quite warm. The Lake is extremely placid and scenic with temples and shrines doting the lake, which make a great backdrop if you want to take a boat ride on the lake or simply take pictures from the bank.

title: Dirty Place,Overcrowded.Nothing of value to see
review: The lake is dirty,overcrowded, Nothing like expectations.Some constructions around ,but nothing great.Not reccomended

title: Just a lake. ...
review: Just a lake not very maintained and worth only 10 mins visit. Attractions have market selling handicrafts

title: Lake?
review: I'm not sure this actually counts as a lake... more like a big dirty puddle.  It's not worth the walk to see ....

title: Not much to see
review: If you have time you can visit this place. There is not much to see here.You can do boating and visit temples

title: Gadsisar Sagar Lake
review: It is a normal tourist spot. It is beautiful but not maintained properly. Boating facility is available here. Peaceful so you can take rest for some time.

title: Why not.... boat ride during sunset
review: Yeah why not... beautiful manmade lake..amazing structures around. ..

title: Good View !!
review: Good place. Evening is the best time to visit.  Picturesque. Not a good place for shopping though you will be barged by the local guides.  It's not needed. There are prayers in the evening around 8pm. It's definitely worth a 1 time visit.

title: Best for time pass
review: Good place to enjoy.nice scenic views.good to see sunset.most enjoyable place for couples.u can get good boat ride.

title: Worth a visit
review: A lake in the desert on the outskirts of Jaisalmer.  Temples and shrines on the shores of the lake - and in the lake - give it a magical quality.

title: Just a Lake in middle of the Desert
review: The lake is legendary only because it is an oasis of water in the middle of Desert. It has some sandstone buildings around it and boating takes places in evening. But there is nothing else worthy to see here. You can definitely skip it.

title: Nice view
review: Good lake in Rajasthan with pleasant view to take pictures & option to go for boating in evening. Don't expect much than a lake in desert area.

title: Tranquil Lake with "Floating" Temples
review: The lake isn't much of a cultural or historical attraction, but provides a great backdrop for a picnic or picture taking.  Go at the golden hours so you can get the best pics.

title: It was a nice lake..
review: In comparison to Pushkar the lake was not very special but the gate was nice and the thousands of catfish you can feed, was entertaining..

title: Average place
review: D lake is full. People do boating. Can click good pictures with d lake. Very hot during d day time, so plan visiting it before 12.00 noon

title: Jaisalmer
review: Beautiful place to visit and stay for few hours.One can enjoy boat ride and enjoy the playing fishes on feeding.

title: Serene lake
review: Nice place to spend a romantic evening on the boat. One can see beautiful sunset from here. There are lot of temples around.

title: Beautiful peaceful place
review: Visit this place either early morning or in the evening. Enjoy the view coupled with the chirping of the birds.

title: awesome
review: This is a must see to enjoy the beauty of the lake and places inside it. You will be curious to know how people made it. If allowed a moonlight night will be just unforgettable here.

title: A home to large catfish
review: The Gadisar lake is a lake in which boating is done. It is a medium sized lake. One can choose the kind of boat they like from small 2 seater paddle boat to a large ten seater oar boat. The main attraction of this lake is that there are large catfish [MAGUR] weighing  3-4kg . One can feed bread and other kinds of food to these fish. There are small and broken temple in the middle of the lake .This is a great tourist spot

title: Great Place to hang out in Jaisalmer
review: Our Kids enjoyed a lot feeding the fishes in the lake, which offers a great view and opportunity to pedal around on boats.

title: Beautiful view
review: Gadsisar Sagar Lake is Beautiful and peaceful place

title: Nice Lake with lot of catfishes
review: It is better to visit this place either in the morning or in the evening. The lake is quite beautiful. You can also do horse riding or boating here if you want. Folklore Museum & Desert Cultural Center are also nearby. Both entry and photography are free here. There is a Gate to Gadisar Lake, which is called Tilon ki Pol.

title: Peaceful
review: Good peaceful cool lake. While boating enjoy views of Heritage Haveli etc. Also don't forget to feed cat fishes in lake.

title: Beautiful and just a short walk from the Fort main gate.
review: Don't be fooled by auto-rickshaw drivers wanting 100 rupees or more to get here - its just a 10-15 minute stroll down from the Jaisalmer Fort main gate. Definitely worth the visit while you're in Jaisalmer. There are so many good picture here of this lake no need to add any more.

title: History unfolding  in real self
review: A beautiful lake neatly maintained. What a history. Do hire a guide. Good time to visit is evenings. Feed the fish, sit and relax,  great view also best time winters

title: Serene and Calm
review: This lake was dug the old kings as a source for drinking water in a drought-affected ancient Rajasthan. Till about 15 years ago, the lake remained the source of drinking water for people till a canal was managed from Punjab to Rajasthan. The approximate depth of the lake is about 25 feet and water level can rise upto 35 feet during rains.

title: Good scenic beauty
review: The lake has a serene environment. You can sit here without being bothered by annyone.

title: Beautiful Lake but not maitained
review: Jaisalmer is a unique city..All Golden and so is this lake.. beautiful.. But not nicely maintained..it lacks cleanliness despite being a well known tourist location.

title: A lake with culture
review: A peaceful place where you can boat with you partner or family. Between the lake you will find the best architectural symbols. A lots of pigeons were there. All and all, its a beautiful place.

title: Just a lake
review: I don't find much difference among lakes in different places. End of the day, it is a lake where you can boat and feed fish. Its there everywhere. My city has lakes. Its more for the locals to unwind in the evening, like I do in my city, if at all.

title: Oasis
review: A small lake in the city of Jaisamer, the place is just a stones throw from the railway staion and offers a boat ride too. You may spend half an hour here, visiting the lake and the small temple onsite. You could also feed the fish in the lake and click a few snaps.

title: At Maharawal Gadsi Singh's lake in Jailsalmer!
review: As a matter of fact, "Gadsisar Sagar Lake", in the "Golden City" of Jaisalmer, is not really a lake! It is a rainwater tank, whose excavation was ordered by Maharawal Gadsi Singh back in 1367! Amazing history of Jaisalmer! And the lake is still there, surrounded by temples, shrines, "chhatris" (cenotaphs) and "ghats (stairways)", as it is very common to find in India, and still responsible for a part of the water supply to local population. "Gadsisar Sagar Lake" is not far from Jaisalmer's Railway Station and is reached through a beautiful arched gateway - the famous 19th century "Tillon-ki Pol", dedicated to Lord Krishna. Boat rides are available and locals sell bread on its shores: you can feed the hundreds of hungry catfishes. I wouldn't say visiting is a must, but if you decide going, please hire a professional guide. Enjoy!

title: Not a must visit place
review: Not a must visit location.Lots of fishes in the pond(kids might enjoy offering food to them).Nothing much to view.

title: Good fun with Kids...
review: A good place to go with kids.  A refreshing change from the heat of Jaisalmer as the boating is very refreshing.

title: Great at dusk!
review: Loved the views of the lake and as the light changed so the birds began to go and the bats began to fly. Has fun feeding the catfish!

title: Gadisar lake
review: not of much interest just boating. of course its fun to feed the huge catfish there. remember the bread cost is rs 20 and not more.

title: just ok
review: It is pretty dirty there and there is really nothing to do but sit and watch the sunset. You can rent a boat but we did not do this.

title: Come at sunrise, then walk around the lake
review: We left our hotel at 6am and arrived at the lake a little before sunrise. It was very peaceful and pretty much empty. A few Indians came with bread to feed the voracious catfish that live in the lake. When the sun came up, there were just a few people taking pictures.

title: Good happy life
review: This leg is beautiful wonderful imagine great view sunset quiet place.          ;";,,''      happy life.         Happy to recommend for visit                   .

title: Disappointing
review: This was quite disappointing, the lake was not signposted, there was very little to see and it did not inspire me to even take a walk around.

title: Great Spot
review: Fantastic lake in the middle of THAR, nice boat ride. great sunset view and SHIV Mandir. best time to visit late afternoon during summer.

title: Nothing to see..boring place..
review: Would suggest everyone to skip this place n rather utilise ur time to visit other places..if u want to do boating then u can visit the lake...

title: If you like
review: At hot weather, lake makes you bit chill but still hot and just little bit far from town by walk. and not really many to see.

title: Peaceful place for short walk
review: We loved reaching this lake after long drive. We sit for a while and just looked around us. There is nothing special to do and as usual in India the lake is full of waste but it doesn't affect much the charm of the place

title: Nice location
review: While the location is picturesque, not very clean and maintained.  Lot of waste littered around and this is something that I am really hoping we as a country can turn around.  Such a location overseas would have been on a postcard.  I think the highlight was feeding the fish for the kids.

title: Nice lake
review: Good place to go either in the morning or evening. There are lots of huge catfish and you can spend sometime feeding them with bread. However the place was quite dirty with the empty plastic bread packets and other rubbish. Good to visit for a short time only.

title: Great place
review: Great place to visit. best part of this location is boating and feeding bread to fishes.good place for relaxing.:-)

title: A lake in a desert is what you can expect only in Jaisalmer
review: Gadsisar, a man made lake in Jaisalmer, is a sight for your eyes. It is so serene and beautiful that words fall short to describe the experience. It is located in the city center - very close to the fort and quite accessible. We visited the lake before sunset and chose a pedal boat to experience the sunset while pedalling in the lake - and believe me, it is a never-can-be-forgotten experience. You can see birds, random trees here and there, and some old structures in the middle of the lake. It is quite spread out (not a small lake) - so if you enjoy boating, you will definitely love the experience.

title: A must see site if there is water in lake
review: Whatever said is less of Gadisar lake. An enchanting clean, soothing lake with lots of bustling activities of birds and animals. We were a group of five n visited the lake in mid sep. It was 8.30 am. Fishes were being fed at that time. There is a temple right ar the place where one enters. But the beauty lies in walking along the pavement and then reaching a built area of trees and a devi temple, which looks like an island in the lake. The built structure is covered by old trees, some considered sacred for hindus. We spent 10-15 min meditating as the purity of air and weather was tempting. We got the opportunity to talk to a native over there, who informed us that ppl usually missed it on account of the distance. The breeze along the lake n the strong wind high up shook our views on desert.

title: Place of serenity and calmness
review: This place will give you feeling of calmness in this high temperature. Very near to fort and city. Can go by local trasport such as tuktuk.

title: Well built lake in the Dry city
review: Jaisalmer receives very less rainfall. Hence Gadsisar lake was built as a reservoir to conserve rain water.  This lake is magnificently built and has small temples within the lake and shrines and temples surrounding the lake. The view of the place is very picturesque. There are ducks sailing in the lake.  At the other end of the lake, one can see few shrubs.

title: Peaceful location
review: Thankfully not spoiled by commercialisation. There are a view stalls and cafes on the approach and a souvenir seller right outside the temple but the rest of the area is unadulterated. Saw sunset and sunrise here.

title: Very peaceful
review: There very nice lake. We go at evening & boating just nice experience. There have many fish looks just awsm. All people give food to them. Very nice lake in jaisalmir.

title: Surprise: A hill station view in desert
review: Boating is a must do activity in the lake.  Negotiate well before get into the boat. its cheap if you do right at the spot. walkable distance from main road. hat or turban is compulsory if you go in the mid of the day. go to this place after visiting the fort.

title: pleasent place
review: nice lake with a pleasant atmosphere . boating make the lake more beautifull. so many fish to feed available.

title: Dirty lake but you can feed the cat fish
review: It used to be the source of water for the city but now its a dirty lake. There are boats that you can hire for some boating. There are some massive cat fish that you can feed and some boys selling bread to do so. There were some birds but probably more during the birding season.

title: Serene...
review: It was fun to be there, especially where lot of movies have been shot and unforgettable Reshma aur Shera...:-)

title: Good
review: We took a boat ride in the evening,it was a wonderful experience.the temples surrounding the lake were lit up and you could hear the bells ringing during the aarti.the people(boat men)are simple and nice unlike in other tourist destinations

title: Boat ride
review: We did boat ride and witnessed the beauty of this place . It was not expensive though I loved the lil market and the route before the lake and how it's covered with beautiful structures .

title: Happy life
review: Ladies so beautiful imagine I really like enjoy there sunset sunrise both good happy life.             """"""'''.                  ""''''''.            """''',''(

title: Boat ride
review: The lake is nice giving view of the city.. it offers boat ride .. it was a  wonderful experience altogether. must do

title: Relaxing, pretty but difficult if you are blonde
review: I enjoyed wandering around the lake, taking photos and having a moment to sit back and have a bit of peace and quiet.

title: Nice sunset boating
review: It is a boating spot. 2 seater boat for 30 mins is for 100/-. Can be skipped if running short of time.

title: A beautiful lake in the midst of desert city
review: Gadsisar lake provides a beautiful view of huge water body in an otherwise arid desert terrain. The chattaries in middle of the lake is a pretty sight and sunrise of Gadsisar Lake is mesmerizing.

title: A nice lake, but could use some clean up
review: The lake is located right outside the city, so if you're in Jaisalmer, I recommend you check it out. It's pretty, and the fact that it used to be the cities water supply is pretty neat. But overall I found it very dirty and smelly. I didn't want to spend too long hanging out because as I am a foreigner, people were constantly trying to sell me things. And there is trash all over the place!

title: Oasis in a desert
review: This lake is located at the heart of the city of Jaisalmer close to the fort. The lake was excavated in 1367 by Rawal Gadsi Singh. The lake collects rainwater and was the main water source of this water scared city in old days. The lake is surrounded by number of temples and shrines. The area is nice and within a desert backdrop looks as a real oasis.

title: Go if you are looking for a quaint evening
review: The best time is to go during dusk or dawn when the sunlight brightens up the lake. You can buy bread and feed the fish.

title: just another lake! crowded and dirty!
review: i went there with high hopes but my hopes got shattered when i saw it offers no great view!

title: Beautiful place, needs to be protected
review: This is the only water body near Jaisalmer and can be such a quaint place to relax. But the lake is drying up fast and needs to be looked after immediately. There are boats for going around, but with so less water, why give Rs 100 to paddle around.

title: 最高な宿！
review: コストパフォーマンス比率は非常に高い。 価格のわりに良い部屋。 私が滞在した部屋にバルコニーがあった。バルコニーではくつろげてゆっくりできます。そして、一番のオススメポイントは、屋上からの最高の風景です！屋上は非常に広いので、食事もとることができます。私は3泊しましたが、非常によい眺め のために3泊とも私はそこで食事しました。 それだけでなくオーナーを含むスタッフの誰もが、非常に親身で優しい。 長い旅の合間にはもってこいなぐらいゆっくりできるホテルです。次回、JAISARUMERUに来てもここに泊まりたいです。

title: Nice lake
review: The lake area is nice, but it is very dirty and there are many single men (locals) loitering about so beware. A nice way to ill half an hour, but not much beyond that.

title: Nice windy place
review: Its a lake you can do boating here. Nice place to sit and spend some good time. Quite windy here so bit relief from heat. Lots of fishes in the lake you can feed them bread.

title: Found some water in this lake !!
review: In summers, you will not find a single drop of water in this lake :( but in the month of august, you can do boating etc there. Its near to Jaisalmer fort.

title: Shadow
review: Came there in the morning on a hot day. It was about 40°C and there is not much shadow to hide from the sun. The spots we found in the shadow were stinking of pee.

title: Do not visit in summers
review: Wonderful place , quite serene and quiet . Visit in the winters to get a good lake side experience . If you are a quite book reading type of a person , this place can provide you solace with excellent scenic beauty .

title: Different
review: Lake is not easily seen in this part of India. this lake is big. surrounding rajasthani structures add a different view. Pegions are flying here and there. Good shopping stores near by that are cheap. This place is not far from town area.

title: Beautiful lake
review: It was really nice place to visit. Had fun with my friends. The architecture inside and around the lake is really amazing. Enjoyed every bit, the boat riding, feeding fishes etc...ohh !!! Very beautiful lake it is love to visit again.

title: "Historical lake"
review: The gadisar lake is one of the cleanest lake I have seen so far in Rajasthan.architecture of main gate is very detailed and beautiful. Boating was also very fun.

title: Gadsisar lake- scenic lake is a must visit site in Jaisalmer.
review: Gadsisar Lake is an scenic artificial waterbody, was built by Raja Rawal Jaisal, the first ruler of Jaisalmer. This historic lake is located towards the south of Jaisalmer city and the entrance to the lake is through Tilon-Ki-Pol, a magnificent and artistically carved yellow sandstone archway . The Tilon Ki Pol is adorned with an idol of the Hindu deity Vishnu, installed in the year 1908.

title: Second top attraction in Jaisalmer
review: The Gadisar Lake was one of the best attractions in Jaisalmer.The story behind the construction of the Gate at the lake front is very interesting.Boating possible

title: Boring
review: Not much to do. It might be nice for a walk, but not longer than 1 hour. The catfish in the lake are fun to feed and for pictures, but the lake itself is small and dirty.

title: Nice sunset spot!
review: The lake is really pleasant and has lots of places to sit and relax. The gazebos in the lake are nice and easy to get to.

title: Beautiful Lake in the Golden City
review: Gadsisar lake is an artifical lake built in 14th Century in Jaisalmer city. It's basically a water conservation tank built to conserve rain water. There are numerous shrines and temples in the surroundings of this lake. We visited the lake in the evening around the sunset time. We enjoyed boat ride in the lake. It was a pleasant experience. There were several beautiful ducks in the lake. There was calmness and peace in the atmosphere around the lake.

title: Underwhelming but nice
review: Okay but disappointing in comparison to the pictures we'd seen online. A lot of young Indian guys were hanging out here and leaving their food and drink waste so the place was covered in glass bottles! The water was dirty and there was graffiti on the temples. The monuments were still nice though and it is worst a visit if you're in Jaisalmer!

title: Run down and very dirty
review: Unfortunately I found this potentially beautiful place to dirty and run down. Worth a look though as is an important landmark in the city.

title: Nothing special, when compared to other places in the city
review: Its a simple lake, with a few structures inn between. The reflection of those structures is good to see, but it's okay to skip it if you are short of time.

title: Sun set at Gadisar Lake
review: If u ever visit jaisalmer, do visit Gadisar lake at around sun set time and hire a boat for a ride. Trust me you'll never forget those few moments in your lifetime. The golden color sunset ambiance make you go crazy. Couples going on a boat ride which is too much romantic is actually awesome to watch. Check out the photos of the lake at sunset time.

title: Amazing place to visit
review: Alone or with friends in Jaisalmer, Gadsisar lake is the perfect way to spend your afternoon!

title: Art and water
review: Visited this place about four times in one month, always enjoyed the beautiful architecture around and inside the lake. Must visit for any Jaisalmer visitor, locals love there too. Highly recommend.

title: An beautiful lake in jaisalmer
review: this is a beautiful lake in Jaisalmer. Good place to hand around with your family and friends. This lake inside the Jaisalmer city near to the Jaisalmer fort.

title: Architectural wonder
review: Located in the heart of Jaisalmer, this lake is literally a treat to the eyes considering that it is an architectural wonder.

title: Charming  Lake
review: A charming Lake built by Jaisalmer ruler to enjoy the evening with his near ones. Dance and cultural activities were being performed in the centrally located building in the lake. Now the Lake is open to public for boating.

title: May be visited once if you are in Jaisalmer!
review: I had walked thru all the way from my hotel to Gadisar lake, I did not find much over there, they wanted to take me to boating (chargeable),  I refused though. Just took some snaps and came back

title: Avergage !
review: One of the places to do in your activity tour in Jaisalmer !

title: Disappointing
review: It is extremely hot and the monsoons have not yet arrived so the lake is low. We found this to be depressing. It is in bad repair with tree roots cracking the pavings, muck, litter and plastic bottles everywhere.

title: ok only
review: not  a worthwhile place to go, nothing to do much over there.. plan it only when you had ample of time specially in winters

title: "What a place "
review: It was the most beautiful lake we have seen so far in Rajasthan. The entrance gate which made by a prostitute has a magnificent carving on sand stones. Only downside is cleaness. Surrounding is very dirty.

title: Good
review: Gadsisar Lake is one of the major tourist attractions of Jaisalmer. Good place for boating and relax. The rajasthani music play in front of lake was verygood

title: Good if you can fir it in your schedule
review: Sight of a lake is quite pleasing. Try boating to enjoy peaceful surroundings.Pretty gates/Jharokha/temples/Chatri constructed in and around lake.

title: Gaddisar Lake trip
review: A beautiful man-made lake that was developed by Jailsalmer rulers to act as a water reservoir in times of crisis. The lake has plenty of water even during the hottest of summer months but of late, the water levels have been registering a fall because of exploitation by upcoming settlements on its shores. Overall, a nice place to visit.

title: The view of the lake didn't live up our expectations
review: Getting there only by rickshaw. Walking can be an unpleasant experience due to the lack of sanitary sewers surrounding all the road. It doesn't look as impressive as in the photos.

title: A lake in a desert city
review: A visit to the place during a summer evening is a pleasant experience. The structures around the lake are attractive. A Temple adds to the tranquility of the place. An option of Boating is present.

title: Beautiful sunset
review: The best place to chill in the city. Just sit on the stairs in front of the lake and watch the sunset or sunrise.

title: another architecture made for royed entertainment
review: stories of king's keep for whom this architecture was built go around. small shamiyanas inside lake were built to see dances and entertainment shows for royals. 5-10 minutes are enough to cover.

title: Cool Ghadisar
review: We reached Ghadisar lake at around 7 in the morning. Greeted by cool breeze clean water & the holiness surrounding it.

title: A BEAUTIFUL MAN MADE LAKE
review: visited the lake on 01.01.2016. The lake situated in mid of city is a great attraction among the children because of boating. as we reached by evening so hurriedly took shikara for ride and enjoyed the 30 minutes ride in cool water.

title: Nice of view of the lake with Rajasthani Temples
review: We visited this place but did not really spend much time here. It is actually a water conservation tank built in 1400 by Maharajah of Jaisalmer . It is one of the tourist attraction of Jaisalmer.

title: Too hot to really enjoy
review: It was the middle of the day and blazing hot.  I had just arrived in Jaisalmer and this was the 1st destination on my tour.  It wasn't a long walk to get to the lake which is quite pretty and there were some people who were boating on the lake.  There are temples nearby and stands selling  colorful souvenirs.

title: INTERESTING
review: We were taken to look at the lake and its interesting architecture , it was interesting to see the hundreds off enormous catfish, they  were being fed by a Hindu family who were recently bereaved and part of the ritual  was  to feed the fish .There were pedallos available that we didn't use

title: Poorly maintained
review: There is nothing spectacular about this lake. The banks are dirty and poorly maintained. Not many good spots so sit.

title: haven is desert.
review: gadsisar lake is like a haven in the diddle of desert,

title: Nicr outing
review: Good to see a lake in desert. Fairly big . Paddle and rowing boats . Some fishes you could feed flour balls . Tea n maggi stalls on the banks . All in all nothing great but one of the sites you visit when in jaisalmer

title: Nice place for a picnic.
review: Best time to visit this is around sun set as the breeze is pleasant and there's also boating one can go do.

title: For some quiet Boat ride
review: We went in the Hot month of June which resulted in the Lake not being crowded at all so we could enjoy the Boat ride with some nice background and monuments around.

title: lake was amazing
review: very nice looking of this lake, water is very clean and clear, boating are not allow this time because water label is down, but history was very good,

title: Beautiful place to see
review: This was just near our hotel, went for a walk and was surprised to see how lovely it was, with people hiring row boats for the day.

title: combination of nature & art
review: nice place to visit while you are in jaisalmer, nice heritage look while going from main gate and in evening the place is perfect for quality time with friends and family

title: Not much to do here... Okish
review: Yes the good thing is that there a lake with few temples and shrines surrounding the lake. The entrance gate of the lake is huge and impressive in the night light.

title: "Great sunset"
review: It was very nice to see the sunset from the back side of the lake so you can see lake +fort. Boating in lake was a great experience! But it need to take good care because there was lots of rubbish everywhere.

title: Temples, catfish and territorial goat
review: A lake with a temple, swarms of catfish if food is thrown into the lake. The entrance gateway has an interesting story about it. They sell bread to feed the protected catfish that thrive In the lake along with an assortment of plastic. The area would benefit from a good litter cleanup. You could hire a boat if you so desired.

title: You may like this
review: It's a medium size lake and it is always exciting to see a lake in a desert. Located near to the Fort area it's not a big effort to reach there. If the day is pleasant, you would like to have a boat ride. On a sunny day it's better to avoid boating.Good nice view.

title: wonderful scenery
review: very beautiful lake in the desert landscape of jaisalmer.it is peculiar and one can enjoy boating here

title: Superb experience..
review: I will not go on explaining of the beauty of the lake..things you must do:

title: Boating
review: Its very peaceful here. One can take a boating ride for 100 for 30 minutes and enjoy the serenity around. Or just sit and watch the locals feed the fish. Or take a stroll and listen to the locals playing music..

title: Average lake..
review: This is very average lake with boating. By side of lake is temple. Having visited other good lakes i found this place very ordinary. Not much to enjoy except boating..

title: Serene
review: Nice... during sunset and evening. Lovely views, very peaceful and quiet. Loved the umbrella's in the middle of lake

title: Serene Beauty
review: Beautiful lake. Paradise for people likes natures photography. The boat ride a must. Thoroughly enjoy the place. Best time to visit is in the evening. Well maintained lake.

title: pretty place!
review: beautiful place to sit for a while and relax! go in the early morning or in evening. visit the shiva mandir there. lots of opportunities for beautiful pics.

title: Good place to relax
review: I would not say that this is one of the best lakes you would find in the state of Rajasthan although it is worth spending some time to relax in the solitude in the desert. Don't forget to buy a packet of bread to feed the fishes.

title: Serene
review: Offer food to the fishes and they have offer peace peace in return. The best feeling is when they bounce above the water level.

title: Engaging Place
review: First of all there is boating facility and you will get boats for 2 , 4 and 8 persons at a cost of 50/- each. It is a peaceful place to sit ,relax and take pictures . Go during sunrise or sunset and see the sunset point. There are lots of fish in the lake and they gather once you feed them bread. The only con is that it is not well maintained and there are poly bags and all wastes around .

title: It is a relaxing activity at jaisalmer
review: You have to try the boat ride here, its relaxing and also asked the boat driver he will tell you the history of significance of the lake.

title: Nothing.. Only hyped
review: A normal lake with normal boating facility. It's only famous for its historical presence ..

title: Clean lake with plenty of fish
review: Clean lake with plenty of fish and boating experience. Looking at a dray place as Jaisalmer, the size of the lake is astonishing.

title: Nice place
review: Pleasant and peaceful place so the small lake make this place more amazing. In evening this place is more amazing

title: Relaxing
review: We walking down here around 5pm which was a lovely time. The water is dirty though so you wouldn't put your feet in. Gets a nice breeze as well. Lots of catfish and ducks. The is places you can buy bread to feed to them.

title: So naic
review: I really like so much sunset so beautiful i love lage so many things to see in lage and happy life jaisalmer  best jaisalmer

title: Beautiful
review: Very nice and clean lake. Must visit place in Jaisalmer. Good views all around. Did not try the boating but will be worth trying out.

title: Nice and lovely
review: Its a very sweet and serene place where you can spend hours and watch the sunset or just the water....you can do boating here...

title: Beautiful lake full of rubbish
review: The lake was beautiful, and so were the temples in it. However, the water was filthy, and there was rubbish all over the place. A local friend recommended us to walk around the lake, but it was difficult to enjoy the scenery with the floor covered in glass and the rats running around. If they clean up the place, it will be stunning.

title: Not worth place
review: This is not a worth place as this is not a clean place but yes if you have been to jaisalmer you can go there for some time

title: Nice place
review: You can enjoy boating there with family.

title: A peaceful boating place
review: Very beautiful lake with floating fountain and lots and lots of cat fishes. I wnet in the evening when people had brought food for the fishes and there was a real cat fight between the fishes for food. We took a boat and covered the whole lake tourbin about half an hour. It was a nice experience

title: Visit to jaisalmer
review: I visited this place between 12th March to 14th March 2016. I visited Bada bagh, Gadisar Lake, Sand Dunes (Prince Desert camp), Patwon kee haweli, Jaisalmer fort.  I enjoyed sitting at gadisar lake, prince desert camp the most. I was very impressed with the food quality and the hospitality of delight restaurant. Thanks to Shakti Singh who took care of all the things including, food, accommodation and the whole tour. He was very flexible in all aspects. He took all our suggestions in a very positive manner. Unfortunately we could not visit the war museum due to some program of PM Modi jee. Throughout the trip I never felt exhausted due its planning. Thanks once again Shakti Singh

title: Interesting
review: We didn't spend a whole bunch of time here, but we did enjoy it.  We didn't go on the lake but walked around in the various shops and temple.   Would recommend if in the area.

title: Nothing special about this place
review: There is nothing special about this place.

title: A regular lake with some heritage architectures around
review: It was a bit crowdy and dirty. Local hawkers filled the streets. Nothing much to see. But, the lake was clean at least.

title: "One must visit"
review: Very beautiful lake with the very interesting history  about the gate made by a prostitutes. You can also make boating in the lake. Back side of Lake has nice view of Fort with lake.

title: Interesting man made lake
review: The story of the importance of this lake to the city is interesting. Like most other places dirty and there are loads of catfish. The story of the lake itself, particularly the gate is interesting and highlights the importance of water in this arid region.

title: An experience
review: We took the evening sunset boat ride,  nothing great about it except for the experience, go there early around 4pm.  A beautiful locale, management couldve been a little better.  Need more boats and life jackets.

title: Boating
review: Boating in Gadisar Lake was really Good. we enjoyed the Boating well in a big Boat With all of our 12 pax

title: Beautiful place but not well maintained
review: A very calm and peaceful place. Great  for photography at sunset. Tranquillity of water,air,the bells of themple and the settings sun will surely relax you after a long day(Not all great pics in my cell so can't upload many )

title: Lake popular with locals I think
review: OK for a wander down and a nosey. A few small market stalls, folk museum close by, boat hire popular with locals it seemed. Lots of huge catfish near the edge of lake.

title: Nice Lake
review: The lake is closer to the fort and is walkable. Also the boating gives u access to other side from whr u can take pictures of Fort with Lake which is quite amazing. People feed fish here and the quantity and size of fish is large. Not well maintained by administration but still a recommended place to visit..

title: Boat ride in Gadsisar Sagar lake
review: The boat ride in Gadsisar sagar lake with the sunset view was a bliss. My kid enjoyed feeding 'aata' to the fishes in the lake.

title: Must visit to watch sunset
review: I recommend this place for watching sunset. Beautiful sunset, magnificent view, lovely fishes and peaceful boat ride.

title: Quite and Beautiful place
review: This is one of the main attraction of Jaisalmer. You can do boating here and also shop around for handicraft. We did find some good handicarft for our website kraftbuy specially one's made from fossils....!! Their is a theater for puppet show. Check the timings. Evening is pleasant and you should visit after 6PM. You can visit Shiva temple on the banks of the lake.

title: architectural lake
review: The lake is surrounded by beautiful architectural structures and sculptors. the structures are made of yellow sand stones and gives the lake a fantastic uplift. Its quite a pretty lake , besides one can take a boat ride for a fee. There are many vendors around the entrance of the lake selling beautiful handicrafts etc. In the lake there are many catfish one can feed them. When in Jaisalmer I think you have to visit the Gadsisar lake its a very pleasant area and one can see the traditional handicrafts, and the ladies in their traditional clothing. There is no entry fee unless  you visit the museum that's just at entrance of lake. Good place for pictures.

title: A silver lining
review: Gadisar is an excellent lake to see and do boating in. I am saying this after having visited so many lakes with boating along the length and breadth of the country.

title: Its like boating inside a broken palace
review: The best thing about this lake is you can boat all day if you want. What fascinates me is tat there are structures made up of bright yellow stone. its like you can tie the boat at the pavement of the structures and can stretch your legs inside the structure. its cool

title: Very good
review: Dear this place is very good boating activity is very nice so many location for nice click katputali dance ticket is very high 100 Rs per person nothing special in dance only money matter lake is very nice

title: Quite beautiful
review: However, the water appears dirty and the buildings are covered with bird droppings, not the most inviting - but great for pictures!

title: Worth a visit, particularly around sunset
review: A pleasant man-made lake (usually referred to here as a ‘tank’) dating back to the 14th century. Formerly the main source of drinking water for the city, it’s filled only by rainwater and sometimes dries out if the monsoon is poor. Around the edge and on small islands are some old temples but its main function seems to be a place of recreation for the local populace, who enjoy pedalo rides on the water and feeding huge catfish that gather in anticipation of a meal of stale bread.

title: Lovelyway to end a day!
review: I have been here a few times and it is interesting to see how it can change depending on the water levels. It is lovely to visit towards sunset when the colours are even more beautiful. My favorite thing is to feed the catfish. there are usually young children selling bread for around 20Rs a packet.

title: Worth to see
review: Jain temple on the lake is very scenic place, and very spiritual and quite if you lucky to feel that. Somebody told me on the other side you can swim, well it is an option if you are a men))) Very nice cooling in the hot day!

title: Pleasant evening
review: We had been there at evening time before boarding our train. Its close by to the railway station. Well everything is charged there. Boating is available, however you cant go to any monuments in the lake, its very old, & they say it may collapse so we cant stand there, its just a normal boat ride. So we didnt prefer for boating, instead feed the fishes, enjoyed the evening there observing the lake & sunset. Jaisalmer is famous for carving on stone, so same here..,

title: Boating is must.
review: Boating is awesome in this lake. It is half on hour boating session. Self driving paddle boats and boats rowed by their staff is also available.

title: good family spot
review: loved boating , and feeding catfishes. My son loved this place and must have spent alot on breads and biscuits for the fishes....boating is good...just plan in the evening as afternoon gets reallly hot.........

title: Man Made Lake at its Best
review: Its a Man made lake. It had ample of water during our visit for Boat ride. Its so refreshing. Just pick up the right time of Boating when it the Sun is not Strong.

title: Early morning visit worth getting up for
review: The lake itself is now full all year round due to a canal feeding water into it.

title: Avoid if u can
review: No good facilities no cleanliness no other tourists attractions jus a pond camouflaged as a lake

title: Relaxing visit
review: We weren't sure whether to come here due to the reviews we read on trip advisor, but we are glad we did. We walked here from the fort (only took about ten minutes).

title: Lovely lake and very peaceful
review: This was at the start of the village walk around Jaisalmer. Very beautiful place and so peaceful;. Joy to stand and watch cat fish being fed by both locals and tourists alike. Pleasant walks around lake, glad we saw it ad it added to the experience of our trip.

title: NORMAL LAKE
review: This is a normal lake. However if you are visiting the jaiselemer then spending a small ride here on boat is not a bad option.

title: Beautiful Place
review: It is nice to see water reservoir in desert and that also surrounded by beautiful palaces. A place worth visiting.

title: Lake in the Desert
review: This is nice lake. You can enjoy boating ride in this lake  and click some nice photos. Architecture is nice to watch.

title: Lake with a view
review: Beautiful lake though not full , we still could go boating in it. This is a fun place to go to if you have kids who want to go boating/picnicking.

title: For the love of boating
review: The lake has boating facility and will give you a nice view with serene environment. Its really peaceful recreation. Also you can come late here to watch the sunset as it has a sunset point. We took kashmere boat which was covered from above and had a boatmen too. It was quite sunny so we preferred this boat and the cost for 30 mins was Rs 300.  You can opt for self pedal boats at 150 - 200 as well.

title: Perfect for sunset from boat
review: A short & inexpensive auto ride from the fort is the gadisar Lake. It is a picture perfect way to wind up a day of sight seeing. Relax in a row boat & watch the birds fly home as the sun goes down. You will capture awesome pics of the small monuments in the lake and their reflection in the water.

title: Quiet Place
review: Its a quiet place to relax and take nice photos with your camera! If you like, you can pay to enjoy a boat ride inside the lake.

title: Ok ok
review: This is just the hyped up spot... Nothing great about it. Just few views and boating.     This could have been managed better.

title: The catfish are so eww! But go see them.
review: Well. The catfish. With their whiskers and the scramble over each other to snatch the food thrown at them. Its ugh. But its a sight you wouldnt see elsewhere so while you're in Jaisalmer, you might as well go see it.

title: Good visit
review: Beautiful lake . We went there after visiting the fort during evening. There are boat rides and in the middle of the lake there is a temple as well.

title: Nice Place
review: Very Nice place . Best view and boating . Good for a family trip or with friends. I like it and want to see once again.

title: A beautiful Lake in the desert!
review: This is a beautiful lake to spend some lone time at. This lake was built by the Maharaja to over come the lack of water situation in the kingdom. It's a nice spot to hang out but can be easily missed if you have cramped schedule while in Jaisalmer as there are a lot of more interesting activities to indulge in, in Jaisalmer.

title: Used to be good but now, more like a surreal location
review: When I first came here (15 years ago), it was a tranquil and awe inspiring location.  Fast forward to March 2015 and it's been populated by children's boat rides; feeding catfish (?) and hundreds of pigeons cr@pping everywhere.

title: Picturesque lake
review: The lake looks very good and also offers boat rides (Though we have not been in the want of time). The lake has few of the domes and a Siva temple in the vicinity.

title: family holiday
review: It is a good place to hang around in the evening time, but the sad part is that the lake is not so clean, the local authority should look into this.

title: Amazing Architectures all around
review: Amazing architectures all around reminds and proves the royal taste. It seems as a prop for shooting of some 15 century star tv serial.  Must to be visited while in Jaisalmer.

title: Peaceful
review: It was a wonderful experience. The lake is calm and serene, it also offers boat rides. We took a double seater paddle boat for 100 bucks for half an hour. It was amazing. Lake has a temple and few domes in the vicinity.

title: The first stop in your Jaisalmer City sights tour
review: This is an artificial lake built by Maharaja Gadsi Singh to collect water for the people of Jaisalmer as early as the 14th century. This acted as the only water supply to the entire city of Jaisalmer. The Maharaja was the only person who was once allowed to bathe in this Lake. They nowadays grow cat fish in the Lake to help it remain clean.

title: Nice lake
review: The lake is nice to visit if you have a few minutes left. It's about 15 minutes walking from the fort. If you want you can rent a paddle boat. It's also nice to feed the fish...

title: Decent place to hangout
review: The lake is nice with boating facilities available. You can enjoy sunset also at this place. The place could be bit more well maintained.

title: Historycal leke
review: These leke is so beautiful it's very easy reach for town  there are so many temepel and you can enjoy there boating and relex

title: Boat ride in historic rainwater lake.
review: Serene lake. Hallmark of the region. The lake till date is a major water source for the region. Water is stored from rainwater - from whatever little it rains here.

title: Pretty Lake Worth A Visit
review: An easy but dusty walk from the fort, the lake is pretty and peaceful. Surrounded by pretty buildings. Worth a visit. Took the rickshaw back, no need to do the walk back as well.

title: One more tourist attraction near jaisalmer fort
review: take a small walk during your visit of jaisalmer fort and you found out this lake. Boating facility is also available here.

title: Good spot for a quick visit
review: It's a bit of a shame this lake is in such condition. Surrounded by souvenir stalls, the water is very smelly (possibly due to the season) and we didn't really want to go anywhere near it with the rental boat. Tired, neglected-looking horses for pony-rides. The walk around the shore was the most interesting bit, but there's really nothing here apart from the view - rather a wasted opportunity.

title: No bread eating fish
review: People paddling around the lake. I was hoping to see the catfish feed but might be the wrong times of year

title: Nice place to feel relaxed & boating
review: Nice place to feel relaxed & boating for for a short while in the city centre. Boats like pedal, rowing & Kashmiri type boats are available at affordable rates for half an hour & one hour. Nice view of the sunset too from the lake.

title: Picture perfect
review: A jaisalmery stone marvel to beautify historic lake in desert land. Quick visit good snaps on card. Boating, traditional clothing available.

title: Disappointing dirty lake
review: We came here on the way back to the hotel from the fort, and as it was free decided to have a quick look around. Unfortunately it hasn't been able to reach its potential as it is dirty and smelly, and although there are boat rides I didn't fancy sitting in a dirty lake. Could be so much more.

title: Lake full of fishes !
review: The lake is full of dangerous looking fishes while tourists feed them there.

title: Just another lake
review: Gadsisaar lake is like just another lake, it is not very big lake. The water is green and not clear, please can do paddle boating. Overall an average place to visit and can be skipped if you are in hurry.

title: Peaceful and soothing
review: Enjoyed sitting on the side of the lake due to fog. If you have already gone for boating then it is not much of a place to repeat.

title: Peaceful!
review: If you had a hectic day or you are tired after visiting the city and you are in need of Relaxation and peace,then definately this is the best place to relax.Take a boat trip in the lake,observe the nature,animals birds flying above your head.Best time to visit is during sunset.

title: Lovely Sunrise point..!!
review: I visited this place in the month of January 2016. After taking rest on the first night at hotel in Jaisalmer. We woke up early morning. So we suddenly decided to go somewhere to look Sunrise. And Going to this place was one of the best decision. It was so relaxing and close to nature that it filled us with full of life..!! Also the ancient building there was adding the charm to this place. I suggest everyone to go to this place. Preferably Mornings..

title: Good for groups ~
review: Everything was nice, but then I was alone and could not take a boat on a lake cause I was alone lol. 1 person is not allowed.  That was the only sad part.

title: Feeding the Fishes at Gadsisar
review: It was pleasure to feed the fishes and watching them in a large quantity. near by you can see the puppet show

title: Worth a visit
review: A lake in the desert will be always be an attraction and as such the Gadisar lake does attract tourists. Boating on the lake and horse back riding are the popular activities. Many curio vendors have set up shops here and one can get a decent bargain. Haggling over price is allowed.

title: Small but relaxing
review: Fancy a mini boat trip, it is recommended. Just remember not to be go too close the edge of the lake, water is shallow. Fun and relaxing. Lovely views.

title: About lake
review: Lake is quite beautiful. Boating is also enjoyable here. For two persons padel boating, Rs. 100 is required.

title: Nice place to view sunset while boating
review: Beautiful location, nice to do boating and view sunset. Kids had a great time. Enjoyed a lot while boating.

title: natural view of lake
review: this is a historical palace situated in main jaisalmer city ...... tourists can go to there by car or bicycle..... there is some historical building .... good natural satisfaction ..... tourist must visit this when then come to jaisalmer .

title: Small
review: Small but nice lake in the middle of the city. Gives great photo opportunity on all sides. Shops on both the sides are available for local shopping. One hour is sufficient enough for this attraction.

title: Beautiful lake
review: Gadsisar lake was our first sight in Jaisalmer... we went for boating in the evening... enjoyed beautiful sunset while boating in the lake....lake was really very large...entrance gate to the lake was beautiful...there was a small market just outside the maingate

title: nice view
review: Gadsisar lake is in main Jaisalmer city. It is nice to visit there. We do paddle boating which was surprisingly cheap compared to the boating in Purana Quila in Delhi. The location is beautiful and the architectures are nice to watch. Overall it was good experience if not so great because of extreme chilly weather i guess.

title: Nice place to relax but not very big
review: You need to park the car outisde and walk approx 100mtr to get to the entry point of lake. The lake is not very big and they charge approx. 150 for half an hour boat ride. Not view is not as beautiful as the ones seen in other places I've visited. An average place to go and can be opted out of the trip.

title: Good and relaxing place
review: You can either do a boat ride here or just sit and relax and witness the sun set and see the flok of birds heading back to their nest once the sun sets

title: good lake
review: this is indeed a good lake and can be visited in the evening. boating in the lake is must and time spent on the side of the lake is awesome.

title: Nice
review: Had a shikara ride..it was good to feed the cat fishes..ride was serene and surroundings were very aesthetic

title: Have a good boating in shikara.
review: Had a wonderful boat ride on a sunny warm day with kids. Good scenic view. Boat charges are on the higher range

title: Nothing much
review: Nothing much to see here. If you are not doing the boating, there is absolutely nothing else. Not really liked it.

title: Pathetic
review: Poorly maintained ...... Dirty ... Garbage .... Dirty lake . Nothing to see . If you are thinking of beautiful view and lake ... Then forget it . Just a place added in list

title: Boating and Relaxing
review: The lake is in the city. It is easily reachable by car and by rickshaw also.  The place is not maintained properly. Over you can enjoy the paddle, row boating and even the sikara boating here.

title: Good place to relax!!!
review: Boating on this lake is quite pleasant and fulfilling. Especially in the evening. Boating fee is reasonable as well. Rs 100 for half an hour for a two person paddle boat.

title: Hire a pedalo
review: Hire a pedalo, get under a tree, escape the heat of the day and admire the great view of the fort. The lake is relatively clean, and a nice place to spend an hour or so

title: Sunset view was amazing
review: Boating experience was nice and the view at sunset is good for photography...will recommend to visit.

title: Early morning visit best
review: Imagine a man-made lake scraped out in the mid 12th Century and refurbished in the 14th Century.  Add to that a dreamy set of golden sandstone shrines, temples and ghats; then you have Gadsisar Lake.  A visit in the morning just after they open the gates works better than battling the busloads of tourists that crowd the area later in the day and at sunset.  If you turn a deaf ear to all the hawkers selling their gimcracks, you'll enjoy the experience.  Don't miss the Tilon Ki Pol or "Prostitute Gate" by the road.

title: Good leisure place at Jaisalmer
review: This is a nice lake with a great view of the fort and other monuments of the city. Nice place for boating and leisure. Please do the boat ride around sunset to get maximum pleasure

title: Not too good but you can stop by if you have time
review: Jaisalmer has nothing much to do other than a night in tent and camel/jeep safari on following morning. If there after you feel like going to lake it's your wish. There s nothing special about this lake. They charge rs 100 per person for 15 mins. Lake is not too clean. Free parking outside and there is a small market around the lake.

title: The touch of a prostitute befitting the grandeur of a maharajah
review: Gadi Sagar lake located at the fringe of the Jaiselmer Fort has the marking of a great outing, befitting that of a maharajah, as ironically the Tilon ki Gate, the official entry to the lakeside was built by a prostitute.

title: Sunset point.
review: If you are planning to come here the best time would be to come in the evening and make it a point to stay till the sun sets. The waters not that clean and you can't go and sit under the Chhatris but apart from that it's worth a visit if you have a whole day with yourself.

title: Serene
review: We decided to spend our evening sitting lakeside and viewing the sunset. The majestic entrance and the structures present in the lake looked spectacular. The lake is surrounded by temples, shrines.

title: Nice place to relax in the evening
review: The lake is not very clean, needs maintenance. We did paddle boating for half an hour. As there is not much to do in Jaisalmer, it is nice place to relax.

title: Significant for locals but not for travelers
review: Lake is a major attraction for the locals, but I feel to make it a tourist attraction, there is lot of scope for improvement. Jaisalmer is a beautiful city where you can spend days doing nothing, therefore the Lake should not be taken as a pastime activity but a rejuvenating one. It is very crowded and not well maintained. The entry to the museum was dilapidated which should be taken care of considering it is a place of historical value which is not receiving the attention it should have. The lake view would be perfect during morning time when there is less crowd. You can walk up to vaishnav chowk after experiencing the lake in the morning to indulge in Dal pakwan and kachori which are mouth watering jaisalmer delicacies.

title: Average
review: Visited in evening. Boating you can skip. Expensive and not that great. Stinking place. I m sure you must have done boating better than this place. Overall you can skip this place if you are shortage of time

title: "One d best place in India to see sun rise"
review: If u r a nature love just dun miss diz place. 'This place is been ranked by cnn for d most beautifull sun rise in d country'. Wake up early in d morning nd spend ur morning here its an beautiful place. Many well known movies have olso been short here.

title: Poor
review: Nothing great to see in it. Just normal as anyother lake around India. Very much yuck and un clean roads.

title: Pretty
review: Its a nice pretty lake.the stones structures in the middle of the lake look pretty. It has boating which we dint do. Snacks outside like dal pakwan are super tasty.nothing much to do there otherwise.

title: Beautiful lake in a desert
review: A natural lake in a desert. Beauty in the eye of the beholder. Don't forget to take the boat ride. You can take pedal boats or one with a boatsman.

title: Relaxing - Out of busy Jaisalmer
review: We walk everywhere we can and this was a fine walk from the fort. Make sure that you look at the route before you go otherwise just ask the locals. We enjoyed the sunset! It was so calm and beautiful! Definitely one of my favourite places in Jaisalmer. The roads are a bit dirty and there is a lot of dust - what else do you expect, it's a desert town in India.

title: OK
review: A lake in a desert was undoubtedly an attraction but the entire access to it was full of

title: Very serene
review: Beautiful lake, especially at sunset. You can choose to take in the views from the higher viewing platform or take a boat ride and get a closer look. To be honest this place is just as enjoyable without the boat ride. You can also buy some bread from a local woman and feed this to the enormous group of catfish!

title: Great history.
review: Excavated in 1367 by Rawal Gadsi Singh, it is a scenic rainwater lake surrounded by the small temples and shrines of Amar Sagar. Earlier, this lake was used to be the main water source of Jaisalmer. Due to an increased water demand for agriculture, the lake is increasingly threatened to dry out.

title: More of a hyped site. Average, can be skipped...
review: We visited the lake in the evening just around sunset. Firstly, the approach is bad with encroachments by road-side shops. Secondly, all the group tour teams bring their groups here in the evening, so it can get very crowded. The lake and the farther view are nice. But the swelling crowd that gathers near the entrance to offer loads of bread to the ugly-looking black catfish, is a big deterrent and takes away any shine from the place. There are a few boats available for riding, which we did not attempt.

title: Clean and beautiful..
review: Only place in jaisalmer where you find peace and tranquillity. Nicely maintained with a temple at the entrance.Good place to spend time with your family.

title: Beautiful site at night
review: I went there basically for photography. The lake has a small place in the center of the lake which gives a different perspective to the lake.

title: Attractive place only in morning just after Sunrise
review: It will give to Lake city(Udaipur) feeling in Jaisalmer. Mainly it's boating attraction but if you are not intered in that then I suggest you to visit in morning just after sunrise once.

title: Beautiful Lake
review: The boating in the lake is very enjoyable experience. You have the option of paddle boat and rowing boat. We opted for paddle boat for four and enjoyed the half and hour (allowed time) of boating. Sunset view from the lake is great.

title: Just One Look
review: This Place is OK , It's Just lake nothing special. It is in centre of the City, One can visit any time in day.  One can do Boating if he/she wants Facility is there. this place can be complete within 15 minutes without boating

title: Good place to spend your evening
review: Beautiful lake in middle of jaselmer to send your evening while boating. Must visit place when your are in jaselmer.

title: Good lake, boating, nice view in the evening
review: This was the last place we went to in Jodhpur. It is about 1.5km from the fort area, cost us Rs 40 or something. We were a little exhausted but the gentle breeze over the lake was quite refreshing. We went boating. Offers good views of the ghats. Lots of birds in the area.

title: Enjoyed a Lot @ Gadsisar Lake
review: Gadsisar Lake is a nice sightseeing point in Jaisalmer. The lake is very clean and serene. You cannot miss boating here as this is a very exciting experience. You will surely love boating here. Good place for photography. A temple is also there. At the entrance there is a market as well where you can buy traditional Rajasthani items and souvenirs.

title: Hyped
review: Like most other lakes in India this lake too is in need of clean up and maintenance. The entrance is full of sellers with their wares which takes away the charm of the lake. Apart from boating no other activity is possible.

title: excellent boat ride with family in evening time.please go early to get a boat ride without hussle, buzzle.
review: it was a nice boat ride for 30 min in gadisar lake, offers good views for capturing pictures with family.. please do wear your safety jacket during boat ride. it is optional but please use it as mandatory for damily safety

title: Spend an hour here..
review: The lake is worth a visti if you have spare time in your Jaisalmer trip, has nothing much to offer except boating and other regular features of any other lake.

title: nice evening in Gadisar
review: lake is big, nice in the evening for boating... birds can be watched. We liked the place. good for photography

title: One of the most beautiful lakes in India
review: Gadisar Sagar Lake is about 2 Km from Jaisalmer fort. Surrounded by beautiful temples and trees the lake provides an excellent scenery, where you can relax and enjoy the evening sunset. The best time to visit this lake is just before the sunset.

title: Peaceful place
review: It's located in the centre of Jaisalmer. It has boating facility. Ideal for a day time family outing. There are a few stalls for food and local items. One can walk along the lake and sit on the lake side to enjoy some peaceful moments. The place is walking distance from the fort though auto rickshaws are also available.

title: Beautiful Lake
review: It is one of oldest lake and beautiful. You gonna love it. You can also see the sunset. Good for photography.

title: Nice relaximg.place
review: U can rent a peddle boat and spend great time going on the small temples in the midle of the lake.

title: Worth visit
review: It's a good place to walk around. Boats are also available. Good natural views specially sunrise and sunset. A lots of birds there specially for bird lovers. You can capture beautiful memories here. Worth visit.Recommended

title: Beautiful sunset
review: Very nice to walk around in evening. Great photos of a great sunset. Cool temples. Can walk out to the 'island'

title: Nice view but stinks of fish
review: Once constructed by the king for fresh potable water, the lake is not used anymore for the same purposes due to a great number of cat fish present in the lake and the ever growing population who go there to feed bread and atta to fish to gain some 'punya'....the lake has a great view. Boating facility is also available.

title: Nice spot
review: Cleaner than what I expected.. Nice views, boats and good chat shops.. Perfect place for a nice evening stroll of hangout when in Jaisalmer

title: Float in lap of nature
review: Very good boating location. Enjoy the pedal boat with your loved one...go to the farthest point and see the beauty of nature...

title: Wonders of Nature
review: A lake in Golden City Jaisalmer is a wonder of Nature, Jaisalmer is famous for sand dunes but a lake is a gift to this city. One can experience boating in lake.

title: Pretty sight
review: The lake was a pretty sight with structures standing in the middle of the lake giving it a beautiful sight especially after the sunset as they lit up.

title: Is not worth visiting
review: Very untidy like a village pond. Surrounding  is as dirty as the lake. If some focus is put in the cleanliness then it would still be good to visit.

title: Lake in desert
review: It is an excellent place for hangout. The main area is hounded by hawkers and dirty. Go slightly around the lake and there is a nice Ghat..where one can sit and enjoy the view. Boating is must. Just soak in the SUNSET and feel in paradise in the desert.

title: Peaceful, Past Time Activity
review: The lake is in between the city and an evening activity where you can relax after the entire day  sightseeing and travelling. The lake is beautiful with few chattries in between  .Boating is really a pass time activity and a way to get to those chattries in between if you want to pose for some Rajasthani pics. The Fort looks really beautiful from here which surely adds to the charm.

title: Not much to see
review: We stopped for 20 minutes but not much to see here, dirty lake with some run down monuments. Lots of vendors.

title: Beautiful and relaxing boat ride
review: The lake is so beautiful with all old buildings/temples in the middle of the lake. You can rent a paddle or rowing boat to ride around. Buy bread if you throw it into the lake - you may see catfish! Didn't expect to see such a beautiful lake in a supposed desert.

title: Just to appreciate the history
review: One is intrigued by a water body in desert - may be in yesteryears there was more rain and this tank was holding the rain water. But now, thanks to Indira Gandhi Canal which come upto a place 65 Kms from Jaisalmer, water is supplied to the lake to keep the tourist attraction alive. It seems in this place was part of the  'Silk route" and the traders used to halt here. The local Chieftain used to provide shelter, water  and security to the Caravan and in return they would return the favour in kind. That probably explains the history of the lake and the economy of the place!

title: Not Developed as a Tourist Spot
review: The administration or the Tourism department have taken no steps to beautify or even keep the place clean so that tourists are attracted to the spot. It seems to be only a place for the locals to enjoy a boat ride.

title: Worth a visit
review: Big queue for boating. But worth a visit. A small lake with some partially submerged structures. Best go in the evening

title: Beautiful Lake
review: This is a very beautiful lake and it is good if you visit them in the evening during sunset. Pleasant experience.

title: The largest lake in jaisalmer
review: Scenic lake where boating is possible. Bang opposite the fort. Worth a visit to spend a lazy evening. The lake is not too deep so take care while boating

title: A Wel Maintained Artificial Lake
review: The lake was once upon a time used for supplying drinking water in Jaisalmer. It is well maintained and facility of boating is also available.

title: Relaxing Shikara ride
review: If travelling as a couple the relaxing Shikara ride on the picturesque gadisar lake is a must. We went around sunset and were not disappointed

title: Good place to sit and relax
review: Decent size lake, calm waters. Clean place, not too crowded. Good view. Find a good place to sit and relax for hours on a non-sunny day. Parking too expensive at 50 rupees. Boat rides also available (peddle boat as well)

title: A place for perfece evening
review: The place looks so nice with some constructions in middle of lake.

title: I love water
review: The breeze near that lake was too natural. I was feeling too fresh there. I want to go there again and again.

title: The only major lake in Jaisalmer
review: Gadsisar Lake was till quite recently the only source of water supply to the city of Jaisalmer and has quite a few temples around it. The lake also has boating facility and can be quite enjoyable in the evenings.

title: Cool place for a nice water ride
review: Historical Gafisar lake is a place where you can take a boat ride by your self , couple can spent good time together away from all worries of the city attraction and higj paid fees.

title: A nice lake in Jaisalmer
review: Gadisar lake is quite big in size and a nice lake to enjoy an afternoon visit. You can walk around the lake and go for a 20 mins boating. Boating tickets cost you 50 rs per person. But the boatmen are very rough. Best time to visit this lake will be during sunset. This will be a good 1 hour trip.

title: It is nothing but a large Water Pond.
review: This place has no reason to be listed as place to be seen. There is nothing here except a temple. The place is dirty and not maintained at all.

title: superb puppet show
review: When you visit gadsisar lake, don't forget to visit a marudhara sanskritik kendra just opposite the lake. every evening there is a nice puppet show which is unmissable. Mr. N. K. Sharma, A retired teacher is conducting it. there is also a small museum in the complex. dont miss the puppet show...

title: To have Boating in Desert ...... To much fun
review: When you go to jaisalmer you only think about Fort and Desert , but there is Gadisagar Lake which let you to boating too in Jaisalmer...

title: As the sun comes down
review: Its a serene lake with little island structures and minarets that add to the beauty of the place. There are boating facilities available for those who are interested. We went there to watch the sunset which was gorgeous. An old Shiva Temple at the ghats made for a great visit.

title: A manmade lake to provide water to the city.
review: A manmade lake to provide water to the city nothing great about it. Similar kind of lakes can be found in every other city. Visit ONLY IF you like boating.

title: Family holidays
review: Superb place,u should visit in the evening at sunset time, u can enjoy boating and the sunset both.shouldn't miss this.

title: Peaceful
review: Peacful lake sight with swans and cat fish around the place..

title: nice lake
review: nice man made lake with temple and other structures which offer good photo opportunities, you can buy little hand made goods along the shores and take in the history

title: Beautiful lake
review: Must visit in jaisalmer. It's beautiful and much cleaner than other lakes in tourist spots. Do take the paddle boat during sunset, its an experience.

title: Photo opportunity for sunrise
review: Spent many mornings at the lake waiting for the sun to rise. It is a great place to take images of sunrise, bird life and its buildings. Well worth a visit

title: Lavish
review: I consider 3 attractions most important in Jaisalmer, one being the Jaisalmer Fort, Patwaon ki haveli and the Gadisar lake. The Gadisar lake is a living example of the sense of taste the 'Royal Families' had in the ancient era. It looks like an amazing piece of architecture built for Kings to spend their evenings. One can opt for a boating ride into the middle of the lake that has an equally beautiful structure to rest or have a picnic. It's indeed worth a visit.

title: Not Clean
review: This place is very dirty. Although gov can preserve it but they dnt give a damm.. Waste & plastics r all over & its stinky

title: beautiful Lake
review: Nice big lake. Good view Infrastructure is okay but the view of lake is nice. Boating facility available. Lots of fish throng as people feed them with bread packets. visit during sunset would be great

title: gadisar lake
review: very beautiful lake..with the canopies and strudtures built in side and surrounding the lake.boating facility is enjoyable and cheap..camel skincaps hetre are cheaper.

title: Plain simple boat ride
review: One nice thing about the boat ride was the beautiful forlorn trees and few structures right in the middle of water reservoir. The whole of area was in a circular shape enclosed with traditional structures

title: Nice small place
review: Nice place to spend evening time and sunset. Boating is fun in the small lake. Though water is dirty. May visit.

title: Best place for couple
review: It was amazing.....

title: Pleasant Spot
review: A short stop off on the way to Jaisalmer affords great panoramic views of the citadel. the lake is bordered by summer palaces and temples which makes for a lovely spot to visit. The  buildings on the  lake, used by the Maharajah for picnics, appear to float on the water. Only really worth a short stop but you can hire small pedalo type boats should you wish to stay longer. We visited November 2015 around Diwali and following a good season of rains the water level was quite high. Our guide said more recently the water levels were very low and when that is the case the water can be very scummy and dirty.
