If you are here after breakfast don't forget to bring a few bits of bread to feed the numerous catfish

title: Wow
review: It was a good place for visiting.

title: Feeding fish was fun...!!!
review: Beautiful lake with structures in the middle was soothing for eyes and heart. School of fish was amazing and kids enjoyed feeding the fish. Awesome and scenic view  perfect for photography.

title: Very beautiful site
review: Its a very beautiful site ....a lake in a desert area is a site to see.

title: Can be much better
review: Jaisalmer administration doesn't seem to be paying any attention to the tourist destinations and that too when tourism is the biggest source of income for people of Jaisalmer..

title: Beautiful
review: I have been to this Lake and enjoyed peddle boat ride here. This is very pleasant and picturesque location. I do recommend this place.

title: Ok, plan it around sunset
review: We were here twice, once at night and once during noon . my daughter had a good time boating. Some of the side structures are lit well and looks great at night. Apart from boating, at both left and right side of entrance to boating you could sit and gaze the lake and surroundings. You would have to walk 300 m for the left sitting place.

title: Lake in desert
review: Excellent place to visit. Due to shortage of water in Jaisalmer the ruler made this lake as a source of water supply to people. It has no stream underneath and depends purely on rainfall for filling of this lake. Boating , pedal boating is allowed in this lake spreading over approx. 3 km of an area is enjoyable site particularly in the evening and in the early part of the night with lighting like fire flames all around.

title: Fresh relieves early morning
review: At the time of evening fun of boating

title: Boring
review: Just like any other dirty, small lake anywhere in India. Visit only if you need to kill time and have nothing better to do. Or, if you want to show fish and water to children.

title: Beautiful lake
review: This lake is situated just in middle of Jaisalmer.. We went in d evening.. Enjoyed boat ride.. Spent two hours on d bank of the lake..very good place..with full of water this year..enjoyed different spices of birds..enjoyed..

title: A beautiful place to relax
review: The way there is quite easy, it's only a fifteen minute walk from the fort. Quite the tourist attraction but there is a lot of space for everybody and we found our perfect quiet spot by the lake. The half sank buildings were nice and we were able to relax and have a great time there.

title: Nice setting but the usual garbage
review: Could be a nice and relaxing place, unfortunately there is the usual garbage problem, especially lots of plastic on the shoreline (people buy bread to feed the catfish then just leave the plastic wrapping, probably too much trouble to walk the 10 meters or so to the garbage bin), anyways there are a few nice pics to take there, still worth the visit

title: Quirck visit except if you want to go boating
review: Quite a vast lake, with little structures constructed in it. looks beautiful. Needs only about 20 mins to walk, see and get back to the cab. If you choose to go boating, would take longer.  There's also a small temple here, with bats hanging about, when you walk around the main sanctum.  also few street vendors selling the usual stuff.

title: Boating at Gadsisar Lake, Jaisalmer
review: It's a must visit if you're visiting jaisalmer.

title: Quick Visit
review: Gadisar Sagar Lake is a quick visit site unless one indulges in Boating. It is a decent site with little to offer except for good clicks.

title: beautiful buildings and structures
review: Lovely lake and beautiful buildings, the structures made in the middle of the lake are truly a treat for the eyes - I haven't seen many of those around!  A must visit in Jaisalmer

title: great place to relax -  visit the museum too
review: the lake is splendid and relaxing,  walk around it. Nice splendid view from the fort.

title: Nice lake - Extortion vide boating !
review: There seems to be only one entrance to the lake. To be fair I did not explore further but the only entrance is blocked by boatmen who will take you on a ride on to the lake. So all in all if you want to enjoy the view of the lake you need to pay, which seemed a little unfair to me. A place like a lake should be at least open to the public for entry and general viewing. If you want to boat you may surely pay but you cant really make visitors pay for just standing around and looking.

title: Calm and Quiet Gadisar Lake is a nice place at afternoon
review: This lake with small temple like structures built within, is vast and full of water, the purpose being rain water reservoir. Just a 10 to 15 min walk from Golden Fort. The best time to be there is by the afternoon. Gentle breeze inspires to have a float on boat in the lake. Blue water surrounded by trees and bushes, this place is a treat for eyes. Beautiful tunes from the traditional wired instrument "Ravan Hataw", played by Rajasthani expert vendor on street, enhances mind settling calm and quietness of the place. The small museum is also a worth of visit. There are plenty of options for further development by the Govt. to make this spot more fascinating for the tourists.

title: Lake with Fish having Moustache
review: hoards of Cat fishes in the lake. the local people take pride in saying that the fish in rajasthan also have a moustache.. as a royal sign.

title: Fantastic Sunset view point
review: This is a beautiful lake and a must see for a day or two day Jaisalmer trip. One must try boating at the lake. The lake has a lot of fish and locals provide food to the fishes (one can also try! very interesting). Beautiful place to see the sun set, and a good place to do the photography.

title: Very beautiful lake.
review: Was clean, much cleaner than most tourist lakes. The boating for 30 mins was fun. There were life jackets, but were optional. Small little monuments in between the lake

title: Apart from the fish and the dirt nothing much to see
review: It is surprising to see this water body whereas the rest of the town is dry. The maintenance is very poor with dirt all over the boundary of the lake, The lake offers boating facility. It is in the middle of the town.

title: Well maintained and good to spend evening
review: This lake is very well maintained and if you are staying in Jaisalmer then you should go in the morning and in the evening.

title: Very scenic and photographic place
review: Gadisagar lake is simply awesome. Lake surrounded by Ancient Chataries offers a delighful experience to tourists. One can also take boating pleasure at the lake.

title: Beautiful lake views from a pedal boat
review: Took a walk here from the Fort and rented a pedal boat for 100rs, unexpectedly wonderful half hour floating around the temples

title: Serene and beautiful lake
review: Quite a beautiful lake with serene and tranquility once you get in to a boat ride (paid). Its a tourist attraction, so the approach is filled with street vendors.

title: Pleasant place but could have been cleaner
review: The place is really nice and peaceful. It has a huge history too (that the lake is never empty). A huge lake that too full of water, right in the heart of a city like jasalmer is a wonder in itself. But I was not much impressed by the cleanliness around the lake. And there is huge scope of improvement here. Otherwise it is a nice place to spend some time. Entry is free and tourist can do boating if they feel like as well.

title: Beautiful place - go for an evening boat ride
review: Going for a boat ride is a must.. Prefer to go in the evenings when the lights are on...in winters, even a day ride will be good

title: Gadsisar lake jaisalmir
review: Big lake near to Fort. Now used for boating. Earlier the rain water was stored for the city.entry fee.

title: Waste of time
review: Please do not visit this place until and unless the local administration takes effort to clean up this place.

title: Feeding Fish
review: Me and my daughter really had a good time feeding the fishes these. We went there twice and my daughter really loved it and wanted to go there again and again.

title: Boon to jaisalmer
review: Thanks to the rulers who visualised the need and did a lot about it.

title: Beautiful lake but very dirty
review: Nice oasis in the desert but very badly maintained. Can be avoided. No proper arrangement for tourists or proper sign boards. One of the dirtiest tourist attraction in Jaisalmer.

title: A pond surrounded with beautiful architural work
review: Such a large Water body in Thar Desert is a Blessing and this must have been the life line of locals. There are several Ghats (Platforms with Steps leading to Lake) around this lake which highlights that people of different cadre took bath at different Ghats. There are also some old structures with canopies around the Lake, which indicates that even Royal family members used to visit this Lake.

title: Trash lake
review: What a shame there is no waste management. The lake is beautiful, but full of litter. If bread bags continue to end up in the lake, they should stop allowing the sale of the bread at the lake. Simple solutions and minimal efforts could make this area more beautiful.

title: I love it. Its beautiful, although a little pride and care could improve it greatly.
review: It is easy to reach the lake by tuk tuk or by foot. And it is beautiful at sunset. Next time I want to take advantage of the row boats. For 20 or so rupees you can buy

title: interesting
review: The lake was built to service the traders who would cover long distances across the desert on the silk route. the most interesting aspect of the lake is the water indeed, in the middle of the wide expanse of the Thar desert.

title: Nice to see a water body
review: Nothing spectacular..perhaps the authorities could make it more interesting with some historical information on a plaque to make the visit worthwhile.

title: Beautiful lake, can the authorities manage this lake better?
review: This is a nice water body in Jaisalmer, nice canopies in the lake, various steps leading to the water, boating facilities as well, but the lake is not managed properly, you can see litter everywhere, they sell bread to feed it to the fishes and the bread packets are carelessly thrown around here and there.

title: Nice place to visit and for picnic and photography.
review: Once you are in Jaisalmer, must visit this lake and have photograph for good memories. There are few small shops where you can buy small small items and nothing much is available to eat.

title: Nice for a short visit
review: The lake has a few temples in it and some nice buildings around it so makes for some good photos.  It is also a lot cooler there in the shade beside the water than the fort.

title: Cool Place to visit
review: Cool place to visit, its not far and walking distance from main road. Good view of lake, lots of fishes in the lake and architecture is excellent

title: Peaceful & Prestine - Perfect for an evening stroll
review: One of the biggest lakes in Jaisalmer city. Boating facility is available, however we chose to sit on the banks and enjoy the sun say good bye. Enjoy a late evening walk & some chaat here. A well spent evening indeed! :)

title: Ok Ok Place
review: Actually nothing to see there. This pace is good only for boating. But in Jaisalmer as expected temperature is always very high with a very harsh Sun which spoils the joy of Boating. They have only open boats not he covered one.

title: A Great to Spend an Evening
review: If you like serenity then this is a good place to spend an evening at the shores of this big lake watching the sunset. Boating is also available here which can be helpful in breaking the monotony.

title: Cant say much!
review: pls make sure that you have time enough to visit the lake during day as we went there post sunset and could not go for boating so cant say much about the experience!

title: Not great, but do visit.
review: There are may lakes in our country which are better that this place. Although not excellent, but it is not far from the main fort and hence go for it if you have time in your hands.

title: A must for photographers!
review: This is another of these site that one may want to visit at sunset and sunrise to get that special light and awesome photo! The lake is also filled with huge catfishes that some people feed there and you can even buy bread just beside the lake to feed the fishes. Make sure you make time in your schedule to go see this spectacular lake!

title: Awesome
review: Gadisar lake is a peaceful place in jaisalmer, in centre of city walking distance from our hotel. I spent an evening at gadisar lake. Best sightseeing of jaisalmer.

title: Lovely place in Rajashtan
review: What a lovely place! I made a Rajasthan tour this summer, and this was the first place I really loved of India after visiting a few other cities. The temparature was tremendously hot, but it's worth it! The lake has got something magic and romantic, and the village with the fort around was one of the best I could visit in India.

title: Nice place to chill
review: This lake is a nice place to chill when you'll be tired of roaming throughout the day. Sit, Keep quite and enjoy the place.

title: Good Experience
review: Lake is in city area and we went there in September so its hot. Nice Boating experience. Water is clean and big lake.

title: nice for paddling
review: The lake was quite close to our hotel so we were able to enjoy sunset while paddling on  one of the small boats. There's a lot of catfish in the lake as well which swarm near the temple whenever it's feeding time.

title: Nice Lake
review: nice quiet place good to enjoy evening T,and wander around the lake with nature, also has boating facilities.

title: Lake in Desert
review: Such a lovely lake...It gives a lot of relaxation to the eyes which were seeing the sand filled desert all across...people enjoy boat ride also...

title: Boating at lake
review: We actually were pleasantly surprised by this lake as we had seen pictures of a dry water bed. There was lots of water and we did a boating for 30 minutes

title: "the lake full of water"
review: gadisar lake is one of my favourit palace in jaisalmer. now day lake is full with rainy water so its looks very beautiful.you can also do boating in the lake.

title: Calm lake
review: Nice place to visit at Jaisalmer. Dont forget to row boat on this lake. After boating, sit at the side of the lake to enjoy cool breeze after sunset.

title: Waste of time.
review: Not as glorious as it should be if you believe the books. There isn't anybody and you cant feed the fish like Lonely Planet said.

title: Amazing place, but locals should improve the condition
review: Gadisar Lake is a mysterious place just next to an amazing looking Jaisalmer fort. When I was here last month, waterlevel ws just ok as many told me that waterlevel could be low in this month.

title: small lake but offers some excellent photo opportunity
review: We went to this lake late in the evening after spending the day at the fort. At that time the lake was not crowded and the structures in the middle provided some excellent opportunities for photos.

title: Boting available and you can feed fishes also fin for kids
review: Boating available and you can feed fishes also fun for kids. You cant imagine lake in city like jaisalmer......lucky because rain was there 2 days ago .....lake was full with water.

title: Very nice
review: During my visit, due to the rains, the lake was quite filled with water and looked great ! has some nice structures on the middle of the lake and by its side.

title: soothing Expirence once you see a water body in rajasthan!!
review: A soothing evening Boat ride after a tough 40 degree afternoon. This lake is the source of water to all jaisalmer people since ages. Maharaja have get it built. You can see beutiful ghats build around it. a chattrii also in a middle of it.

title: Interesting spot
review: Worth a potter down to the lakeside, but if you don't make it here, you've not missed much. It's a smallish lake, with some interesting temples on the bank and great views of Jaisalmer fort. The usual hawkers pestering you and you can take a boat out onto the lake, but it's probably not worth it.

title: average
review: we have to walk from the road to lake.some boats are there in lake.one temple on the bank of the lake.less crowded.

title: just breathe taking
review: we got there about an hour before sunset. we set out in a rowing boat and the view was breathe taking. prays taking place in the shiv mandir birds chirpping away and watching the sunset while in the middle of the lake. around the lake are some temples. must visit.

title: Nice place for paddling
review: Full of fish.. Just feed them.. And see the response :)

title: Must not visit
review: Place not to be visited as it is very dirty and there is nothing to do at this spot. It should be removed from the sight seeing spots.

title: Ok if you have to spend few hours after seeing the fort
review: nice... could be much better if they keep it cleaner... good half a day outing from the fort... suggested...

title: Quiet and beautiful
review: Don't miss it. It's an amazing place for pictures and relax. Not far from town.

title: Nice place to visit in Rajasthan
review: Not maintained, dirt all around, 1 time visit.It has some strange creatures like fishes which could be interesting to watch.

title: Beautiful place
review: Though the lake is beautiful and a boat ride in it is good fun, it is being marred by insensible and irresponsible throwing of garbage and plastics into the lake. There are places around the lake where you can sit, relax and enjoy good view of the place. A word of caution, do not go to the edges of the lake if you are boat riding since water there is shallow and chances are high that you may get stuck.

title: Beautiful
review: ocean in the desert. It's a must see place. Looks more beautiful post monsoon. Nice place for a morning or evening walk.

title: Just okay
review: If you have time to spare you can perhaps stroll down to the lake. Its small and not very clean. Also not very well lighted during evenings. There are a few temples around the lake and a few dirty boats. Go if you must.

title: Perfect for sun set
review: I went with my family gadisar lake around sunset time it was amazing looking fort good for photo graphics that time. We did also boat it was cool .But not around good clean all over place plastic bag they need to keep more clean

title: A serene spot in Jaisalmer!!!
review: The Gadsisar Lake is situated near Tilon ki Pol (Gate of Tilon) in Jaisalmer. There is a gateway[which arches across the road] located near the lake, which was built by Tilon (royal courtesan) .Lake is an unadulterated treat for one’s eyes and mind. You can enjoy a calm boat ride(not a must do) on these waters as the sun sets to close a hectic day of sightseeing in peace. A number of shrines and pavilions dot the lake banks and a domed pavilion in the middle adds tremendously to the aesthetic appearance of the lake. This lake is not an oasis, but is a water conservation tank that controlled the entire water supply during the reign of Maharwal Gadsi Singh, the Maharaja of Jaisalmer when this lake was built.This artificial rainwater lake was the chief water source during that time. Present day fact about this lake is that its never dry (even though its in the middle of a desert) as it is fed by the Indira Gandhi Canal. Also one of the attractions of this lake are the different species of birds, which migrate from distinct places. Photographer will be delighted with snaps of this place.

title: something special
review: Great and mysterious place...

title: Indian Maharajah's unique creation
review: Impressive lake created by Indian Maharajah for summer enjoyment for his family. Take a boat ride to enjoy this warm experience and enjoy the scenery. .

title: Nice place to hide
review: More or less wuite place to hide from rush and insisting Indian people in the center or around the fort... Spend some time feeding fish, riding a boat on the lake or just rest in the shadow...

title: Peaceful lake
review: Its not much commercialise so one can have peaceful time.If wheather is pleasant do boating also.A place where you can sit and relax for couple of hours.

title: Untidy and not maintained well at all...
review: if you want to spend few hours in a place surrounded by lake with cool breeze , then you can visit this place....otherwise its not maintained properly..very untidy...lot of fish in the lake..vl b a gud experience for children...

title: perfect lake but not maintain
review: this lake is not maintained properly very untidy & dirty no proper infrastructure.lot of fish in the lack people are feeding the fish and making the lack more dirty.you can go for a couple of photographs and spend like 1/2 hours

title: Decent place
review: Nothing too great about this. Its a normal lake with some structures in middle of it. You can go for a couple of photographs and spend like 15 minutes maximum. I feel Jaisalmer is just a hyped up place. I should have visited Mount Abu instead. Wasted my 2 days out there.

title: sagar lake
review: Nice place to visit...not much information was given to us at the time of visit of the sight...nice place to enjoy boating also...

title: Lake Gadisagar
review: Cool atmosphere and beautiful architecture.... Seeing the local damsels in their attire was a treat for the eyes and my camera too !

title: Nice One
review: A short walk from the Jaisalmer fort will land you on the banks of Gadi Sagar, a popular local hangout. The pathway is neatly maintained and clean.  There were local artists playing which made the atmosphere so cool.   We were shocked to see big fishes in the lake, and they came in bunches.  Made a cool look altogether, worth a visit

title: Good place to sit, soak in.
review: Good views, plan to be there during morning or evening hours. Can explore by walking around to take some pictures.

title: Perl in the desert
review: We did boating the lake, It was one of the oldest lake of Rajasthan.

title: Find Hari Ram Bhopa at his shop!
review: Right before the entrance to the lake (in tourist season, October - April) you can find the amazing musician Hari Ram.  He makes, plays, and sells Ravannahatahs, an amazing bowed instrument that will make you quiver.  If you go to this lake, be sure you spend some time talking with him.  He is one of a kind, and the lake is beautiful too.

title: A serene spot in Jaisalmer
review: This is the lake which was earlier the only source for

title: “Nice small lake once only source of water to the city”
review: Small, calm place to visit. Not too well maintained but kids will enjoy. Boating also available. Photography is traditional Rajasthani costumes can be done outside lake. Few eat-outs also there.

title: great
review: picturesque lake with nice architectures surrounding. boating is great experience here. ghats could be cleaner.

title: A Fairy Tale place...!!!
review: Gadsisar Lake complex is a mesmerizing place. I have been there so many times, yet it never fails to attract me to the same level. Right at the heart of the city, it is best explore either at Sunrise or at Sunset. Looks even better if there's ample water in the lake. Try your hand feeding the thousands of cat fish that reside in the lake. Boating is another activity that can be done, provided there is optimum water level. A beautiful place...!!!

title: Boat Ride in Gadisar Lake, Jaisalmer
review: We had a boat ride around 8 PM in Gadisar Lake. It was half an hour ride and boatman was the quiet type and paddled the boat quite efficiently. He made a big round of the lake and took us close to the temples/ structures in and around the lake.

title: Lake in the middle of Desert
review: This tank was built by a famous dancing artisan Tilon from her wealth accumulated in the darbar of the king. It acted as main water supply to the city

title: Poor
review: Again this place was at a sorry state, nobody takes care of these things and they have become just trash. Just a name to visit nothing to amuse as per name.

title: Fishes
review: We went there to see the fishes. Also did some boating. Quite a relaxed place overall. Met an old guy Babu Singh Baba. Interesting fella!

title: GOOD PLACE TO VISIT BUT WITH CAUTION......
review: Good place to visit, historical touch, but not clean probably due no charges being charged. quite crowded in peak season, not likely to get preference by locals if not a foreigner or rich soul....exercise caution during visit....

title: very good location but not clean.
review: lake is so good but cleaning is required .cows are visited there every whereand water is also dirty.

title: A lake with fine structures around it!
review: Another major attraction near the city is the Gadisar Lake. A giant gateway of yellow sandstone welcomes you inside the lake. We were informed that this lake was also source of water for the Jaisalmer City. Anyone found bathing or polluting the reservoir was used to be punished stringently including the slay action.

title: Mesmerizing Lake of The Golden City
review: Located within the city of Jaisalmer is the wonderful Gadsisar Sagar Lake. We visited the lake in the morning. The Ghats and the Shrines on the banks of the lake were bathed in the golden light of the morning sun. The lake also has a lot of fishes in it. They say that the lake used to be the only source of water for the city in olden times. The architecture of the temples and shrines along the lake is also very beautiful. We visited in the month of January so the waters had receded considerably. There were many pigeons merrily flocking on the temple tops and also on the grounds.

title: Offers calm and solace!!!
review: If you feel like letting your hair down after a long day or want to venture out of the Jaisalmer fort for a while then this is just the place to be.It also offers boat rides.

title: A nice lake in the golden city
review: This lake is approximately one km far from the Jaisalmer fort in the south east direction and is one of the main attractions in Jaisalmer. When I visited the lake during May 2015, the water resided and the base of the cenotaph present in the middle of the lake was very much visible. Visited both during morning and evening times to take the photos from different angles. The yellow sand stone structures on the banks of the lake turn golden yellow under the rising and setting sun give a romantic appearance and soothing to the eyes.

title: A small artificial lake
review: This is a small artificial lake of the XIV century, situated in the south-east from the city walls and served as a key source of water supply in Jaisalmer until 1965. Because of its importance it is surrounded by many small temples.

title: nice lack
review: lack of jaisalmer must visit. history behind this lack. visit in afternoon to have real fun. boating is must at gadisar lack.

title: The perfect place for sunrise photo's.
review: In the morning, the lake is calm and the sun shinning on the structures is golden.  It's a perfect place for beautiful photo's.  There are a lot of stray dogs in this area, but seem harmless.  As with anywhere in India, watch where you are walking.  There were many birds here which also added to the interesting photo's.

title: Avoidable
review: We thought it would turn out to be a pretty lake but no. crowded, useless, shops steal you.

title: Sunrise is amazing
review: I visited Gadsisar lake twice before sunrise for photography. It's a short auto ride from any hotel in town and easy to navigate.

title: Worth seeing
review: This is a lake steeped in history and giant catfish! Both are impressive. Our guide told us this amazing story about a slighted courtesan who revenged herself on the king by building a gate where she could stand so that he would have to enter below her feet...no I won't tell you the rest, ask next time you visit, it is a gem of a story!

title: The Amazing Earth !
review: Few locations have their depth with all elements. The Gadsisar Lake is one of them. Thats What I felt. I was there @ early morning, just sun had arived on earth with the golden rays.

title: "Remembering the Old Silk route "
review: A visit here takes you to olden times when large caravans on camels either coming from or en route to Gujrat and Multan sea ports . .on journeys to and from Arabic lands used to stop here for rest and entertainment.

title: A quick look is enough
review: About 3km from the city, this man-made lake was built to hold rainwater for the city.  There are several temples and shrines around the lake and facilities for boating.

title: Transported back in time...
review: Visually, Jaisalmer is definitely the Golden or honey coloured city. Whilst this is the last stop before Pakistan, it was a city that was failing and almost gone, tourism has bought it back from the brink. No where else that we visited in India, did I fully appreciate a time when travelling caravans of camels and humanity passed this way on the trade routes. The small lake of Gadi Sadar is about 3kms from the lower city and was built as a water reservoir for the city in the 14th century. We visited this area through the Tila ki Pol gate, early in the morning. The colours were stunning, and for any budding photographer, the delightful playing of colours at early morning, gave an endless opportunity for the shot of a lifetime. There is no gardens, but the beauty of this place lies in the powerful atmosphere and ability to place yourself back in time, watching the various celebrations on the lake with the reigning king watching from the royal platform and the wives from the smaller royal platform. The carvings and local history of the buildings provide many a guide with a living, and vendors along the entrance. Don't miss the vista from here to the citadel. Don't need to spend a long time, unless setting up for a once in a lifetime photo.

title: Beautiful but only if maintained a little more
review: It was a very short visit that we made here but we were lucky to see some traditional ceremony going on. It was fasting time for ladies who are going to be married so there were these women with traditional clothes carrying matkas we got a chance to click pictures and communicate with them. There is a small boat ride that you can take. The architecture is beautiful But since i m on wheelchair could not go to other parts of the lake.

title: Needs maitenance
review: Last stop on our way out of Jaisalmer. Time and poor maintenance has taken a toll on the surely once-upon-a-time great lake where camels and mortals would have quenched their thirsts and rested during long travels. Today there are some rickety pedal and row boats - not many takers. Favorite past-time of tourists now seem to be feeding bread to the fishes in the lake.

title: Lake in the Desert City..
review: This lake is situated on the outskirts of the city and bear a huge attraction of the majority tourists. A very beautiful place surrounded by varieties of temples and shrines. In the season you also may find variety of migratory birds here. Boating in the paddle boat is one of the beautiful memory of the visit.

title: Great view of sun set
review: Located middle of desert city - Jaisalmer a best place to relax with Sikara or boat rides, especially afternoon to enjoy sunset, bird watching and enjoy fresh breeze.

title: Lake with beautiful chatris
review: We visited the lake in March. It was noon but the weather was pleasant.  The beautiful chatris built on the lake shore gave it a magical appearance. One of the must see places in Jaisalmer.

title: Needs cleaning
review: Nice place but spoiled due to lack of administration and maintenance.

title: Nice Architecture, Oasis In The Desert
review: This lake has some of the best chhatris you can see across India. The Tilon Ka Gate is also a architectural masterpiece and intriguing is the story associated with it. Lake has enough amount of water to do the boating round the year and various types of boats are available there. A place worth a visit in Jaisalmer.

title: Gadsisar Sagar Lake
review: normal lake...typical old fashioned. nothing much, apart from scenes on sunset. needs cleaning, vast area...

title: beautiful and peaceful lake
review: I've been to this place in the end of February and it was so pleasant and peaceful. Worth a visit if you are in Jaisalmer.

title: Peaceful----
review: Here you feel peace,sit some time on the bank of lake,it is a small body of water ---once it was a source of drinking water for whole Jaisalmer city----over all average but do not miss a chance to see when in Jaisalmer-thanks-sss

title: Jaiselmmer city tour
review: Success of a visit here depends on the water level. Well worth stopping off if you are on your way into the centre of Jaiselmeer. Very atmospheric and relativedly quiet, although the tour buses do get here. To be seen by preference early in teh morning or at sunset.

title: not much here as lake is dry
review: nothing much to see as the lake is dry.you can see the temple and can see the carving on the walls of the temple.

title: Nice small lake once only source of water to the city
review: Small, calm place to visit. Not too well maintained but kids will enjoy. Boating also available.

title: VERY FILTHY
review: Was very diappointed to see the lake.It is not at all taken care of. The surrounding area stinks a lot. it is a shame on our part as lots of foreigners visit jaiselmer.

title: Great place for evening
review: The lake is good, there are fishes to feed, which one will enjoy. The boating is real worth enjoying during evening.

title: Feed the Catfish
review: This lake has always been of importance to Jaisalmer and is stocked with large catfish. If you arrive in the morning you can see people feeding the large fish to receive a blessing.

title: Relaxing oasis away from hustle and bustle.
review: It's a short walk to the lake, down busy streets,and then you come into this lovely quiet area of the lake. Not a lot to see there, but very pleasant and relaxing.

title: Beautiful in Sunset
review: During Sunset it looks stunning as there is a chatri in the lake and there are lots of white swans here. Its just in the town so take some pictures here if you are in town.

title: Just another spot
review: Nothing much to see except for a small boating area and an ancient temple of Lord Shiva...Also theres a puppet show in the evening that may enthuse one..

title: very nice lake
review: lake with lot of fishes but need cleanliness. The lake has become little dirty but the sunset view was very nice. Good to spend evening at lake

title: Lake gateway of the courtisane Teelon.
review: We had a nice visit with guide around the lake. The beautiful arch/gateway to the lake is known as Teelon-ki prol or the Gate of Teelon which was constructed in 19th century by a courtisane named Teelon. She had also placed a small temple of Lord Vishnu on the top of the gate, so

title: The royal lake
review: A nice open place. Boat riding on the lake was cool. Happened to see many migratory birds. there was an old man who with his musical instrument had entertained us with some folk songs too.

title: nice
review: It is a nice lake with enjoyable boating. We had a great time boating in the lake. It has some reasonable shopping too. The food stalls near the lake were also very good. The view from the stairs above the lake was beautiful and very pictures too. It's a must visit lake in Jaisalmer.

title: Good picnic spot
review: Provides both row and paddle boats - row boats and rowed by the management. Very good descent view. Also arrange for puppet show in the evening.

title: A Small Lake where one could do boating
review: Small lake where you could do boating.  This is a historical monument. The story goes that the entrance or the "pol" was built by a prostitute by name Tilon. The Raja did not this to be built by her since he would have to pass through it every time he went to the lake.  Nevertheless, Tilon built the same during the absence of the Raja and also built a Krishna statue on the top of it so that the Raja could not pull down the structure.

title: awewsome lake
review: The lake is very nice and small as well as well maintained. The boat charges is expensive, but if you go as a group, you can save some money. Went for a boat ride and it is very pleasant.

title: Pretty lake!
review: A very serene place to catch the sunset. There is boating as well. The pigeons add to the beauty. Can feed the few ducks as well!

title: Pretty as a picture!!
review: Very pretty lake with a beautiful monument right in the middle that you can climb up on... Lots of small and big fish in the lake that you can feed bread crumbs to... Its quite a sight watching them jump up... Boat rides aplenty, very scenic place... There are some pockets that are not so crowded that fill you with peace!

title: Take a boat ride
review: If you have time and nothing else to do, you can visit Gadisagar lake and enjoy a boat ride for half an hour or so...

title: Do not Visit.!
review: Nothing to see. Just a very small lake with 5-10 boats which are normally empty. Do not waste time.Normal architecture. Dirty.

title: Tranquil lake amidst history
review: A most idyllic experience, if one visits towards sunset. The sanstone structures on the embankment and middle of the lake provide a certain timelss setting. The geese and swans in the water are added attraction. Inspite of no entrance fees, we found the precincts clean, though the toilet though present, needs cleaning. At the entrance are quite a few handicraft and locally made / designed costumes and dresses for men & women that bargain hunters might find attractive.

title: sunset is beautiful
review: dont hesitate to wake up early an d make a round to the lake not from town side but from desert side. only birds and sunrise pooja from temple will be your companions. its a way to be quite and away from the town noise

title: Less maintained
review: The lake could be even more clean. The place is good however the lake was a little bit dirty with plastic lying around.

title: Nice place for kids and to spend a evening
review: Nice place for kids and to spend a evening. Boating can be done to see some ducks in the center of the lake. Nice quiet lake. I got a chance  see some migratory bids as well in the winters.

title: nice lake
review: its bit amazing to see water in desert, old stories will add spice.

title: Good place for children
review: Its probably the only place in the city with some activity for children. The boat rides are good distraction from the otherwise history and museum tours. Just pray that there is water in the lake during the visit - I heard it can dry up totally in a bad year.

title: Beautiful architecture but poor lake
review: The lake is not in its full bloom because of the scarcity of water.But the structures nearby make the area beautiful. During sunrise, the view is more promising as the sun rays lit the yellow carvings and captivate your attention. It is situated 1.5 km from railway station.

title: Serene
review: Only lake in Jaisalmer, major water source for city. You can do boating here and watch sunset and sunrise.

title: A lake in desert
review: So a lake in desert can be a site for many to see... It has a nice locale and is situated close by to the fort... Has a puppet show in evening and you can also visit the temple of Shiva whihc is situated at the lake...

title: Peaceful
review: The lake can be viewed better from the right side of the entrance. You'll see everything - lake, boats, birds and the pagodas.

title: Famous land mark of Jaisalmer city for years
review: This is one landmark known to many people at Jaisalmer across years. Not to miss boating if you have time which is operational almost until 7:00, however they may close early during winters. Nice place to see.

title: A lake in a disert
review: can't believe that there can be natural water resource in a desert city. not wel maintain, but you can enjoy boat ride... good sunset view.

title: Bad shape
review: The Gadisar Lake, about a kilometer from the fort was originally built as water reservoir for the fort.

title: Unimaginable to expect water in desert
review: Unbelievable and unimaginable to expect such a water body in the desert. Also it is so beautifully built by the rulers of yesteryear's. Man made lake with so much life in it is really wonderful. Rajasthan is magical made by such wonderful rulers who thought of their people and their future. Wonderful.

title: For best photo ops visit early morning or late afternoon
review: In order to get good photos of all the pavilions around the lake, it is necessary to visit twice - once in the morning and then return in late afternoon for the rest. The colors of the setting sun on the pavilions can be quite nice. The sun plays havoc with reflections on the water and half of the pavilions always seem to be in shade, except, of course, at noon.

title: Waste of time
review: Its a small lake, with not much water even in January, just think what would happen in May/june. You can small boat ride, nothing much to see.

title: good for those seeking relaxed sunset and may be boating
review: This place is not maintained in a way it should have been. But even then its not a bad place to visit. Don't expect too much out of this place. This place is best for a relaxed evening watching sun set, which gets dramatic with sky changing colors every 2 minutes - true for winter months.

title: Not very well maintained
review: The lake is not very clean although it has a lot of potential. The temples and the lakeshore have nice structures and the gateway, "Tilon Ka Pul' is structurally great but the overall ambiance is not very comforting

title: lake walk
review: It was our evening walk to lake from our hotel we just walked to it from the dry lake bed and due to festivals season many people with band baaja were here to submerge there idols kept at home for puja. lake is infested with fishes and people just feed them. it is fun to watch. there are chatries for good overall view of the lake.

title: Great Place to visit in Jaisalmer
review: don't miss to see Gadsisar Sagar lake. It's beauty & calmness will always stay in your mind & soul. Ancient sculptures & scenic views from the mid of the lake, just mesmerizes everyone.

title: Beautiful lake
review: This place has been neglected.its a beautiful lake.but not taken care as a tourist attraction.no boats were there to do the boating in the lake. If this type of beautiful lake was in some other country they will charge the entry fee.it was not kept neat and clean. In India we lack the tourism skill. We should go and see in the foreign countries how they promote tourism. We can not provide the basic facility to our tourists such as wash room . Gadsisar lake is the example of this.

title: Could have been great
review: Its a vast vast place. The architecture around must have been great. The setting indeed is beautiul. Just that there's absolutely no maintenance. Otherwise, this place could & would have been great.

title: Just a lake
review: Good for evening time spent around sunset. Nice scenic beauty which if maintained well can make the surroundings beautiful. right now, lot of dirt and stray cattle around the lake.

title: A place worth visiting
review: It is a place worth visiting. The "Chatris" are beautiful. The lake water could have been more clean. However, a nice place to visit.

title: Beautiful
review: A beautiful place an hour before sunset as the golden stones glow in the evening light and bats begin to wake up from their roost in the trees. People feed the catfish and musicians in the background add a nice ambience.

title: Gadisar Lake boating
review: Take a moment for self-driven boats and you would enjoy a lot. The scenic beauty is very good. We were at the evening sunset and it was awesome

title: nothing much to talk about
review: The lake is almost dry. The place is not kept clean. I had the view from far away and did not  want to go near. can be avoided,may be during this time of the year(Jan)

title: ill maintained lake with foul smell
review: it looks like wonder that in desert there is lake but it is ill maintained and has no charm. Can be avoided

title: nice lake
review: gadisar lake is a major tourist attraction in jaisalmer.it is a beautiful and peaceful place to enjoy sunset and just spend a few moments with your near and dear ones over a cup of hot tea and steaming maggi noodles

title: Boating In Desert !
review: It was quite unbelievable that there is a lake in Jaisalmer and one can have boat ride too. Simply amazing sight.

title: I wish i could give 0 rating
review: Horrible place to visit. Please dont go there if u trust my review. Avoid goinf there after sun sets because there is crowd of eveteasers which keeps paasing leud comments. Still if you want to go there kindly visit in day time when there other visitors as well.

title: clicks.. clicks..
review: great place for a break from forts and havelis. calm and quite though the water was dirty. Had great temples and museums.

title: Relaxing
review: Took a boat ride with my wife and Kid and it was very relaxing pedalling for 30 minutes. Once you are done with boating you can walk up a little where you can get a good view of the jaisalmer fort.

title: Beautiful at sunrise, good for birding
review: Very beautiful at sunrise while the men feed the catfish. Calm and a nice little desert walk around one side of the lake with lots of birds.

title: Boating option
review: Its a lake where boating can be done. Just like any other lake in India! It does look good in the night when the lights are reflected off the water

title: 5 mins visit to this place is more than enough
review: Nothing so special about this place. this only looks good in pictures, else this place is so dirty and such a tiny lake which doesnt look like a lake. You can even give this place a miss when in Jailsamer. Absolutely Ok place!

title: So so
review: We visited around late morning, the lake area was a bit dirty and smelly. It is not an extra ordinary lake. The central portion has another structure where lots of birds sit. We were lucky to see all of them fly at once :) You could manage to grab a few 'Indian' Landscape clicks. Do go, but without high hopes

title: Better maintenance is required
review: The lake had very little water. Boating is available. The place around the lake is littered with plastic waste. We also saw many sewage draining into the lake. The local administration should take some action to maintain this lake.

title: not a great place
review: this is a small lake surrounded by some structures, very dirty, there are some boating facilities but you can skip this place

title: Good scenic view
review: Visited both in morning and evening...the beauty of the place is really worth watching. It was clean all over the place..

title: Simple water body
review: It has lost its charm as water dried up . the place has not received any rain since last 2 years. Building around the lake is beautiful.

title: very small lake
review: its a lake with so less water.boating is done here.nothing spectacular about this place.

title: Boating in Jaisalmer
review: It's a small lake in Jaisalmer, created initially for water conversation, but now solely for tourism purposes.

title: Beautiful Lake
review: The lake is beautiful rainwater lake, but mismanaged and dirty. It offers boat rides and beautiful views at sunrise and sunsets.

title: Good Lake
review: you can boating in it (only when water in lake).

title: Its ok for a walk
review: We walked around it for a bit, also if you go on the top, theres a very good view of jaisalmer fort. We didn't feel the need to take the boat ride here. It will take you 5-10 minutes in a auto to get there, so just go to look around if your in Jaisalmer.

title: A stinky place...
review: its a normal lake you will find in every city minus cleanliness. Stinky Smell all around in peak season. We can easily skip visiting this place and.

title: Good place to enjoy in evening
review: this place have small lake and open for boating. good place and need maintenance. good place to hangout in evening.

title: Man made Lake
review: a lake within the city of Jaisalmer, this was constructed to preserve water for Summers.. a place to visit during the sunset and have some beautiful clicks

title: lake with scanty water
review: there is very little water in the lake; it is very badly maintained and there is garbage all around...yet, they do boating here !!!!!!

title: Enjoyed sunset and boating here
review: This is also a beautiful place and was full of people when we reached there. We hired one pedal boat for 150 rupees and did half an hour boating. This place offer good photography opportunities. We quietly sat here for around one hour.

title: Only boating spot in jaisalmer. Nothing much to explore
review: This is a lake in the enterance of the Jaisalmer City and people can hire peddle boats in the lake. There are small havelis and temples near the lake which are picturesque.

title: Neglected
review: Nothing special and seemed neglected by the authorities. No maintenance, foul smelling. Too many hawkers.

title: Oasis In Desert
review: A beautiful place with Temple on the banks of the Lake people were enjoying boat ride in the lake.A nice place to relax in the evening during sunset.

title: Well worth a look
review: The lake is a short stroll from Jaisalmer fort and, yes, there is rubbish everywhere but in the late afternoon light it is possible to ignore that. It was very photogenic around 5pm with the golden glow of the buildings reflected in the lake.

title: Good place to relax
review: We enjoyed a lot as there were ducks coming out for bread & my 15 months old son was very exicted to see them ... plus he was excited during boat ride .. .best no guide around to be a pain the rear end ... if going with Family Or as a couple please do visit you can spend some quality time out there

title: Dry and small
review: Not very well maintained. Not an must watch for a trip. just a normal lake with boating probably found in every 3rd city.

title: nice palace to see
review: Lake is beautifyl and views dfrom top are nice but tourists leave a lot of garbage and junk around, you may buy some traditional stuff ffrom here but remember the man selling habur stones.

title: Nicer than I expected
review: I didn't expect much from something called a 'tank' but I wandered down there anyway, one morning, and was very pleasantly surprised, because it's really quite a picturesque lake, surrounded by carved archways, old houses and temples, on the city side. You can do boat trips if you like. It's a nice spot for photography, and worth a walk around.

title: Monument
review: Liked the temple near the lake.

title: Nice serene place
review: Good to see it once ...  though we saw it in the evening..the place is goiod to see in the morning hours too... in the evening the lighting around the lake makes it a pleasant watch..

title: Dry. And nothing special
review: As it hardly rained in jaisalmer in 2014, this place is dry yet you have sufficient water for boating. You can skip this place if you are on a tight schedule.

title: An Average place
review: There is not much outstanding about the place esp when you have so much to see in Jaisalmer.

title: Lake stands hope of water
review: Gadisar lake is the nice lake situated outside of the city nit at a walkable distance. There is nothing special to see. Ideal time to visit it at sunrise or sunset makes memorable moments.

title: Good for the eyes to see water...
review: Water in the desert town. Till a new born is 7 years old he doesnt see rain. That is how try Jaisalmer is. Worth a visit for some time. You can spend about 30 mins or so here. Other than the lake there is nothing much to see.

title: beautiful lake
review: Lake is beautifyl and views dfrom top are nice but tourists leave a lot of garbage and junk around, you may buy some traditional stuff ffrom here but remember the man selling habur stones who says you will get yoghurt if you put the stone in milk is fake...

title: Gadsisar lake
review: Gadsisar Lake is a scenic rainwater lake surrounded by the small temples and shrines of Amar Sagar.

title: Just a lake
review: Its just a lake. Since its near to fort so can be visited there. The lake was not clean and not maintained.

title: Lovely Lake surrounded with golden sandstone ghat
review: Lake is so beautiful and it is surrounded with golden sandstone ghats. the structures around the lake give this lake a breathtaking view and the sweet sound of "Rawan Hattha" by old man takes this lake to next level. its a must visit and we had spend 2 hrs at this place.

title: Not at all maintained
review: The water was polluted with the polybags and wrappers. Although surrounding was beautiful, the poor maintenance of lake made us return from there without spending even five minutes.

title: A rather sad & dilapidated spot
review: For a land where water must be scarce, there seemed no respect for this lake.

title: soothing to see lake in desert.
review: Good to see water inTthar desert. Can be cleaner. Stop feeding bread to fish as the bread wraps were littered all around.

title: See the sun setting in lake
review: Seeing the reflection of sun in this lake is a beautiful view.

title: Talab
review: Lake would be a misnomer here, its a kind of village talab, and the water was scarce, the maintenance was very poor, and fish hardly visible in a muddy water. Appera that the administration is not bothered about the lake, people come here only by its old poplar name, Gadisar lake, theres nothing like lake here.

title: nice place
review: its a nice scenic place to visit with the lake and temples... its a nice place to visit in the evening and relax at the end of the day..... The lake has so many and huge cat fishes you must see them...

title: Good quiet place.
review: The view of the lake is nice. You can feed the fishes of the lake. if you wish. One old folk singer was singing "Jhuma Jhuma", "kesariya", song on a small tower. The folk song, trembling voice, and the folk instrument, all changed the ambiance.

title: Nothing to see
review: This was one of the biggest disappointments in Jaisalmer. When we reached there, we were trying to figure out what do we have to see here :)...can be avoided easily.

title: Nice for 10 minutes
review: Polluted lake. Buy some bread to feed the catfish. Nice for a sit down and photos about 1-2 hours before sunset.

title: lake in desert
review: Gadsisar Lake is one of the major tourist attractions of Jaisalmer. Just leave the madding crowd behind and venture towards the outskirts and you will find yourself next to the famous Gadsisar Lake. Contrary to the popular belief, it is not an oasis but a water conservation tank made around 1400 A.D. by the then maharaja of Jaisalmer, Maharwal Gadsi Singh. Can you believe this structure just outside the city walls once acted as a reservoir that controlled the entire supply of water to the arid city!

title: Must visit place
review: Lake view is excellent especially at the time of sunset. The view is simply beautiful … spell bounding when the lights are switched on. It can figure as one of the must visit places of rajasthan if it is maintained properly and kept clean.

title: Cool hangout
review: The lake is man-made and was done with the intention of providing water to the original city. Hence this is situated in the heart of Jaisalmer.

title: A serene locale
review: It is a small lake in the midst of the city,walkable from the Fort, where one can enjoy moments of peace and quiet along the perimeter of the lake or atop some of the structures that stsnd around.Boat rides are available for those interested or you can feed the ducks and fish

title: What a Nice lake in Desert
review: This is really amazing to see the lake in the desert. We wonder how this is possible to have the lake with water when there are very less rain. It is a nice location to go and relax.

title: Unexpected beauty
review: Gadisar lake was not in our original plan but since we had some spare time left after seeing the Havelis, we thought of visiting the lake. We reached there after sunset so our expectations were very low. However, we were surprised by the illuminated area, with focus lights on the entry gate. This made the yellow stone gate glitter beautifully. Also the surrounding stone structures were glowing in the night and the water was shade of very deep blue. Probably the late evening environment clubbed with the glowing golden yellow structures made us enjoy this lake much more than what we would have done in broad daylight

title: The best lake in Rajasthan
review: Considering lakes of Udaipur Gadisar lake of Jaisalmer is the best lake in Rajasthan. .don't ever forget to do boating during sunset while taking snaps of various birds ducks and natural beauty of the surrounding. .The golden fort is best seen from top of this lake only.

title: Great Sun Rise & Sun Set View.
review: Pros

title: beautiful in the evening
review: This lake is not very big but it is beautiful, we went around 4pm and the sunset was very nice. There are small boats there.

title: An evening spot....
review: I had gone to the lake once in the morning and 2nd time in the evening. It was so beautiful. It takes to back to those days of the Maharajas,,,so grand must have been their life and lifestyle....how they may have spent several evenings by this lake.

title: Beautiful lake
review: very nice place to visit in jaisalmer after the Dunes & inside fort. Try to go in early morning.

title: A must see in Jaisalmer
review: A lake in the desert, fascinating. Don't forget to ask where you can find the catfish.

title: Lake of romantic dreams
review: This man made lake has beautiful little fort built in the centre as well as one on bank amazing big catfish hovering around for food .

title: Calm visit by the lakeside
review: As the morning sun rises, the fragrance of incense from the ancient shiva temple lingers around. The beautiful lake shimmers and the architecture comes to live as a perfect setting for a classic movie.

title: Serene Beauty
review: A quiet,peaceful place with birds chirping, temple bells ringing... Beautifully built  temple of lord shiva in yellow rocks around the lake..A worthwhile place to spend  an  with a beloved....

title: Good time pass
review: I was in jaisalmer for 3 days and stayed at jasmin home..near this lake...i went there every day to feed fish with a 10 rupee per packet bread which you can buy at the entry of the lake.

title: Peace by lake
review: Peaceful place to enjoy boating with family and loved ones. Overlooking the history and royal architecture.

title: A small lake with boating options
review: Nice place to sit & relax in the evening. It is away from the hustle. There are options for boating over there. But if there is any crunch for time in your trip, please do not regret of not visiting this place.

title: a good place but.........
review: this is good 5 star place but ruin by local govt. management and as well by tourist. i feel help less the questions ask by my kids for its poor condition. but my photographs look nice in this place. ther is boating and evening time is best when some sun rays shine in the water  A lake long with some royal monuments.. Long shore with a decent sitting place covered with golden marble.. Lots of birds and fishes around.. That's a perfect set up of Gadisar lake however now comes some more realities.. Cows roaming around the place... baggers and street children across to irritate your piece of mind.. Tourist more interested in making noises and shouting around rather than enjoying the beauty and calmness.. and above all plastic bottles and packets scattered across area... What a beautiful place been wasted due to inefficient and irresponsible authorities..

title: Soothing..
review: Boating on the lake with pigeon flocking around was relaxing and soothing. Visit the lake in evening and enjoy the sunset.

title: Oasis of life in jaisalmer city
review: Gadisar lake is man made lake and its a quite big lake and a treat for photographers as one can feed catfish here and take a boat ride or can take a long walk around lake with gusts of wind blowing your worries and giving u a fresh air to enjoy a romantic walk !!!!!!!

title: Small temples and shrines
review: Once the only water supply for the city of Jaisalmer the lake (tank) is now the home to many small temples and shrines of many beliefs and religions. Worth a quick visit if in the area.

title: boating place
review: we enjoyed boating at there lot of people was there,we found lot of fishes (so large) in the pond,Lord Shiv temple also there

title: A lake with a difference
review: This was quite a surprise as it was not just a lake. This used to be the royal burial ground earlier and you get to see the chatris all around. The architecture around the place is quite nice and so is the place overall. Once can actually feed the cat fishes in the lake and view some of the giant fishes all jostling on top of each other for food.

title: Over crowded
review: The place is being over crowded and it is polluted by most tourist who abandoned lost of plastic bottles and other eatables

title: the last maharajah bathing resort
review: nice setting for an ancient  maharajah bathing resort, unfortunately the lake is scarce of water  and the facilities need maintenance,

title: Crowded but charming
review: The entry is free so it can get bit crowded. They also offer boat rides, but the lake is small to there isn't realy worth it.

title: Interesting site...
review: The lake was built in the 14th Century by Maharawal Gadsi Singh, and supplied all the water for the city until 1965.  The surrounding buildings including a Krishna Temple and a Ganeesh Temple were not built until 16th Century.   Most interesting is the main gate built by "Tillon" the favourite concubine of Gadsi Singh, so she would not be forgotten through history.  Site is worth a quick visit to see these, and the "swan" paddle boats which are hired out to go on to the lake, people feed the hundreds of catfish in the shallows.

title: Nice spot the spend the evening
review: Gadisar lake is an excellent spot to spend your evening time. As the sun goes down the structures surrounding the lake turn golden and provide an excellent view. Boating in the lake is a good idea but quite expensive keeping the boating time in mind. And please don't forget to feed the huge fishes in the lake. overall the location is calm and serene.

title: give it a miss... unless u have nothing better to do
review: give it a miss... unless u have nothing better to do... it has very little water... the boats have seen better days

title: Lovely place
review: Note to everyone (myself included), please don't expect a Pichola Lake kinda lake here. this is Jaisalmer after all.the desert. anyway this place is packed with tourist but it has a lovely view. we came here mainly to enjoy the sunset.

title: Awesome place, but very polluted
review: It' s a beautiful lake with ancient man made islands an a great  historical sight.

title: boat ride
review: Every part of Jaisalmer has a story. To know more about the entrance gate to the lake read up or hire a guide. Good place to spend a quiet evening boating or just sitting by the lake.

title: Nothing to see here
review: I was disappointed, except a few boats nothing is there and you cant go boating in the heat. Better to avoid this place or keep it low in the list.

title: Serene and beautiful
review: Very nice serene atmosphere. Visit in the evening hours and wait until sunset. Take a boat ride. Boat rides are a little costly though.. But its okay.

title: Maintenance is very poor
review: Maintenance is very poor and the lake looks like the trash. Boating is available but is not worthy. Lake was bit dry and I don't find much interesting in this lake. May be the wrong season.

title: Dont waste your time
review: Nothing great at all. Lots of fish being fed(basically over fed) by the local tourists and thats all the highlight,

title: A should visit place
review: This place is a small lake with many fishes. Some people said that the fishes were brought from somewhere else. We get to serve bread pieces to the hungry fishes. We hired a pedal boat to roam around the lake. Got a chance to watch the ducks very near.

title: Must visit place in Jaisalmer
review: Lake is located in serene atmosphere which no one wants to miss. It is a must visit place and we enjoyed the boat ride and ducks.

title: Nice lake
review: I was pleasantly surprised to see the lake brimming with water in October. The view during sunset is even more pleasant

title: waste of time
review: there is no water this place stinks. waste of time.Avoid.Few ducks are seen on the land side with some hungry fishes waitin to be fed.

title: Go for boating
review: The lake is average. Not very cleanly maintained. Boating is something that you can do in the evenings.

title: Place to be missed for sure.
review: We went to this place first prior to seeing the fort. We were very disappointed by the sight of the lake which had not only dried down but was also stinking. There is nothing much to see here and so would recoomend it strictly to skip this lake.

title: Its very dirty place.
review: Its too much dirty place and smelling so bad. ppl are going for boating there and feed fishes in lake.

title: Jaisalmer Iconic Spot
review: You need to visit this place and take a picture with the iconic stone structure. Nothing much to do here.

title: Probably the best place in Jaisalmer but been wasted heavily..
review: A lake long with some royal monuments.. Long shore with a decent sitting place covered with golden marble.. Lots of birds and fishes around.. That's a perfect set up of Gadisar lake however now comes some more realities.. Cows roaming around the place... baggers and street children across to irritate your piece of mind.. Tourist more interested in making noises and shouting around rather than enjoying the beauty and calmness.. and above all plastic bottles and packets scattered across area... What a beautiful place been wasted due to inefficient and irresponsible authorities..

title: Just a simple lake
review: Visited in the evening with lights on, didn't go too much in....crowd was almost going off but some people were coming celebrating due to Dusshera I guess

title: Nice lake
review: Could have been well maintained. It is of historical importance and have beautiful structures all around, but a little care from the government and the local people can make it more attractive.

title: Beautiful but needs some cleanliness
review: It is so pretty during the sunset. We didn't go for any kind of boating here but enjoyed the sight of a lake amidst the dessert. It was definitely a feel-good factor!

title: It's worth visiting
review: Gadisar Lake left a lasting impression on me.

title: good place to visit
review: i am sangeetha from mysore

title: very good
review: hi if you are nature lover then most visit lake in early morning

title: Poor shadow of its past
review: Badly maintained and almost being left to rot, this lake has a grand entry but what you see later is a disappointment. Wake up tourism ministry - there is a lot more which you can do!

title: Must visit
review: great fun in feeding the fish in the lake a huge no. of fish appears when you start feeding ..... also enjoyed paddle boat.... and a great view of sun set..

title: Place to relax after the day long tour of the town
review: Nice place to spent some time in evening feeding the fishes. We were not much intrested in boating so not able to comment on that but the fishes took our attention and love as well.

title: A rundown but peaceful place
review: Gadisar lake seems a pale shadow of what it must have been in the past...add to it the pathetic maintenance by the govt....however it has a serene and peaceful quality especially when there are no crowds....u can also feed the fish...

title: right...
review: firstly, that person who was standing near the entrance did not let our vehicle inside and was asking for more money. We thought that it would be better to leave and so we went away.

title: lake in the desert
review: One of the most famous lakes in Jaislamer, it is the location for many a film shoot. The place is very average and not worth a visit

title: Dirty
review: It was a dirty place with cows n dogs n filth all around. It was also very crowded and nothing great to see. We left in 15 mins.

title: Tranquil place
review: Made by Maharwal Gadsi Singh in 1400 A.D. this lake (actually a water conservation tank) is surrounded by a whole variety of temples and shrines and migratory birds.

title: NICE PLACE
review: We enjoyed boating-shopping-and having coffee-feeding fishes its a nice place with clean boats open till 9pm

title: place to be at peace
review: its just like a place where you will sit alone or with your partner and watch the sunset ... great views of abundance of cat fish fighting to have what you throw in to eat ... birds of different species on migration at different times of year ... boating facility available .. great harmony of past with present .. beautiful structures built way past preserving the golden color of the city .. everything looks golden in color and with rays of sun they are splendid sight to view ......

title: Very clean and quite place
review: Do feed the fishes in the Gadisar lake. It gives you an unusual pleasure.The lake is very clean.There is good a facility of boating in the lake.

title: Hear Hari Ram play his instrument
review: Take a ride in the lake. Feed the giant cat fish and listed to the sweet music played by  music teacher Hari Ram. You can even buy his CD.

title: Good place in jaisalmer
review: i strongly recomended to visit this place it was peacefull place you can stay alone there and test your yoga strength

title: Lake
review: Perfect to enjoy the Indian culture. It is worth to visitit and feed the fishes and this is something Indian peopledo for their Karma.

title: A Lake in the Desert
review: Thanks to our Guide who shown this Gadisar lake, it is amazing lake with nice story of Tilon a courtesan and nice place to hangout and boating.

title: Water Lake in the desert...
review: Nice to see a lake in the middle of the desert. Well maintained old structure around it gives a beautiful view and shows the importance of water that time in the desert...

title: Oasis in the  desert
review: Good to see some water after long desert.This is man made lake in Jaisalmer. Now home to thousands of oversize cat fish which thrive on feeding by torist and local people. Lake has some ancient structures. Boating is avilable at evening. Overall its nice place to spend 1/2 hours.

title: Dirty place
review: Looks good only from a distance. The place is very dirty. The artificial lake is centuries old and ought to be kept in much better shape

title: Nice place but very little water
review: From a sagar of a lake it had very less water when we went there... still makes for a good photography place during sunrise and sunset

title: Good visit
review: Nice and quiet visit to the lake, bought bread to find the catfish, there are so many of them in the lake

title: Peaceful site, but poor maintenance!
review: Lake & the surrounding area need better maintenance & feels like there is nothing much to see beyond the Jain temple.

title: A nice place to relax.
review: Gadsisar lake has many beautiful buildings surrounding it, and it would be a romantic place to go for a night stroll. The lake was low at the time of visit. I'm sure it would be much more impressive if the lake was full. One of the better attractions in Jaisalmer.

title: Well maintained
review: For a place like jaisalmer that hardly gets any lake, it is amazing to see a well maintained lake with lots of water. Children liked the feeding the fish activity.

title: Gadisar Lake in Jaisalmer, India (1 Photo)
review: Gadisar Lake is a scenic rainwater lake surrounded by the small temples and shrines in Jaisalmer, India. Jaisalmer, the 'Golden City', is located on the western area of India in the state of Rajasthan. The Gadisar Lake was constructed by the first ruler of Jaisalmer, Raja Rawal Jaisal and this man-made water reservoir, was once the only source of water in Jaisalmer.

title: One of my favourite memories of Jaisalmer
review: The temples along the lake are beautiful, but what is truly stunning is the Thar desert that begins just where the stone steps around the lake come to an abrupt halt. We walked all around the lake on a cool afternoon, ambling past the temples and then making our way over the sand. We eventually came to a rippling inlet into the lake, crossed by a bund created with large boulders. It was a magical afternoon. This is a must-visit site.

title: Can be better
review: Its Ok for visit. not  so terrific. We visited in afternoon and cannot continue boating for more than 10 min because of direct sunlight. Might be gud if visited in Evening

title: Water Body in the Desert !
review: Gadisar Lake is a scenic rainwater lake surrounded by the small temples and shrines in Jaisalmer, India. Jaisalmer, the 'Golden City', is located on the western area of India in the state of Rajasthan. The Gadisar Lake was constructed by the first ruler of Jaisalmer, Raja Rawal Jaisal and this man-made water reservoir, was once the only source of water...

title: Peaceful
review: The lake is at 10 minute walking distance from the Fort.

title: Nice lake, great views during sunset
review: A simple lake in the middle of this desert town makes one feel good. Boating is an added attraction. View during sunset with the reflections of the chhatris in the lake water is awesome. A must visit while at Jaisalmer

title: very nice
review: The lake is at 10 minute walking distance from the Fort. The Gadisar Lake was constructed by the first ruler of Jaisalmer, Raja Rawal Jaisal and this man-made water reservoir, was once the only source of water..

title: Nothing magnificient
review: looks like average village pond barring the temple and gate around the lake. these temples and gate make it on OK type sight seeing place. One good activity is that you feed fishes in the lake which my kids (age 6 and 2) enjoyed a lot!

title: Beautiful and calm
review: This is a beautiful and calm place, with less hustle than the center. Nevertheless, I would discourage looking at pictures before you go there, because you might be deceived once you're there! Most likely, late afternoon (before dawn) is the best time to go...

title: Nice place to passtime
review: Lots of fishes to feed and nice boat ride.

title: Osis in jaisalmer
review: Gadisar is one of the best place in Jaisalmer. I like it a lot. A little storage of water. And after to know a history of gadisar i come to know a value of water. And few things i dont like is local people are not caring it. They are just making is worst. But over all we enjoy a lot there and i suggest to every one to visit this.

title: Pleasing to the eye and cool even in the summer
review: An oasis in the desert. We visited the lake on a hot afternoon in mid July. We climbed on to the canopy and enjoyed the cool breeze though the town was hot and sultry. This showed the impact of environment on the weather. Another attractive destination to take pictures.

title: The lake of royal family
review: located in main city, the gadisar lake is represent the royal rajputana architect. the entrance gate has fine stone work with rajputana style. the surrounding of lake is the great rajaputna architecture. there are one cenotaphs in the center of lake. nice place for boating and to  spend a beautiful evening

title: Average
review: Average views of the lake. The place assumes historical significance and a couple of Bollywood movies (Sarfarosh) were shot here as well. That apart gives a pleasant cool air in the desert around :).

title: Average is great sometimes
review: Though the lake is like any lake/pond you might have seen, in a place like Jaisalmer the sight of water is pretty nice.

title: A place to get peace
review: amazing architect and great view provide when you get in gadsisar lake. the sound of birds make your mind fresh and gives you a good feeling. boating is available. evening time is very good when you can fed to fishes and enjoy a good view.there is one puppet show museum and you can see and buy puppet.

title: Nice to visit
review: Not something spectacular, but we enjoyed to walk around by the lake with a certain calmness and the refreshing view of water in an otherwise dessert covered city. Its also possible to rent a pedal boat and float around in the water.

title: Water Body in the Desert !
review: A sight for sore eyes  a bit of a relief from the city.they allow you to row out on your own if you are polite the architecture and buildings a round are a study..The erstwhile royals sponsored such structures to provide employment.It would be nice if the Govt did the same.
it was kind of empty lake .. ppl were sitting there and playing cards.. and they stare at us like we are aliens..

title: oasis in thar desert
review: I visit this in early morning. very peaceful area. i didn't but if you want you can boating here. i enjoy to feed bread to fish

title: Peaceful!!
review: This is not just another lake where you go boating.. It truly has a royal feeling around it with a beautiful "Dwar"" (entrance).  All around the lake you can see nice architecture. Suggest to start your day with this as you can enjoy a peaceful boating with the birds and duck with less crowd. Do not miss the Photo shoot wearing the royal  Rajasthani attire with your family . It will definitely be a very memorable photo.

title: Serene lake in the middle of the desert
review: Go in the evening, take a paddle boat and enjoy the sunset. Not to be missed are the catfish which feed on bread crumbs.

title: Must Visit Place
review: Gadisar Lake a must visit place in Jaisalmer. One can enjoy boating here. 100% from my side to this place. Right choice for Evening Picnic & best spot for Lovers.

title: Admirable history
review: The history of its making is nice and there's also a very interesting legend of Tillon ki Prol (Gate of Tillon). The only downside, as with almost every water bodies in India, is it's dirty at the shores.

title: Picture Pefect Lake Side
review: Perfect place to spend memorable evening following with Sun set. You will fall in love with the place the moment you will enter. This palace is a perfect bland of Natural & man made beauty. Boating is available here on chargeable basis. One can feed bread pieces to fishes and ducks which are the part of eco-system here. Not to miss the changing surroundings and colors while sun is setting on its natural pace. If you are a shutterbug then its gonna to be a feast to take various shots one after other and more amazing than earlier.

title: Do boating, spend an evening sitting by the lake...
