review: We went boating twice across and around the lake. It was nice, lazy time. Paddling slowly, chatting away. Go during the evening at sunset. Do the boating and find a quiet spot by the lake to sit for long till it gets dark. It feels beautiful.

title: Beautiful curiosity
review: Do not hesitate to visit this beautiful place located 15 minutes from the city (on foot). This small lake (or water supply) deserves his visit. The architecture is really beautiful, the place clean throughout and well equipped with accessible banks where you can see the Indians perform their ablutions, women feeding huge catfish ... A beautiful scene of life!

title: Beautiful
review: This was the first tourist place that we visited during our trip to Jaisalmer.. there was some crowd but well behaved people.. we took the shikara ride to the mid of the lake.. saw the sun set.. it was just serene.. one must go and visit..

title: BEST PLACE
review: This Lake was 10-15 minutes Walk from my Hotel(Mystic Jaisalmer). The Water is not Clear and Good for Boating, kind of fun. We did it for 30 minutes. Fee was around 200 for 4 seater and 100 for 2 seater for Indians. made by the king for drnking water but now it is a tourist attractiobut still its good to visit at the time of evening to see sunset view, we hired a boat to see its ........

title: A filthy, small water body. Avoidable!
review: Anyone from the northern part of India would have seen much bigger, beautiful and scenic lakes. Gadisar Lake is filthy with some ugly and repulsive fish which are in great numbers. Water is not clean. Locals feeding the fish bread is a sorry sight. We fled within 5 minutes. This one is completely avoidable.

title: AVERAGE, DIRTY: DO SEE THE CATFISH THOUGH
review: Just a average pond today. The history is worth a visit. The catfish are hugh and can be fed, do so, said to be auspicious. Frankly the visit did nothing to me.

title: Experience ok
review: We were sightseeing in jaisalmer n thought should visit gadisagar lake ,it's close to jaisalmer fort .well nothing much to do ,boating is there.but I enjoyed sitting on steps n watching few ducks over there.it was like panghat thing..maybe in summer this lake has very little water.

title: Peaceful
review: We had a great time in the lake since we were more than 10 people in the boat. Must visit. Best time to visit is in the afternoon around  4 ish in December 13

title: Good but not great
review: Feed the catfish for 20 rupees. You can hire a boat. Good views of the fort. History of the gateway is interesting. As only 5 mins out of town worth a visit.

title: Feed the Fishes
review: A well maintained lake/tank with clean water. Period architecture all around. Nice place to while away a few hours, if the place is not crowded.

title: A welcome distraction
review: Spent an hour or so here walking around the lake/reservoir. Highlight feeding the cat fish with a loaf of bread bought for 30p from too enterprising local children.

title: Nice Lake
review: In desert area if you see lake feeling good. Also few temple sinking on the mid of lake.

title: Good place to spend time !
review: We spent around half an hour. Less water these days but if you go in July , August you will be pleasantly surprised to see the big lake full of water in the desert. Off course you must know the beautiful story about this lake, our guide Guddu explained it to us and we enjoyed been there and spending time. Its bit dirty but this you see almost everywhere in India.

title: Nice place for photography n sight seeing
review: The lake is good.parking facility is there.its a nice spot for clicking pics in d structures made in between d lake.it wud be nice to feed the hungry fishes in d lake..they even feel your presence n swim on d surface of lake .the market alongside is gud.

title: Good For Boating
review: This Lake was 10-15 minutes Walk from my Hotel(Mystic Jaisalmer).

title: it's just a lake
review: I'm not sure why people rave about Gadisar lake. It is after all just a man made lake with a few nice buildings around it. A nice place to visit but not a must see.

title: avoid
review: avoid is the word with nothing but unkept boats and dirty lake to write home about . rather spend time roaming around the fort on foot and discover the main bazar.

title: Avoidable
review: No upkeep. Very dirty lake. Boating facility is there, but you would not prefer to take that adventure. Why it is a tourist spot, not understandable.

title: Peaceful and serene...
review: Spending a lots of time at the fort and desert...this lake comes as a change in your Jaisalmer trip. At the middle of the city this very easily approachable...you can spend like 45min to an hour over here.

title: So romantic!
review: We paid 300 rupees to be rowed around this magical lake and it was worth every rupee. The boy who rowed us was delightful and a calm steady rower! They won't let you row yourself as the lake has varying depths but, anyway, you will probably enjoy it more if you are rowed! The views from the middle of the lake are just gorgeous.

title: Average Place
review: Lake is there but not big. They have not maintained this place or else this would have been good place.

title: Nice to visit if there's water
review: I visited the place with Don't Complain Travel. There was unfortunately only little water due to a dry-spell (April), so it wasn't as nice as on most of the photos. But definitely worth a visit, especially with the water. I'm sure you can take amazing photos.

title: Famous Gadsisar Sagar Lake
review: I visited the Gadsisar Sagar Lake with Don't Complain Travel. It was one of the first places I saw of Jaisalmer, before I had decided to visit the city. When I was there in April, there was only little water due to a dry-spell - so the little shrines weren't standing in the lake, but actually next to it. It wasn't too impressive like that, but I definitely see the potential. Should visit again when there's more water.

title: Good for a few photos..
review: Stopped by and clicked a couple of photos, had some nice fresh tea at one of the stalls there, and did little shopping of trinkets and knick knacks.. peaceful to sit around, but nothing much to do..

title: Go at sunset
review: This place is great for its sunset views and tranquility. Renting a boat at sunset proves a great value and it is very romantic.

title: Best Boat Riding at Lake
review: An Artificial lake made by Jaisalmer King's for citizens to fullfil their demands for Drinking water. Now it's become a tourist place. Boat riding is done only here in Jaisalmer district which is famous for Desert. Lovers meet there to enjoy good times together.

title: Best Option for Boat Ride
review: An Artificial lake made by Jaisalmer King's for citizens to fullfil their demands for Drinking water. Now it's become a tourist place. Boat riding is done only here in Jaisalmer district which is famous for Desert. Lovers meet there to enjoy good times together.

title: Nice lake
review: Good lake to click photographs around and take stroll. Although some areas around the lake is not so well maintained, other areas seem to be under maintenance.

title: It's a lake...
review: A lake. With a few overpriced shops in the surrounding area. Nothing special beyond the few structures built on the water

title: Amazing in evening
review: Best time to be at the place is during sunset. One can rent a boat and can enjoy the nice view soothing view.

title: Calm place
review: beautiful place to visit in the late evenings when lights are about to start. Guides pester a lot. good place for photography.

title: Serene!!
review: An ideal place to spend your evening/morning when in Jaisalmer. the temples around are worth visiting. you can try a pedal boat or Shikara or sit at the stairs leading to the water and watch the sunset.

title: Romantic
review: I liked the boat rides available to see sunset and enjoy a quiet romantic moment friends or family both can enjoy

title: "Nice view"
review: made by the king for drnking water but now it is a tourist attractiobut still its good to visit at the time of evening to see sunset view, we hired a boat to see its ........

title: Lot of fish (mud cats)
review: great fun in feeding the fish in the lake a huge no. of fish appears when you start feeding ..... also enjoyed paddle boat.... and a great view of sun set..

title: not much to do, except boating and feeding the fish
review: one may enjoy the place during evening...and feeding the fish is most enjoyable activity, at least if you have small kids with u...

title: Pretty scenery but lots of trash
review: Nice for an hour, or so. Water is pretty funky and has a strong odor to it. Fun place just to sit and watch, but lots of urine, trash, and even worse on the stone sitting areas around the lake.

title: Very nice lake
review: The lake can be a starting point for then visiting the city. The place is nice, with some little shops, and some nice views.

title: "Amazing " Gadisar Lake in the Desert city Jaisalmet
review: It is one of the major lake in the city. It was only source of water for local peoples before 1965.It was built by Maharaja Gadsi singh.and got the name gadisar lake. The gate was built by Tilon  a prostitute from Pakistan who was courtesan in Kings palace and she was very beautiful. Now a days Gadisar lake is famous for boating and picnic spot. It is good to spent time at lake during sunset. Must watch place.

title: awesome view
review: quite cool place with super air wind.. can enjoy with family and alone if you want to piece for a moment should go there feel like a beach...

title: Fishes n Fishes!!!
review: It was built by Maharaja Gadsi singh.and got the name gadisar lake. We took some bread packets along with us to feed the fishes. You will enjoy it if have small kids with you.

title: Good place
review: Very nice place especially when you visit with a sunset, all fasades looks amazing, birds, kanoying people on water, very peacefull and quiet place not so far away from city centre .

title: Man made lake in desert - that's it !
review: Gadisar lake was on the to-do list so we did it :)

title: perfect at sunset
review: a must when visiting is to buy bread and feed the cat fish!! this is a very serene place to visit and watch all the courting couples in their brightly colored cloths, best way to get here from the fort is using a auto rickshaw

title: Not a must see, but Ok for quick stop by
review: Not a great site for tourists, except to get photo ops at the Water, Mantap etc. There is a guy who sells all sorts of odds and ends at this place- it was most interesting thing I found.

title: Good for an evening boat ride
review: The lake, like the fort can also be better maintained. However, the evening boat ride was quite relaxing whilst watch the sunset.

title: good
review: must visit after 4 pm and enjoy the boating take paddle boat as at the time of sunset  its will a great experiance

title: Peace only @ Gadsisar lake
review: If you are in Jaisalmer and do want part of crowd than go to Gadsisar lake and relax here and feel peace.It very old lake.also here you see some temple.

title: Just a boat ride
review: There is not much to do or see at Gadisar Lake....just a normal boat ride in boats that can do with better upkeep. Just about fine. Do it if you have time and want to relax for 30 mins.

title: Boating point
review: If you are in Jaisalmer and do want part of crowd than go to Gadsisar lake and relax here and feel peace.It very old lake.also here you see some temple.Evening boat riding is quite relaxing @ the sunset.

title: A calm place
review: A pretty calm place you can spend hours & hours at.  Read, click, have conversation with ur loved ones or get lost in ur thoughts.....

title: Serene surroundings
review: Firstly, this attraction should be spelt Gadsisar lake and have recommended Trip Advisor a change. It is just on the entrance to Jaisalmer and is an old rain water conservation place surrounded by tombs. It is good for some photography and there are a few tombs in the middle of the lake.

title: Good for photos
review: We visited the lake with a tour guide who explained to us the history of the lake. Without him we wouldn't have learnt much there. It was pretty to look at and made for some great photo opportunities. However it is showing some signs of decay. Wild dogs were also a problem for us. Nice views looking back on Jaisalmer though.

title: cool place
review: it is a cool place to relax , one can enjoy boat rides also

title: Visit sure but will be disappointed !
review: A visit to Gadisar lake must be made becoz it is a much talked about place of Jaisalmer. But u will b disappointed as it is not well maintained & hounds of tourist guides flock all around trying to fleece you. Architecture is worth appreciation but shows signs of decay .

title: Lovely place
review: The lake is beautiful,so is the boat ride around!Very relaxing to watch the sun rising over the stone structures and the birds gathering close to the shore!

title: A refreshing boat ride amidst the golden city
review: Its really a nice place. Water is clean the boat ride is enjoyable. Though there was less water in this winter, it was good, overall. Nice place and one of the must see places in Jaisalmer.

title: wow
review: they have lots of fish in this lake

title: beautiful place to spend a evening
review: Gadisar is Beaaaaauuitfuuulllll. very very picturesque. The settings are ideal. It is a nice place to spend a few hours in the evening, either boating of sitting by the lake side. the boating procedure is little chaotic, but okay by Indian standards. recommended for spending atleast one evening here.

title: Awesome!
review: One of the most beautiful tourist attraction of Jaisalmer.

title: A small lake in the desert
review: The place is picturesque  and boat ride could be enjoyable. We didn't do it as it is a very small lake and also lack of time.

title: Amazing Lake View...Heavenly place!
review: If you are in Jaisalmer and confused on where to go at evening, this is the perfect place for you. Very peaceful place, nice view (just checkout the snaps which I've added with this review)

title: beautiful lake
review: we just walked to the lake but didn't have time for boating. If you have time spend the evening boating and enjoying the architectural beauty of the buildings in the bank of the lake.

title: Ok type lake & may be good for people who love to do boating
review: Nothing much around but people can do boating @ 200 per person for about 30 mins. The full rowing boat cost 600 for 30 min. We did not do boating as we found the prices too high for 30 mins.

title: Suggestion
review: It's a serene beauty which is a must see during the sunset.If you want to enjoy a peaceful time in the water,this is an important place to visit.

title: Calm and peaceful
review: A wonderful place to visit in the evenings - peaceful and calm. Can spend hours here gazing at the water... a perfect way to end your trip to Jaisalmer.

title: Nice and beautiful
review: This place is just beside the fort. Very nice location and scenic beauty. The main entrance has very beautiful jari work. If u like art on stone ,must try this place.

title: You do not miss much even if you skip this
review: The lake is very dirty and water is used by local people for washing. Few boats are available for joy ride but we did not use them as we found the place not upto our expectations. You can hire dresses or Rajasthani attair and using them to take photographs.

title: Nice lake within the city
review: Not too far from the fort is the lake. probably built as a water source for the people. Nice buildings with fine rajasthani architecture can be seen. Must place for those interested in photography. People can enjoy a boat ride and can have a full view of the Fort from here.

title: Charming
review: We reached there just before sunset and enjoyed the ride in our pedal boat. Unlike the fort where you're surrounded by all thing touristy, the place was relatively clean and quiet.

title: Excellent Sunset Point
review: Brilliant view of the sunset with heritage temple and "Chhatris" which are a part of the lake. Good place for boating.

title: Good recreation
review: You should do boating to admire the beauty of the lake. Once you reach other side. You have very good view of entrance gate of lake and fort. You can have good click of landscape. Walk around lake for temples and feeding fishes.

title: Very good view in winter morning
review: In morning slanting sun rays the lake gives a magnificent view with its stone structures. However, presence of catle cleanliness is an issue. Increasing constructions around the lake is having impact on its catchment  area.

title: nice place
review: took a boat for half an hour in the evening,  the lake was beautiful and the whole place is clean, saw some beautiful birds also , nice experience

title: A must see in desert land
review: Boating facility (Paddle & rowing both)  available.....worth a visit. Can spend an hour in the middle enjoying the serene calmness around. The lake and the structures inside it present a pretty picture and some good photo opportunities

title: Go there at sunset
review: The lake is a nice last place to visit for a day to enjoy the sunset. First have look close to the main boat gate, where people feeding the catfish. If not, do it yourself. Those catfish go insanely crazy! Afterwards go to the eastern part of the lake and see the sun sinking.

title: Nice visit in the evening
review: Gadisar lake is a nice place to spend some time in the evening. There is boating available here and there are lots of catfish which catch bread pieces. People are crazily feeding them or they are crazily eating them not sure. There is a small market here where one can buy gifts and stuff for the family. Nice place to relax and do boating for 30mins. One can visit the desert cultural centre opposite run by Mr Sharma after visiting the lake. One can see that Gadisar lake is the tourist hotspot in Jaisalmer and should not be missed even if for a short time on leisurely evening.

title: beautiful but overrun by crass boat operators
review: The Gadisar lake complex is a fine piece of Rajput heritage with beautiful sculpted monuments and stunning views of the sunsets and sunrises.But it is over-populated by crass and crude boatmen who talk loud and obscene and reduce the whole experience to that of a kitschy tamasha. Discerning travellers should stick to the main complex and not waste their time in giving paatron to the foul-mouthed and badly behaved shikhara operators.

title: Peaceful Spot
review: Well worth an hour or so visit as its free to enter and you escape the rat race with views into the desert and back to the fort.

title: Visit for a pleasant sunset
review: This lake was built by King to harvest rainwater. Lake is medium sized and has well built ghaats around it. Few temples are also present. They also have kept 2 observations points to take views of lake and distant fort. They also have boating facility. Lake is clean so boating was a good entertainment. A view of sunset from boat was amazing and memorable. I'll recommend people to visit lake during sunset for beautiful view of lake and golden fort.

title: Lake in desert
review: This a small lake with boating facilities. The structures built here are beautiful. We went there in afternoon and didnt opt for boating as it was hot. best time to visit is evening or morning.

title: “Peaceful Sunset”
review: This a small lake in the deserted terrain catches an eye.

title: Busy, popular - but worth a visit
review: Gadisar Lake offers many 'typical lakeside' attractions - boat rides, fish, good views and it is worth a visit.  If you want to get away from the crowds though, you will need to walk around the lake, away from the main areas.

title: Good break from forts
review: It was a welcome break to see the lake after so many forts and havelis. The main gate is beautifully carved and the structure in the middle of the lake is beautiful. You can even feed some ugly catfish in the lake. Good place to relax.

title: Hyped!
review: Nothing Great about the lake. There is a story of a Dancer and the gate to the lake is built in her memory. That's it. No proper seating arrangement there.

title: The view from here is quite good
review: This was a surprise package. Somehow amidst all the dryness and desert it really seemed like a wonder to have a pond of water. I enjoyed the view and of course the wind which blew at the top.

title: Peaceful place
review: Stopped over at the Gadisar lake before we returned to Jodhpur by cab. Peaceful. At the Main entrance there is a dress up shop where my kids got into traditional rajasthan folk costumes and I clicked away some snaps. Came out well. There is also boating on the lake if you care to spend some 1/2 hour more at the lake.

title: For the photographs
review: The lake itself is quite simple, and is worth a visit if you want to click some beautiful pictures. The sunset and sunrise here should be much more beautiful though we never had the chance to see it. There are plenty of fishes in the large lake and you can feed them if you have some bread handy. Worth a visit if you are visiting Jaisalmer.

title: Magical Lake
review: This lake is magical after sunset. It is like an oasis right in the middle of the desert. Do try out the boating, The structures in the middle of the lake, makes it even more spectacular.

title: carry some food for Fish there
review: Yes its a nice lake......we had a shikara ride there.....300/- rs for 1/2 hour.....

title: Gadisar Lake
review: lake basically build by earlier king for the storage of water and later use for the festival and program for the royal family and boating. their are different pavilions for Kings ,queens and guests of royal family. special stage created in the lake for dancers and musicians.

title: Great lake
review: Absolutely magical place to watch the sun set. It wasn't too busy when I went there so it was much nicer to relax and take in the sheer beauty around you. I'd definitely recommend a visit here if you can spare a couple of hours.

title: Worth visiting
review: Worth visiting and spending about an hour. The lake and the structures inside it present a pretty picture and some good photo opportunities. If you are inclined, you can take a paddle boat and move around in the lake.

title: A must to see !
review: On our walk about we wandered into the grounds and saw the catfish being fed on bread being thrown in. The fish were so numerous that they were wriggling over each other in an effort to catch some. W had never before seen so many fish fighting for food.

title: Not that good
review: Not much water in this lake and not well maintained. However, the place gives you peace of mind if  you sit on its banks. Boating is available.

title: Lake in the desert!
review: Most of all I was shocked by the fishes, so called cat-fish, which you can feed by bread... But in the fact of the lake in the desert is already something interesting. On the other side of the lake there is a small temple (Shiva temple-?) which is very nice and quite. I liked to come there to have some time with myself, looking at the Fort... Very nice place!

title: A pleasant spot IF there's water!
review: It was full when we visited, and our two boys enjoyed their 30 mins on a paddle boat while we wandered around. There are several small Hindu temples worth a visit.

title: Water flowing like magic
review: 30Kms away from the Fort. Amazing Lake. Very High tradition which flows with the lake. All tourist have a dip here. its good to be here in May.

title: they must have a better arrangements there
review: well located nicely carved but maintainance is very poor so they must take cares of it and thr boats there are not running and as well there was some dirt arround

title: Awesome chill-out place!
review: Recommend for sunset photography! I was kindly invited by a person, who's house was literally above the ghats and he brought me to his own great home so that I use the best location for the shots!

title: The charm of Sun-set
review: Piece of History: It's an artifical lake built in 14th century for conservation of rain water by the then Maharaja in 14th century.

title: Overated Place
review: It is dirty, dingy, stinking and poorly maintained. It remains practically dark in the evenings as there are practically no lightings. Further there is nothing to see except for its historical importance. Should be avoided as it is a waste of time.

title: Nice desert architecture
review: The lake is no more than a big pond, but around the coast it is possible to have a look at a Jaisalmeri architecture, in particular, the gates to the lake. Everything is built from the same stone as the rest of the city. There are also boats in the lake, but I am not sure whether t's worth to paddle in the water. It's better to have a stroll around. Near the lake you can find Folklore Museum, with a very enthusiastic manager and interesting stories about the desert history and traditions.

title: Chilling place in heated Jaisalmer
review: We visited Jaisalmer in Sep and it was quite hot in afternoon. When we reached Gadisar lake it was relief form scorching sun. Beautiful lake with scenic background and few monuments in the backdrop it was best thing we could have asked for

title: Fresh feeling
review: A huge lake in the midst of the desert city is just wat you want to see .. Go for a 1 hr boating to enjoy the real beauty of this place...

title: must see during sunrise
review: we went on a chilly winter morning...but the view is amazing especially amidst the chhatris...

title: lake which is with waves in month of May
review: May is a deadly summer days in which the lake of Gadhisar is with waves . its having great view. good boating spot in sumeer also

title: Really picturesque
review: Catfishes. Huge catfishes. Lots of them too and just on the waters edge. That was the major attraction for me. We reached this place at dusk and could not do the boat ride. However, the lake and the surrounding structures are just amazing. The decoration and the carvings is brilliant. Good place to visit for photo-opportunities and boating or just chilling by the water feeding the catfish :)

title: dream place
review: this is the place where I really like to spend my time mostly at evening time. around this lake there many temples so in evening time when in temples prayer is start and you have to just sit there near the lake and enjoy the music. I am live in jaisalmer so when we have summer time I went there regularly morning time. just quite and be with nature. whenever you visit town once you go there and spent some time there.

title: COOL WATERBODY IN THE DESERT CITY
review: This is the only attraction in Jaisalmer where tourists come to see a lake ! A beautiful lake in the city of sand!

title: serene place
review: beautiful and calm lake with artistic chatris and a holy temple inside it. a huge magnificent gate called 'pol' signifies the entrance to the lake. of course there  is a story behind the construction of the gate and the temple. Jaisalmer used to get its water from this lake before now it gets it from Indira Gandhi canal. It is adorned by beautiful chatris in the center of the lake, according to the locals it used to be the summer palace for the king.

title: Beautiful place
review: This artificial lake is very beautiful. It's a windy place where you can sit, refresh yourself and take some good pics. It was great to go there and see.

title: Don't visit this place ...
review: I visited this rain water conservation lake in the afternoon.yeahhh bad time.it was monsoon,but monsoon in jaisalmer is equal to summer as well.its only 10 am and I was already sweating like hell when I entered the beautiful tillon gate with its arches. The water in the lake wasn't full,the lake seemed a bit dry to me.I didn't see those plastics.there was no boat either,its ok since I wasn't interested in doing it during this hot weather.wat I love a bout this place was their cenotaphs,the vishnu temple, and the reflection of those monument in the water.I simply love it.u can buy bread to feed those catfishs in the lake as well.I think the best time to visit this place shud be either sunrise or sunset. And during winter time I guess.this place is just a small tourist spot in jaisalmer. But don't ever come here unless u r ready to fall in love with it

title: Peaceful and beautiful
review: Don't miss the Gadisar lake with its atmosphere of an abandoned city, the giant cat-fish and the beautiful photo opportunities!

title: a very beautiful plae to relax
review: it is just amazingly beautiful. i never expected a lake like his in "the middle of the desert" and its very close - you can walk to there

title: A Little Oasis in the Desert
review: A small lake in the Desert. Certainly admirable. You can opt for a boat ride in the lake also. Adjoining buildings and architecture is traditional Jaisalmer type of Yellow Sand stone. A good visit in your Jaisalmer sightseeing.

title: Good
review: Good Place to Visit. There was a lord Shiva Temple. Do Boating if water is clean.

title: Boating in Desert
review: Loacted near 'Tillon ki Gate' in Jaisalmer . It is not an oasis but a water conservation tank made around 1400 A.D. by the then maharaja of Jaisalmer, Maharwal Gadsi Singh. Can you believe this structure just outside the city walls once acted as a reservoir that controlled the entire supply of water to the city! One temple is situated inside the comples. You can do boating there. Good time to go is in the evening. You can purchase some arts & crafts stone and metal items. The beautiful gateway that arches across the road down to the Lake was built by royal courtesan named Tillon in the end of 19th century, known as Tillon Ki prol (Gate of Tillon). Lord Vishnu's statue was installed in the year 1908 A.D. or the gate by the courtesan & declared Krishna Temple to save it from demolition by the then Maharawal.

title: Boat rides.
review: I liked going to the lake where I got to go on a small boat ride and see the sunset while on the lake side

title: Beautiful
review: This is a beautiful sight, totally unexpected and worth a visit. Do walk away from the usual touristy things and towards the quieter parts of the lake for quiet contemplation,

title: Nice Palce
review: Nice place to visit in the evening if somebody wants to have boating experience. Tilon ki Pol is also situated on the banks of the lake which is having a good background history. One of the Chhatri is located inside the lake at its centre and overall good to watch!!!!!

title: Excellent
review: The place is good and full of nature and silence. Please beware of Boat service provider becuase most of the times they will provide you defective boats just to ensure that you won't spend much time riding the boat so that they could offer the boats to other visitors and earn extra!!!!!

title: Beautiful and calm
review: One of the few places in India with cool places to sit where we were not constantly bothered by people. Two people tried to talk with us, but we relaxed here for over an hour in the cool wind and shade during the afternoon heat. It is beautiful, near the fort, and well worth a visit.

title: Lake
review: This is artificial lake build by the king of Jaisalmer to provide a source of water during old age time. The stone work is done beautifully and the carving is mindblowing to look out.

title: No maintenance.
review: It is a very small lake which is not well-maintained.Boats are available at this spot.But overall its not an interesting place.

title: Lake adorned with beautiful monuments
review: The Gadisar lake is not big, but is enchantingly beautiful. Adorned with elaborate monuments both on the lake banks as well as within the waters, this is a must-see on your Jaisalmer trip. Recommendation: Go during sunrise. Sunset is not as picturesque as the sunrise given the directions that the monuments are built...

title: Nice
review: Lake is big, boating is there but the parking is not allowed inside except for some special cases, camel vehicle is there. There's one spot little down the lake where people stand to see the view, hot sunny during this time

title: Peaceful
review: My family and me reached the lake at a time when there were very few visitors there. We liked the peace and the serenity. Although the lake wasn't full, the surrounding structures gave it a beautiful look.

title: Sunrise Heaven in Jaisalmer
review: If you’re looking for the best place to watch the sunrise in Jaisalmer, look no further (unless of course you want to go into the desert, but that then is not strictly Jaisalmer).

title: It's the desert. How big a lake did you expect?
review: The lake is small but man made in the the fourteenth century. My guide told me stories about the lake, the importance of water in the founding of the city and about an interesting princess. Without a guide there is precious little to do other than take a boat ride, the boats are open top, and the sun is scorching. The lake is worth the visit with a guide to bring the history to life. Without a guide I don't know what a traveler is going to bring away.

title: Catfish Spectacular!
review: This man-made lake was the fresh water supply for the locals up until recent years. Lots of temples around the lake and watching the catfish being feed is amazing and puts you off swimming for sure. There is also a platform to the left of the end of the entry walk where they use to practise 'suttee' - the burning of wives alive! Sobering. Worth a look.

title: a beautiful,dreamy,heavenly sunrise in jaisalmer!
review: no one should miss!  the day (eve.)we reached jaisalmer we rested.the next 1/2 day was also spent in lethargy as the long distance was travelled by us by car (1200kms in 2 days).only wondering the fort n shopping in the evening.on the very next morning i got up from the bed about 5.00 am asked dr.rajendra,sudhakar and tai to  get ready fatafat ,not to waste time in bathing and we moved at last upto somewhat 5.45am.reached gadisar lake within 10 min.there was nobody! we waited and the colorful affair started.the sky became pinkish,then turned slowly into redish and multiple sheds  and the day maharaja surya entered on the "kshitij" in a fabulous manner!on the day 18th nov.as it was a winter time we were lucky heto share this experience.we were speachless,went on snapping n snapping!this only was for about 30 in.again the climate changed sun went behind the clouds and we felt that it was a special show for us.the late comers missed the brilliant "vidhata" architacture,the reflection of it in the lake water! we were lucky!!sending some snaps.

title: Waste of time
review: Dirty, full of algae and pigeons, nothing worth noting here. Waste of time and effort this. Recommend every1 to skip it altogether and head to dunes

title: Oasis for photo enthusiasts
review: If you want to have best postcard photo from Jaisalmer, it must be the sunrise at Gadisar Lake. The offers best view of the majestic sonar fort. One can take tons of photos of the fort and the splendid gate and its reflection on water. This is a rain water conservation lake built by Maharawal Gadsi in 14th century. It was once the main source of drinking water for the entire town of Jaisalmer.

title: See the Lake at Sunset
review: The lake is gorgeous and provides a field-day for photographers. But be sure to go at sunset when the holy shrines are absolutely stunning. A 10-15 minute walk from the fort.

title: Can be skipped
review: Being from a state blessed with enough water bodies, this lake wasn't really exciting for us. It was shallow, slightly dirty and the only reason we stopped by was because it is close to the railway station, our ultimate destination. Nothing noteworthy here.

title: Calm and Serene !!
review: This is a lovely lake...Not very crowded and you get wonderful view of golden colored architectural marvels.

title: Nice lake marred by dirt
review: The old structures surrounding the lake are nice at sunset, but the lake is quite dirty and a boat-ride doesn't seem worth it.

title: Good place to watch some birds
review: Good place to have some nice pics..The lake has some submerged buildings - though you are not allowed to boat too close to them..Its an ok place - like any other lake.

title: Good Views
review: Liked the views and the traditional chhatris in the lake.

title: Worth a Miss
review: This place has a fair amount of history to it, however even the locals are not too keen to showcase this place since it is not well maintained.

title: Great for sunset
review: I went there by chance when the sun was setting. That was excellent and I had very beautiful pictures thanks to this. The place is quiet and relaxing. And saw people giving food to fishes and geese.

title: Great for some early morning photos
review: the lake was a little low when we visited in December but we were able to take some great photos. The cenotaphs reflect beautifully in the water.

title: Avoidable.
review: This is a very small and dirty lake. It is totally avoidable as its not well-maintained. There is a temple near the lake which we visited. Boating-facility is also available.

title: Calm and peaceful lake
review: A calm and peaceful lake 20 mins walk from the fort. Mostly visited by indian tourist. We did half hour paddle boat for a reasonable price. Overall a nice place to spend a few hours

title: Disappointingly Dirty Lake
review: This historic man-made lake in the desert, naturally recedes as the water evaporates. Whilst a dry lake is far less pretty than a full one, it is an act of nature. However, when the lake is almost as full of litter as it is water, this is a sad act of man. Shame.

title: I liked it but not as a lake ..
review: Liked the place because of the birds i spotted and not because of the lake .. the lake had boating facility but the water was quite dirty, i am adding the pics of some of the birds i spotted ..

title: Nice place if you like to see fishes
review: it is a small lake with lots of catfish, people feed these catfish breads, so you can see them coming to the surface.

title: Gadisar Lake
review: Its a nice lake with a temple, the views across are extremely beautiful. Its a lovely lake to sit around and see the sun setting down. Local shops outisde offer you many of the rajasthani toys and handicrafts. Its a bubbling place with tourists all around. The place is filled with people most of the time. The only drawback i saw in this place was the number of people feeding the fishes. People were gathered to see the cat-fish and were just over over over excited.

title: Please keep this lake clean
review: Insane travelers have polluted this lovely oasis in desert by throwing plastic trash all over this place.

title: dirty
review: stinking water body with hardly any water, a regular tourist trap with boating. not worth wasting ones time

title: Beauty in need of a clean
review: A wonderful door and beautiful situation spoilt by filth.  Don't think about the boats spattered with pigeon poo but enjoy the sunset on the steps to the lake.

title: MMMM.......
review: No idea what this place was about.. I needed a deeper digging into its historical and social importance..

title: poorly maintained lake
review: The lake is a total disaster. Unused bottles and plastic bags float around in the lake.It is a shame that nothing is done to preserve it.

title: Just because you are at Jaisalmer
review: The title of this review tells it all, just because you are at Jaisalmer, you can visit this place. It is a small lake, with facilities for boating. It is quite dirty, with plastic bottles and packets floating around. Street dogs are also occasional visitors here (may be because they also are at Jaisalmer). There are some nice structures around, and must have been a beauty when it was built, what a pity that it has not been maintained like that!

title: You can skip this
review: If you are on tight schedule, you can skip this. Its a small pond, with  sloppy boats for hourly/half-hourly rides. Nothing much to see.

title: An eye opener
review: The Lake is not maintained at all.To see people throwing garbage into the lake besides feeding the fish was horrendous. This could be made into such a beautiful tourist site if the government would take an interest and do something to clean it up.

title: Quiet Space Away fron the Tourist Hustle
review: A hop and a skip from the market area, the lake has a calm that will give you peace. The temple here with the local priest is also pleasant. Read about the gate before you go to capture a feel for the history of this space.

title: Best place to visit in jaisalmer
review: Really enjoyed the evening view and boating. One must visit this place as the ducks and the structure in the middle of lake is very exciting

title: mystical
review: we met Lala, the boatman at this lake and what a tour he gave us ...there are old guest houses meant for silk route travellers and summer palacein middle of lake and another temple to a side . must visit.. magical / mystical

title: Not worth the time
review: The lake area surroundings is not at all decent as there is lot of trash all over the place.I don't think it is worth the time.

title: Very picturesque lake but could be so much better with a bit of effort
review: This lake has the potential to be a really peaceful, beautiful and romantic lake. It is easy to imagine this lake full of cool, clean water in the middle of the desert, a haven of chirping birds and cooling breezes on a hot evening, some old temples and domes dotting the periphery, and you taking a boat ride soaking it all in.

title: lake in the desert
review: a king made it bcoz water was so scanty in jaiselmer , it looks so lovely in the evening u can feed ducks go for boating and see puppet show at 6 .30 and 7.10 in evenings right at the gates of gadisar, just cross the road.

title: Charming....
review: There's so much to see around Gadisar lake...so many small little monuments/temples/structures all over the place, and thus so much history too. We spent some time walking around and exploring and really loved the place. It's relatively less busy too, compared to the rest of Jaisalmer, and so enjoyable to spend time here.

title: Not a place to visit
review: Very poorly maintained and the lake is small and dirty with no beauty and its basically a waste of time to even have a look at it for 5 mins...

title: Ok. Just a dekho.
review: Well, it's just another lake. Small one. Really small. It is not as dirty as some others make it out to be - for that, nothing compares to the streets of Jaisalmer- hands down the dirtiest city I have been to. But the lake is 'manageable' dirty.

title: Nothing interesting to see here
review: There's not much here, just a very small lake with some dilapidated boats and small run down temples. We just stopped off for a few minutes while going around the city looking at the Havelis.

title: Lake in Desert
review: A beautiful lake in a desert town. Wish the Government maintained it better. These are some of the nature's surprising creations. Though a desert state yet Rajasthan is blessed with some of the most beautiful lakes in our country. The structures created in them beautify them further, A must visit in Jaisalmer.

title: Lake ahs been shrinked to a Pond
review: viewing from forst it looked like , there would have a been a huge water resource once upon a time but when we visite it . it looks like a small pond fill of garbage. the boats we ride are in terrible condition and no one seems to thinking of repairing them.

title: Can be omitted if schedule is tight
review: Well, gadisar is a small lake or rather pond you can say. the water level is very low and while boating there are strict instruction of not to venture within 30ft of the shore as the boat will get stuck due to low water levels. Theres nothing great to see in this place, if ones schedule is tight, then this place can be easily avoided. You wont miss anything. Just a place to relax. Needs more attention and upgradation as a tourist spot.

title: Boating in the lake
review: I will recommend the boating there. Cool breeze over rippling lake and bright sunshine will give you a different feel altogether .

title: Nothing really to see
review: A total disappointment. A dirty, unkempt body of water that would hardly qualify as a lake. Suffers from complete neglect and apathy of the local administration and tourist authorities of Rajasthan. A shame.

title: Nice and pleasant
review: This is a pleasant place to hang out and spend the evening. One of the must see at Jaisalmer. The lake is comparatively small in size  and has some remaining structures nearby. People can be found selling stone articles and fossils near the lake.

title: Nice place..
review: Decent place... very close to the city.. Not very clean.. The boating services may be at fault for this ....

title: water in desert
review: We went there in the morning and enjoyed the relaxed time around the water body.

title: Bad - Avoid
review: The lake is dirty and has nothing to offer for any tourist. The entry to this area is free, however there is INR 50 parking charge for your vehicle. The lake must have been a place to visit few years back. Saw a few people enjoying boat rides which really over priced.

title: Nothing great about it. Go once if you have time.
review: Go once if you have time. If you don't, nothing much to be missed. Boat rides are available. Some remainders of an ancient temple complex are there within the lake.

title: Dirty lake
review: Well there is nothing much to do or see unless one would like to go for a boating in a polluted lake strewn with plastic bottles. There is a lot of scope to improve the surroundings, build a nice walkway along the lake but right its in a very sorry state.

title: few good pictures and boating
review: Gadisar lake can be easily reached for 10 rupees shuttle from Hanuman Circle or anywhere from gadisar road in group rickshaw also known as tempo. There is paddle boating which cost 25 rupees per person for 30 minutes. The other boats are kashmiri sikhara which is 200 rupees. Kashimri sikhara is relaxing as someone rows the boat for 30 minutes. However, water is very dirty.

title: Boating and relax
review: Gadisar lake is known for the pedal boating and rowing boats for the visitors. A boat can be rented for 4-6-12 people on per hour basis. There are no motorboats in this lake, as few years ago this lake water was used for daily usage.

title: Worth a visit - beware the 'guides / touts'
review: A peaceful lake in the town with Ghats and some interesting architecture / history.

title: Nice, but why all this dirt?
review: What we will never understand is why no Indian every notices all these plastic garbage right at the sight they take you to. The lake is nice with some small temples, but how romantic is a boat ride in a dumpster??

title: Good place to spend your evening
review: If you are doing the sight seeing at the Fort in the second half.. the jaisalmer fort palace closes at 5:30 sharp and you can straight head towards Gadisar lake from the fort.. its Rs 40 by auto from the fort..

title: relaxing
review: nice way to relax.

title: Artificial lake with ghats and temple
review: We probably would have missed it, but our driver and guide brought us there and it is definitely worth the visit. You enter through a beautiful gate and then you stand at the edge of the lake next to the ghat and a cute little temple. There is a lot of history there which gives you great insight in how life has been.

title: Jaisalmer trip by Ganesham Tours & Travels India Pvt. Ltd.
review: Gadisar Lake in Jaisalemr has a amazing view. i liked it too much. Normally Jaisalmer know about it's desert but it have a very nice view of lake as well. Thanks to Ganesham Tours & Travels India Pvt. Ltd. to make this amazing trip for me.

title: Very Good
review: The lake was being used as the only source of water in medieval times-not now. It has boating facility. However, the attraction is to watch a large number of fishes trying to catch a bit of food thrown at them.

title: good lake
review: this lake is so nice & fish is many.it is important & nice view of these  thing it is nice place cap is very look. ng is very good it is important these value of the gadisar lake.the gadisar lake is view is important value of these gadisar lake

title: a nice place, but low and poor water quality at that time
review: It´s certainly a nice setting but as the water level was very low and water quality very bad which ruined the whole impression

title: A Lake in the desert
review: yes it is a lake, but a very small one. Dirty water and limited scope for boating. Well the temples look good in the evening when lights start reflecting in the water.

title: Nothing much to see
review: Worth just 5 mins and a couple of snaps ( quite contrary to the first glance, the place looks very good in snaps).

title: good place
review: this is a good place.lake is full of fishes and fishes gives us good view when we feed them.priest of temple performing pooja with sloks gives good view of indian culture.

title: dung smelling water full of overgrown catfish!
review: For a photo effect, walk to a quiet area of the lake and dump some bread to see a forest of catfish come up to grab the bread. The water was so smelly we didn't dare take a boat into it.

title: Nice
review: One of the nice attractions of jaisalmer. You can do boating, enjoy kashmiri shikara ride (shikaras seem to be from 1947 though). Nice place to hang around.

title: skip it
review: hardly a lake..it is just a pond...with (sorry to hurt sentiments...)...a huge population of ugly fishes....

title: Feeding fish...
review: Boating on this lake may not give u water riding experience... but getting a bread pocket for 10 Rs and feeding those 1000 of fishes will give you life time experience.. visit this place for feeding those fish...

title: nice place
review: Its a nice little lake...you can spend little time here. the most amazing thing to see here are the catfish, you have children selling bread to feed to the catfish and once you throw the bread in the water you should see the number of catfish. Otherwise an ok place good for a visit.

title: A not so clean lake
review: Visit to click some pictures. The monument in the island, the base drop of water and the back drop of blue sky is great setting for a nice romantic evening. Sit a bit away from the lake as it stinks and you may get bitten by mosquitoes

title: A normal looking lake that needs attention
review: The lake was average from the perspective of a photo shoot. I did not opt for the boat ride available due to time contraints.

title: So-so
review: It was nice enough to walk around. But the lake itself is very polluted. I do not recommend the boat tour. Not safe.

title: Well worth seeing
review: Pretty lake and monuments? Our guide made the trip interesting for us and the resident catfish make it a curiosity worth visiting. The temple is worth a peek as it has a lovely bull statue inside.

title: Nice to sit down and relax
review: From the Gadisar Lake you've got a beautiful view of the fort. It's nice to sit down at the stairs, watch the fort and chat with the local people.

title: mystik place
review: not touristik, just very enchanting, lovely architecture, very calm and beautiful,and huge wild hungry fishes....

title: Disappointing Experience!!
review: Of my various trips to this city, it was the first time we went to see this lake...and i so much wihed that there were no peolpe at that place...i mean people polluting the water by feeding the fish with bread....THe place is so beautiful & quiet but badly administered.No check on wht peolpe do..Surrounded by small temples on two sides & seeing sun set from the opposite side was beautiful..but the lake is dying & if we, the people don't refrain ourselves from spoiling our heritage/monuments, it's gona die sooner.

title: Need too much cleaning
review: An average experience. Yet, should visit for around 30 minutes as the place is indeed peaceful.quiet romantic place.The lake was very small and only worth having pedal boat. Lake is very dirty water inside lake. Very big fishes having hunger for food.

title: Nice but dirty
review: The building around the lake make it a good view, however the lake water itself is very dirty and filthy.

title: only source of water in old time
review: story about gadisar that how important it was in the era of scarcity of water that not for drinking but washing and other uses this was the only source.

title: The Oasis.....
review: A thought of A king to have it here A nice place to be at evening and morning.... Some good architecture around and A small museum to give you an inside history of Jaisalmer...

title: Worth a look but looks nicer in postcard
review: Its worth taking a trip down here from Jaisalmer but the place is very dirty which takes away the romanticism of it

title: Nice place to relax
review: Sit down the lake to relax, reading a book and chatting with other people around. Lovely place to go.

title: Small but nice place on bank of lake
review: This lake is very attarctive and nice.small but old type Rajasthani art piece archtect.umbrella style small constructions on bank of lake looks very beautiful.also water ride vailable on boat

title: Beautiful and serene
review: Historical place with a charming story. Must visit. Schools of cat fish on the surface of the lake being fed by the locals is an interesting site to watch.

title: Postcard location - not maintained well!!
review: You can hire a Camel chariot from the gate to the lake (very small distance) for fun, especially if you have kids with you. the architecture is good but not well maintained. The lake is beautifully constructed and a site to see but the problem is of maintenance. We have boat rides across the lake and many picturesque places around it but the lake itself is very dirty. The prime attraction here actually are the catfish which are available in large numbers and you can feed them with bread (I do nit know whether it is right to do that). But this actually defeats the beauty of the place and makes it even more filthier.

title: Nice
review: Hundreds of Catfish live in a lake. People feed them breads and it is amazing to see how they jump on it. There a few ducks as well. A short boat ride in the lake is a pleasant experience.

title: romantic , quiete , beutyfull
review: quiet romantic place. przejazdki cheap romantic boat, you can admire the temples on the water and the shore of the lake, built only to enjoy the boating. P {OLECE necessarily, because in Rajastan is a place few

title: A Visit to Gadisar Lake.
review: An average experience. Yet, should visit for around 45 minutes as the place is indeed peaceful.

title: lovely picturesque lake
review: Great for people watching,going on a boat and feeding giant catfish!!

title: Blood of life in the desert
review: See the holiday life style of Jaisalmir people. there is only one oasis in the desert here it is Gadisar Lake.

title: Overrated
review: Over rated without a doubt. The gate in front demanded some awe, thats all.

title: Beautiful by sunset
review: ...with the sun setting and sky turning pink this is a stunning way to end the day. Very peaceful, beautiful and photographic.  Get a tuk tuk from the main square in the fortress to here and he will wait for as long as you want (we took 90mins to walk around) and it was STILL only £3.

title: Not much there
review: Pretty lake, interesting story. You can paddle around in a boat, but beward because the vendors do not have much change, so you need small change. Lots of birds and a few good photos can be taken.

title: Nice to stop by
review: Nice view of architecture all around the lake; the lake is itself full of big catfish … great photo opportunities.

title: Beautiful lake, with big catfishes
review: i had the fortune to visit Gadisar Lake on Gangaur-Festival and it was awesome.

title: barely worth seeing...
review: The lake was very small and only worth seeing if you are from the desert.... the Hawelis and the Fort are much better sights!

title: if you have nothing much to do, try boating here
review: not very well maintained, but you can visit this place for taking some good pictures of buildings around lake and also do some exercise by boating using paddle boats available. Can be on second priority of things to see

title: Who says Jaisalmer is a desert
review: If you go to Gadisar Lake in Jaisalmer you will be compelled to say that "Who says Jaisalmer is a desert ". One can enjoy boating here in beautiful boats. Worth visiting if you are in Jaisalmer

title: Go for the boat ride.
review: Its another great place in Jaisalmer, do go for the boat ride. visit in the afternoon so you can see the sun set.

title: soothing
review: never thought a nondescript lake would turn out to be an amazing experience!

title: Stunning oasis
review: Sit on the steps away from the boats and watch the sunset...it is pure magic.

title: In a shabby state.
review: I was really disheartened to see the lake in shabby and bad shape. I felt sirry for 50 bucks I paid for parking at the lakeside.

title: Dirty/beautiful
review: The lake is pretty dirty, but you can still get some nice pictures, especially at sunset. There are paddle-boats for hire.

title: Unexpectedly interesting
review: A bit out of the way but definitely worth a visit for its location, siting of temples around and in the lake, and its history and relationship to the town.

title: finally an attraction not commercial
review: Finally, this is a place where you can relax as much as you want. No hassles, but you can still feel you are in India. Nice sunrise there.

title: lovely sunset
review: we went in the morning with the guide and liked it so much that we went to enjoy a sunset by the lake which was lovely.

title: Well worth a walk to see it.  Very romantic setting.
review: Pretty boats, framed by the arch in front.  There was a camel cart in front to take, if you wanted to.

title: "Historical Lake"
review: The entrance to the lake is through carved yellow stone archways spectacular and very inviting to the visiting tourists.  The board at the entrance gives a brief history of the lake, believed to have been created (man-made) in the 2nd century to serve the water needs of arid Jaisalmer town.  The lake shores abound in temples and shrines and 'chattris' which can be found in midst of the lake itself, lending it a place for meditation.   The guide informed us that during the winter months, water fowls abound in the lake.  We saw a lot of fish, (eels) which swim to the shores to feed on the bread that is given by the tourists.   A peaceful place and a must visit for those visiting Jaisalmer city.

title: Peaceful
review: Only problem is getting to the overlook. Very smelly and dirty approach.

title: Lake in a desert area!
review: This was and even today is the source of water for Jaisalmer. The pavillion in the midst of the lake was used for music rectals. The Gate (or "Pol") has an interesting history - ask a local.

title: nothing special and dirty water.
review: dirty, not maintained. nothing special about it. i would say skip jaisalmer. not sure why people recommend it so much. except for the sand dunes, there is nothing in the city

title: Lovely Lake
review: We went on a boat ride on the lake. There were many different birds .The lake is surrounded by classical Rajasthani architecture.A boat ride in the lake feels like we are in  medieval India where the only buildings are of golden glowing sandstone carved into beautiful shapes.

title: Water in sandy country
review: Strolling along the stairs looking for catfish and ducks in the morning calm is a welcome alternation to the cultural visits of Rajasthan.

title: lake
review: a trip in a self row for passing time not very cool

title: lovely tranquil and calm
review: just on the edge of jaialmer it is so calm and peaceful with tame fish withwhiskers!visit it and have a respite from all th shops shawls sand camel treks and hype sometimes in j enjoy it

title: More like a pond
review: Its a water reservoir for harvesting Rain water. Offers boating through 2 & 4 seater peddle boats and larger row boats for groups. Didn't find anything unique about it as compared to other lakes spread all over India which offer boating. There is a sign that says 'fort view' near the entrance. Don't fall for it as it takes you up a path atop which you get a view you could get from multiple other places all over jaisalmer.

title: Hope you like fish!
review: I hope you like fish as you will see a lot of them there!  You can baragin an auto [tuk tuk] ride from Gandhi Chowk for under Rs100 and there is a small walk to the lake itself. Along the walk are stall holders selling hats, and a variety of local crafts. The ghats & temples are interesting but what most people watch are the fish!  You can purchase food, usually a loaf of bread, and from a standpoint throw it into the water & see the hundreds of fish struggle to get some. They wriggle over each other & some ever climb out of the water!  It's an ugly sight!!

title: a must see
review: beautiful lake with clean water....try boating and u will love every bit of it

title: Bof!
review: Dirty and crumbling. Really guys, that's a UNESCO landmark city, clean up!!!!

title: nice for eve stroll
review: Its a nice lake and lively place with vendors playing rajasthani music. Lake has staircases all around it, so its very calming to sit on one side and watch the boating n birds and sun from the distance. If you dont like crowd, chooses the sitting place little far. View is all same from everywhere. It also makes you think about the hardship of this area for drinking water. Since my visit to these areas, I am thinking twice before wasting any water.

title: boating is excellent
review: The boating is excellent in lake. nice puppett show there. a must visit place.

title: Nice place
review: A man made lake. Has some history which the guides keep saying. Good place to do some boating n stuff. Nothing much to see. But not a bad place. Just opposite the fort so usually a spot that isnt missed. Nice place.

title: Nice Boats rides & souvenirs.
review: Nice decorated Camel wagon rides from the main road to the lake and there is a small temple as well. You can take a boat ride with pedals and spend an nice relaxed morning in the lake amongst geese and other birds. You will find old men playing playing rajasthani music. On the way back one can buy some souvenirs as memories of the trip. At the gate there is peanut vendor who sells roasted peanuts & different varieties of chikkis (sweet made from peanuts) which are very tasty & recommended.

title: Good man made lake, nice place!
review: Gadisar lake is good mad made lake. Its nice place to sit around and watch . The place is quite and beautiful . There is not much noise. There are good Bhuskar who sing melodioulsy.

title: Just ok
review: Probably a 5/10 minute visit will be good enough for this place, if you are not inclined heavily towards boating. Half-filled, so mostly neglected. My advise would be to charge some entry fee and maintain it properly.

title: beautiful
review: i quite likes the Gadisar lake,esp during sunset.I suggest you go half an hour before sunset to see both views.Although the corners of the lake needs to be cleaned.

title: Boating is good
review: Gadisar lake is very big lake and boating is good. Cat fishes are very nice

title: View of ancient time!
review: The sculpture of the entrance gate and the view was good from outside. Boats and lake not maintained.

title: Unexpectedly serene and beautiful!!
review: Although not on my list initially decided to head to this lake one evening. It turned out to be delightful as there is quiet a few activities to do here right from feeding the plethora of catfish with bread to paddling away on a boat towards the sunset. The structures located in the middle of the lake provide a composition for a beautiful painting when they are bathed in the setting orange sun's rays. Go for it and catch up with a puppet show run by a non-profit organisation on your way back (you will be guided by sign boards on your right just before  lake shore)

title: wow...
review: its a man made lake. the temple on the banks of the lake is superb. its also built in 12th century. in the evening they lit it up with lamps. its a awesome view. don't miss the boating. especially its enjoyable on a full moon night. the structures built in the lake are mesmerizing.

title: Good Boating experience
review: It's a nice boating experience. Plan a visit in the evening to view the sunset as well. The sunset point is totally dirty, but yes seeing the sunset, we dont get this option at cities, so it is nice. The boat trip is little expensive for the Shikara and affordable for the peddle boat. They charged around 75 Rs for 30 mins. I guess that will pass for being a tourist place.

title: Lots of Cat Fishes
review: The best time to visit this place is in the morning time when the sun is about to rise. It can give you excellent photos from the other side.

title: Yes we enjoyed it,
review: It is a nice place, we took evening boat ride for rs. 200 on shikara..it was nice..just ask shikara guy to stop a while on small islands and mandir.

title: Very poorly maintained
review: Water is choked with dirt and garbage.  Needs a facelift.

title: Surprisingly clean and nice
review: Given how dirty almost everything in Jaisalmer generally is, the lake was a bit of a surprise - reasonably clean with very affordable boat rides (starting from pedal boats to kashmir boats). Definitely worth a trip if you are with kids

title: Old times memories....
review: Sure that "once upon a time ....there was a lovely lake were to enjoy the buty of an oasis"

title: A Nice lake
review: Its nice to boat in evenings, you can enjoy sunset and take some really good shots.

title: Nothing Special
review: This lake is over-hyped and there is nothing special here and definitely not worth the time you spend here if you are on tight schedule. You might consider going there if you have some time to spare otherwise just give it a pass.

title: Big Lake Thats it
review: A Big lake with buildings all around. You can only view and get back to your car. Nothing great about this lake.

title: Picturesque
review: A quiet and beautiful lake with nice boat rides. Right time to visit is just about sunset when you get the right light for shooting pictures and also get to see a lot of birds.

title: Go early or late
review: Avoid the crowds by going early in the day or at sunset: the lake can be atmospheric but the busloads of tourists (indian and non) rob it of any charm it might have. If you go to the right of the portal and walk beyond the  waterfront temples, you can walk on a narrow lane which suddenly becomes very peaceful and then  leads you back to the main road so you can walk around jaisalmer and back to the Fort  avoiding the crowds.

title: Cool and Calm place even during heat of Jaisalmer
review: I loved this place as it was full of tranquility  of this placid lake. Its not huge lake but very relaxing place.

title: Beautiful boating lake
review: Enjoyed boating in the lake with nice views around, though the Swatchata could be better. Could watch ducks , crane in the lake.

title: Just a lake
review: I understand the history behind tbis artificial lake, but at the end of the day it is just an average lake.

title: Good for photography
review: The place is a decent place but could be better maintained in terms of cleanliness and beauty. But still what is there is good but should be visited it the morning or evening. Avoid visiting in the afternoon as the sun gets overheated and hot. There are plenty of composition possibilities for photography.

title: Amazing boat ride
review: We enjoyed a very nice boat ride in the lake...beautiful scenery with birds flying around and calmness around

title: Historical Lake
review: The Gadsisar talab (Lake) jaisalmer built by Raja Rawal Jaisal, is one of the most famous tourist places in Jaisalmer This historic lake is located towards the south of Jaisalmer. DOP 08.03.2019

title: Lake in Desert City
review: The Lake looks lovely in the evening or when the sun is shining bright. It is very close to the Fort and fairly approachable.

title: Was OK, few good spots for photography
review: Didn't excite much, few tepid boats on a lake. There are few pagodas on the lake where one cake take nice portrait photos..

title: Ordinary lake
review: If you are in the area, this lake is definitely a place where you can take a few minutes to take pictures. Apart from this, it is an ordinary lake, which needs to be clean and maintained.

title: Lakeview
review: Amazing view ..but its dirty everywhere no place to sit & boat ride are expensive , near to the golden fort so you can explore both place

title: Just a lake
review: I understand the history behind tbis artificial lake, but at the end of the day it is just an average lake.

title: For sun rise
review: Not one of t

title: Beautiful boating lake
review: Enjoyed boating in the lake with nice views around, though the Swatchata could be better. Could watch ducks , crane in the lake.
